brar sweets restaurant, sri, went here last night and sri definetely enjoyed the food... naan is very very good.. but have to agree brar sweets restaurant is much better an option compared to here... if you havent tried brar sweets restaurant before.. brar sweets restaurant's a must go for you...

brar sweets restaurant, sunando, sunando had bad experience twice and sunando visited brar sweets restaurant only twice. both time sunando was passing by and thought to carryout some snacks and sweets. each time one or other items were missing from sunando's bag even though sunando was charged in full. first time half pound dhoklas packet was not there. sunando did not  reported. but on  nd visit sunando ordered kachoris  with other items and when sunando came back home khachoris are missing. this is too much about the reliability. so its like you are buying the stuff you you have to cautious about the items. sunando will be not visiting brar sweets restaurant third time. all of you do not  forget to verify your items before leaving the shop.

eastern twist, angela, angela have  been twice and loved the food. angela had the veggie curry. yum. the fresh paratha bread is particularly awesome as a hangover - happy food ! angela had good service both times. alice served angela on angela's most recent trip and alice was very friendly. do not buy the drinks there  however ! the orange juice had settled so much the orange juice looked like apple juice with a bright orange ring at the bottom. to be safe  angela's partner ordered a fruit punch. a fruit punch looked fine from the outside but when my partner got to the bottom... lots of red flakes. a fruit punch was gross. otherwise  great for takeout to bring home and eat with your own beverages ! eastern twist have great hours but are closed on sundays  which is unfortunate ! angela find the prices very reasonable for such delicious  fresh fusion.

eastern twist, anna, stars  anna used to live down the street from eastern twist and would go at least once a week for eastern twist's amazing indian - style wraps. it  easy to miss walking by as eastern twist does not  look that exciting from the outside  but anna m so glad anna went in one day ! their amazing indian - style wraps are phenomenal   + definitely get a wrap and not the rice dishes... rice is good but wraps are what eastern twist is best for . anna used to get the butter chicken and the omlette  anna do not  like spicy foods so the butter chicken and the omlette were perfect and so flavourful. anna do not  think anna need to reiterate others  comments about how delicious the wrap bread is you really have to try the wrap bread to understand just take anna and other yelper  words for the wrap bread ! anna have no idea what the wrap bread is but the wrap bread is delicious. the women who work there are very nice and friendly. you do have to wait a few minutes since eastern twist make their amazing indian - style wraps on the spot  but anna did not  mind waiting since the food is so good. plus you can call in advance if you are really in a hurry. m's only issue is anna wish eastern twist had delivery.
eastern twist, tw, had the butter chicken wrap which was excellent. the spicy carrots are delicious. looking forward to trying other items on eastern twist's menu !

eastern twist, jenny, eastern twist is in my old  hood and jenny used to pop in once in a while for eastern twist's coconut noodles soup. very similar to malaysian lhaksa with rich coconut milk broth skinny yet satisfying noodles  asian herbs and boiled egg. yum. eastern twist's butter chicken wrap is really very good  as well. jenny have  had it both in their butter chicken wrap wow.. the bread was really delicious  and without - -  just eaten as a curry. both times jenny was impressed with the deep level of spice and moist chicken. jenny do find the service varies from really helpful and nice to major attitude  but eastern twist will  always make jenny's food super - kill jenny -  drive a burning metal spike through jenny's skull -  hot !

eastern twist, tara, tara have  been dining at eastern twist for the better part of three years since tara work in the area and can easily depend on consistent friendly service every time tara walk in the door. tara order the spinach chicken wrap on whole wheat and am satisfied  and very full  every time without fail. the wraps and bread are delicious and the portion size is healthy. next time you are  on your way to subway stop turn back and try eastern twist instead.

eastern twist, bleach, bleach was living on queen and love gandhi so when bleach moved in this area bleach was kinda wish gandhi has a location here  but  eastern twist fix that for bleach yeaa  !  !  ! bleach order the butter chicken on rice   xtra spicy    very good so judging from that  bleach think eastern twist's food  very good. bleach will order other things from eastern twist for sure. prices are average

eastern twist, jordan, jordan always love coming here. the food is fresh and flavourful. jordan have  always had a good experience here and am happy that eastern twist is  so close to jordan's apartment. definitely appreciating eastern twist during the cold seasons !

eastern twist, alisha, alisha walk by eastern twist all the time but never had a chance to stop in. finally the other day while running errands alisha decided to stop in and try the famous butter chicken wrap. in reading previous reviews alisha knew it would take time so alisha placed alisha's order and returned after a trip to the post office. the paratha was fresh and butter chicken was nice and hot. there are plenty of toppings and sauces to choose from but be careful because the more you add the messier it will  be. alisha m not a fan of spice so alisha steered clear of the carrots but the carrots looked delish. alisha would definitely come back and maybe ask if alisha can get rice inside the famous butter chicken wrap to soak up the sauce and hope the famous butter chicken wrap is  not as messy.

eastern twist, sherry, came here with sherry's friends after visiting casa loma. the wait was a little bit long but the food was really good. the wrap is nice sand warm and the sauce are very tasty. sherry got the bbq chicken with yogurt sauce and mango sauce. sherry's friends got the butter chicken and my friends say the butter chicken is  pretty good. but be warned  the butter chicken will get messy because of the sauce.

eastern twist, steve, steve have  been a regular customer here for a year now  and before steve move out of the neighbourhood  steve feel almost obliged to share how much steve love eastern twist. steve almost always order a spinach and chickpea wrap  which winds up being one of the taste highlights of my week. you simply wo not  find elsewhere anything like the paratha that they use to form a spinach and chickpea wrap  which winds up being one of the taste highlights of my week; the paratha that they use to form the wrap is  charred and textured like naan  but much thinner and less fluffy  yet chewier than roti. the spinach and chickpea curry within a spinach and chickpea wrap  which winds up being one of the taste highlights of my week is as good as anything you would  find at a much pricier dine - in south asian restaurant. and the other toppings are excellent  especially the achar  which gives the dish a challenging but perfect amount of heat. every other  naan wrap  disappoints in comparison. also :  the staff are some of the sweetest people in the world ! steve will  miss the staff when steve have  moved away.

eastern twist, alisha, alisha walk by eastern twist all the time but never had a chance to stop in. finally the other day while running errands alisha decided to stop in and try the famous butter chicken wrap. in reading previous reviews alisha knew it would take time so alisha placed alisha's order and returned after a trip to the post office. the paratha was fresh and butter chicken was nice and hot. there are plenty of toppings and sauces to choose from but be careful because the more you add the messier it will  be. alisha m not a fan of spice so alisha steered clear of the carrots but the carrots looked delish. alisha would definitely come back and maybe ask if alisha can get rice inside the famous butter chicken wrap to soak up the sauce and hope it is  not as messy. edited to add that rice inside the famous butter chicken wrap is the way to go ! rice inside the wrap soaks up all the delicious sauce and makes it easier to eat. never falls apart on me now.

eastern twist, reshma, tried the wrap with spinach and potato .. reshma liked the wrap with spinach and potato .. topped the wrap with spinach and potato with some achar  like indian pickles yogurt  coriander leaves and tomatoes .. yummm  :

eastern twist, cheryl, tried eastern twist for lunch today  on cheryl's sister  recommendation. had a bbq chicken wrap on a whole wheat roti paratha. added lettuce  tomato cilantro  and yogurt tamarind mango sauces. it was delicious ! had a slight kick  cheryl have wimpy tastebuds was very flavourful. cheryl found the service to be very polite and friendly  and the service was quick because there was no one else there at the time  :   would definitely recommend.

eastern twist, harrisimo, situated right on the increasingly bustling corner of bathurst and st clair lies eastern twist; but man what first looks just do not  know. eastern twist is not one for the decor  eastern twist is  more of a takeout place and it is just find the way eastern twist is because the food here is simply fantastic and while not all of eastern twist's dishes measure up to the same quality as others  most of its dishes are quite tasty and reasonably priced. the point to remember when going here is to order a  paratha  wrap rather than a dish which comes with rice. now do not  get harrisimo wrong the rice and the rice's even sexier sibling coconut rice is just fine here  but the freshly made paratha bread straight out of the over is at the top of harrisimo's list as the best wrap bread harrisimo have ever tasted. the freshly made paratha bread straight out of the over  rich in flavour and infuses palatable elements of other delectable flat breads like nan into a stretchy  chewy masterpiece which surrounds your choice of sumptuous fillings like butter chicken or various vegetable masala  in what quickly becomes a textural delight upon completion. to top it off every paratha wrap is served with very fresh standard veg like salad and tomato  and some unique options like spicy marinated carrots and your choice of a variety of amazing sauces like tamarind and hot sauce. last but not least  it is  very important to mention the absolutely gargantuan size of each paratha wrap which  to put the massive paratha wrap in ethereal terms  is roughly the size of a medium human head and feels like the massive paratha wrap weighs a good kg and a half. thankfully  the massive paratha wrap does not feel that heavy in your stomach because of the massive paratha wrap's wealth of healthy ingredients and the high quality of the ingredients used also  for those looking to get those looking to get their money  's money  worth the massive paratha wrap is often large enough to be divided into   separate meals if you are not exceptionally hungry. harrisimo would recommend the caribbean chicken if you are looking for something with meat and the potato curry if you are looking for something vegetarian. harrisimo almost exclusively get the potato curry because harrisimo think the potato curry is  not only the best tasting and most filling option on the menu  but the potato curry also happens to be the cheapest at   .  . c mon where else in toronto are you going to get a massively healthy and tasty wrap for   bucks tax included answer :  eastern twist

eastern twist, giulia, great fast food made well. eastern twist offer vegetarian options and plant - based gravy made from vegetarian options which it taste just like regular gravy. giulia's boyfriend could not  even tell it was vegeterian. giulia will definitely go back.

eastern twist, mei, came here with pretty high expectations but was slightly disappointed. eastern twist should really have     because for a wrap it is granted  eastern twist is  pretty big but still . the butter chicken wrap was very good but the spinach and chickpeas was mediocre and not really warm. there also no restaurant here but eastern twist is  definitely a quick bite place.

eastern twist, rony., visit eastern twist. eastern twist is awesome. love eastern twist's wraps ! !  ! what everyone else says is correct        and rony. m indian ! must have is the carrot pickle   spicy and flavourful add the carrot pickle to any dish ! as everyone says the wait is    -    minutes for a wrap but the paratha is made fresh and definitely worth the wait !  !  !  ! always call ahead and place ur order it is  the best way since no convenient parking nearby  :   rony. usually park in the pizza pizza but be wary obviously.

eastern twist, jeremiah, sandwiched in with a harvey  and subway  eastern twist deserves more attention from people looking for a quick snack.. or even dinner. jeremiah usually drop in for the coconut milk soup with chicken to go. a large is enough for three people to share  and for about     after tax that is  not too bad   although jeremiah usually also serve the coconut milk soup with chicken to go over fresh white rice at home  despite the coconut milk soup with chicken to go being a noodle soup. the coconut milk soup with chicken to go  tasty and fresh  coming after usually about a ten minute wait. eastern twist's wraps  which jeremiah have  had a few times  are okay  but not quite as special as the coconut milk soup with chicken to go. the staff at eastern twist are very pleasant and welcoming. even kitchen staff will greet you when you arrive and when you leave. dining space at eastern twist is pretty limited and eastern twist is  obviously intended to be a take - out place for most. jeremiah definitely recommend the coconut milk soup with chicken to go to anyone in the neigbhourhood. eastern twist have a chicken - less version as well for those looking to avoid meat. skip the rest of the typical fast food franchise places and go here.

eastern twist, emily, eastern twist is surrounded by big - name chains so it appears to get lost in the crowd. emily went in before work one day and placed emily's order of bbq chicken poutine. was told about   minutes after emily placed emily's order that it would be another    minutes. there is not  really anywhere to sit so it became an awkward situation between emily and the hostess while emily waited. there was no one else in eastern twist while emily was there. the food itself was really good and was a fairly good size. so if you are  looking for something different in fast - food eastern twist is the place to go.

eastern twist, sarah, such a gem ! one of sarah's favorite things to get for lunch is the chickpea and spinach wrap. the butter chicken one is also delicious. good idea to call in advance  as sometimes it can take   -    mins if you order in store.

eastern twist, owen, the food here was exceptional. the staff are very friendly and the food here is well made. owen had the potato chickpea wrap and the potato chickpea wrap was amazing. very very filling. prices are good and place is clean but small. would certainly go back.

eastern twist, amelia, spinach and chick pea on whole wheat naan w carrots onions mango sauce yogurt chilies  - omg did amelia just die and go to heaven   ! this ish is amazing. grab a friend to share because this wrap is a heffer. taste is outstanding. messy af. going to be dreaming of this for a while

eastern twist, kelly, small eatery with a few seats available. it was relatively quiet but kelly waited for about    mins for the food to be ready !  !  !  ! small eatery with a few seats available had just   staff and just   staff were v slow. for a  fast food  and  quick bite just   staff should definitely work faster ! kelly had the chickpea and potato butter chicken  seekh kabob minced beef spicy   poutine creamy coconut curry food was v disappointment -  curry was soaked into the noodles so there was barely any  curry soup  left. the seekh kabob beef was cold. like small eatery with a few seats available froze the seekh kabob beef and did not  heat the seekh kabob beef up enough. kelly am surprised that they have   stars reviews. toronto has much better indian fusion cuisine than this ! not recommending it !
eastern twist, anamika, nice staff  good flavours. anamika tried the chicken curry wraps  butter chicken and the veggie one too on different occassions. good amount of food for the price.
eastern twist, i, the butter chicken wrap is really good  followed closely by chickpea and other veggie wraps

eastern twist, jon, eastern twist is a great addition to the bathurst st clair area. it  nice to have a fast - food option that is not  pizza pizza or subway  or  now harvey  . eastern twist offers a diverse options  with a variety of flavourful curries and seasoned meats. when jon go to eastern twist it is  usually for a paratha wrap. jon's favourite tends to be the spicy beef wrap though the bbq chicken tikka wrap and the butter chicken wrap are both delicious too  -  -  the butter chicken is the best bet for someone who does not like things spicy. the paratha  bread  itself is absolutely scrumptious. once the bread and filling are ready  you can choose which toppings you would  like to add. these include lettuce  tomatoes  onions cilantro  and  very  spicy carrots. there are yogurt and tamarind sauces as well. beware very  spicy carrots ! very  spicy carrots are delicious  but will be too spicy for some people  tastes. the vegetarian samosa are cheap and delectable as well. everything is made to order  so you may have to wait for    or so minutes for it to be ready. you can call in an order to pick up  but jon have had mixed results describing what jon want and getting an order right. on the whole  jon love having the option of grabbing a bite here rather than the standard fast - food options nearby.

eastern twist, lola, while the concept of butter bbq chicken poutine is mouth watering butter bbq chicken poutine's execution is less than satisfactory. the butter chicken is amazing but the fries the butter chicken is  put on are thick cut and quickly become soggy.

jaipur grill, leeor, the soup  on ! the lentil soup at jaipur grill is killer. the soup has this tang to the soup that leeor love. leeor once tried to cajole the server into telling leeor what they put in the soup  and the server said the server would ask the chef  but the server flaked on leeor. anyway  leeor eventually de - constructed it. all the food leeor have  tried here is high quality. tandoori was nice as well as the curry dishes. staff is generally quite cordial and friendly and its never hard to get a table.

jaipur grille, andrei, jaipur grille is a great indian restaurant with higher than average prices. jaipur grille's grouper konkani is a reason in their grouper konkani to pay a visit. their grouper konkani  soft and tender  with delicious sauce. trimurti on queen  for instance  offers the same quality of food at a lower price point. however  if you feel like indian food you can not  go wrong with jaipur grille.

jaipur grille, mae, very nice indian food. disclosure : mae have  never been in india but ate there with people who had been . everything seemed freshly made and the spices were varied among the dishes  also not too hot for mae's taste. elegantly simple decor makes the dining room very pleasant. service was attentive but not excessively so.

jaipur grille, zahir, atmosphere was good but not great. service was great and food was very good if a little bland. even though zahir usually order mild or medium spicy at most indian restaurants  at the jaipur zahir tasted no spice in the vegetable paneer or the madras chicken. and zahir did not especially ask to have the dishes made blander. overall  a good experience which caters to the white bread palate.

jaipur grille, maddy, great indian food maddy had a greay deal about jaipur grille and have been wanting to check jaipur grille out for a while  -  and maddy finally did. the food was delicious the ambience is nice and the staff was friendly as well. food : a  appetizers : -  maddy had the dahi vaada and chaat for starters -  was good but a little disapointing -  maddy was hoping for more chaat style  -  the combination of the dahi vaada and chaat in one was a little weird. the dahi vaada and chaat would have  tasted better as separate dishes  -  kebab platter   -  the chicken tikkas were so tender and delicious ! the fish was fantastic as well. would have  been satisfied with anothe round of the platter   b entrees -  daal panchtaran  -  a mix of   yellow and orange daals -  ti was good but not my favourite entree that maddy tried. -  chicken tikka masala was very flavourful ! -  diawli special  -  the lamb dish was amazing !  ! the best indian lamb dishes maddy have ever had. maddy wish this was on jaipur grille's regular dinner menu c  dessert  - kulfi -  tasted great and the presentation was fantastic !  ! highly recommend jaipur grille for good indian food !

jaipur grill, emily, emily was actually looking forward to writing a good review for jaipur grill. the food was quite good and a step up from lot of other indian places emily have  been to. emily went out with a group of friends      vegan     meat eaters . emily were very clear about this when ordering. after were emily done emily asked for our left overs to be packed up. emily just went to eat our left overs only to find a huge piece of meat  -  beef  lamb  its brown..and some other meat rice dish mixed into emily's veg left overs. jaipur grill is really unfortunate. emily called to the apology and the apology seemed very insincere. first emily had to explain to a server the problem and a server just totally did not  understand then emily was passed off to the manager. as a vegetarian it really is upsetting to have meat mixed into your food. emily do not  think jaipur grill understands this. the manager was just giving emily some excuse that when its a large table jaipur grill always put all the left overs together. our main server was very attentive and nice  but the server that packed up our food was obviously clueless. not sure if emily will return.

jaipur grill, marcin, jaipur grill has some exquisite chicken curries. korma and vindaloo curries are one of the best you can get. also  in terms of freshly baked indian breads jaipur grill is a number one restaurant. jaipur grill have the best garlic naan marcin have ever eaten. that being said  marcin am very disappointed with jaipur grill's vegetarian dishes. cauliflower and potato curry has no sauce whatsoever  was excessively salty and the vegetables felt as if the vegetables were made of gum. marcin guess jaipur grill did not use fresh vegetables. so jaipur grill is definitely not a good place for vegetarians to go  and sadly so  as marcin think vegetarianism is a very important element of the indian cuisine. one of the waiters is very intimidating. one of the waiters never smiles and it feels like one of the waiters is angry with you. the atmosphere is not very relaxed. marcin would not go there alone. however jaipur grill might be perfect for formal occasions.

jaipur grille, david, after ordering jaipur grille several times and enjoying jaipur grille  david decided to finally check out jaipur grille in - person during summerlicious. jaipur grille was almost empty when david arrived on a friday night  and david were quickly shown to a nice table by the window. shortly after placing our order  however  a party of three and a baby were seated at the table right next to ours  -  -  despite the fact that there were many  many other empty tables in jaipur grille. now  here  what david have  struggled with. do david make this review all about our experience next to the table right next to ours  or do david focus on the food alone david have  decided to go with the former  since the staff felt it was okay to place a small infant at a table right next to another one  despite ample space in jaipur grille. david's appetizer the chicken ginger tikka  chicken breast marinated in lemon juice  crushed ginger garlic  cooked over charcoal was actually pretty good and david did enjoy it quite a bit. it was only after david would  finished eating it that a baby really started to express a baby's displeasure at being out of the house. a baby wailed for a solid half hour  and probably kept going long after david would  left . nobody at the table right next to ours made any effort to shut a baby up  and in fact  nobody at the table just started talking louder. the staff not only did not  do anything about this  but basically ignored our table for the rest of our meal. david would have  ordered another alcoholic beverage but nobody asked if david wanted another alcoholic beverage. worse still  our water stayed empty right up until it was time to pay the bill. david's main was the shrimp masala  tiger shrimp saut ed with peppers   garlic in tomato   onion masala  and david's dessert was the gulab jamun  dumplings cooked in light syrup with saffron   pistachios but because of the absolutely intolerable ambiance  david was forced to wolf the gulab jamun  dumplings cooked in light syrup with saffron   pistachios down in an attempt to get the hell out of there. david should note  however  that the shrimps were not peeled. the laziness of the chef meant that david was forced to spend a few minutes the endeavor to peel each of the shrimps  with the endeavor made all - the - more difficult by the sauce that the shrimps were soaked in. all in all  this was one of the worst  most annoying meals david have  had in a very  very long time. neither of us enjoyed our meals  since david raced through the entree and dessert portions. the fact that david paid about      for such an experience is something david wo not  forget for a long  long time.

jaipur grille, raj, raj's family hosted a party here for about    guests in the back room. raj looked at about eight places all over the gta before choosing jaipur grille. jaipur grille was more expensive for a group meal than most of the other places raj saw  but the space and layout was perfect for us so raj went with jaipur grille. turned out the price was totally worth it  -  -  most of our guests  who were south asian  were blown away by how good the food was ! most impressively  jaipur grille manages to make yummy indian food without the usual  secret ingredient  : copious amounts of oil and grease. for anyone else doing a large group event raj were very happy with the well - coordinated service and nice ambiance  and no surprise charges at the end of the night  -  -  whew !  . raj have  gone back here since a party and the food has been consistently good  and pretty affordable too . raj's faves :  the samosa chaat an appetizer  and the mango mousse.

jaipur grille, william, been going to jaipur grille for    years and the food is always great. visit was no exception. however the service has changed.... dramatically. gone are the familiar servers only to be replace by some   younger and clearly less experienced individuals. some   younger and clearly less experienced individuals felt awkward.... albeit pleasant. the biggest surprise of the night came when some   younger and clearly less experienced individuals changed into some   younger and clearly less experienced individuals's street clothes before william had finished the meal and proceeded to clear the table. overall  the experience of eating at jaipur grille felt inferior this evening.... however the food quality remains high.

jaipur grille, bund, bund will  keep it simple. bund enjoy coming here for lunch or dinner. the service is friendly and efficient. the food is delicious. jaipur grille the prices are very reasonable as well. the kebab platter is always appetizing. the combination of spices used really wake up the palate. the chefs really know what the chefs are  doing. great location and ambiance. nothing pretentious about it. simple  clean decor. the food speaks for the food.

jaipur grille, masha, jaipur grille has such a romantic and classy atmosphere which was perfect for masha's weekday evening date with masha's hubby. masha were seated right away inside the clean  simple  dim lighted dining area. several large candles were flickering along the big windows as the reflection of the flames danced around jaipur grille  creating the most cozy and sexy aura. our server was extremely friendly  chatty and efficient. our server was very helpful in helping masha choose what masha would like our server noticed masha was picky . masha had : appetizer :  dahi vada chaat      -  thin crispy lentil dumplings drowned in thick yogurt  mint and tamarind sauce. this dish was semi - sweet  a bit tart and delish ! mains : lamb korma       -  spiced lamb in an almond and cinnamon curry sauce. lamb korma       -  spiced lamb in an almond and cinnamon curry sauce was cooked to perfection and just melted in masha's mouth ! lamb korma       -  spiced lamb in an almond and cinnamon curry sauce could have  been spicier but lamb korma       -  spiced lamb in an almond and cinnamon curry sauce defiantly was awesome. there were strong notes of cardamom which was not  a big deal but they could have  toned down a bit. paneer makhani       -  small tender pieces of cubed cottage cheese drowned in a fenugreek tomato curry sauce and thick butter. masha thought paneer makhani       -  small tender pieces of cubed cottage cheese drowned in a fenugreek tomato curry sauce and thick butter would be too greasy but paneer makhani       -  small tender pieces of cubed cottage cheese drowned in a fenugreek tomato curry sauce and thick butter was not . paneer makhani       -  small tender pieces of cubed cottage cheese drowned in a fenugreek tomato curry sauce and thick butter was masha's favorite dish and the flavors were bursting ! naan    . -  the naan bread here was fluffly  a bit stretchy  and super fresh. the naan bread here really went well with our mains. dessert drinks :  masha tried the mango mousse     or    which had a thick creamy whipped cream texture bursting with fresh mango flavor without being too sweet. the mango mousse     or    which had a thick creamy whipped cream texture bursting with fresh mango flavor without being too sweet was pretty tiny; the mango mousse     or    which had a thick creamy whipped cream texture bursting with fresh mango flavor without being too sweet could have  been bigger especially for the price. jaipur grille had a nice bar menu but masha opted for the lassi      and masala chai     . the lassi was semi - sweet  chilled and creamy with yogurt  and masala chai was super fresh and hot ! masha was afraid jaipur grille would  give masha microwaved stuff like other indian restaurants. microwaved tea =  poison tea ! masha highly recommend jaipur grille ! the service is amazing  the ambiance is perfect  and the food is cooked well and tasty. jaipur grille's portions are good and the prices are a bit high compared to other places but jaipur grille do jaipur grille's stuff well here. also  masha look forward to coming back for lunch; jaipur grille have a nice lunch menu that masha think may be worth checking out.

jaipur grill, selene, selene generally really do not  like most indian food. selene find most indian food super greasy way too heavy on the sauce the pakoras are normally done wrong and all the veg dishes have paneer or ghee  making it super hard as a vegan. the food at jaipur grill  however  was really good. the pappadums were spicy  as the pappadums should be . jaipur grill had a good number of vegan dishes  though selene get the feeling that jaipur grill did not  know what vegan was so selene m not      positive there was not  some ghee in there... three of us split an order of pakora  not the best selene have  had  but quite nice   an eggplant medallion dish in sweet tomato sauce  mixed veggies and cashews in a green sauce  and a spicy yellow lentil dish with rice. the food was great  tons of flavour  not greasy. our other friend got an okra dish  which was really good  though a bit on the salty side. service was amazing. jaipur grill were very attentive and friendly. decor was beautiful and the lighting was perfect. some things that could be better... selene do really hate that jaipur grill only have white rice. come on  get with white rice ! if you do not  want to do brown rice  offer wild rice or something ! for some reason jaipur grill gave us all our leftovers wrapped in one bag. very weird  like selene obv do not  all live together. selene think that jaipur grill could have asked if jaipur grill were unsure. and worst  as emily m. said  jaipur grill mixed all our leftovers together  meaning emily m. got meat in emily m.'s veg dish ! not cool ! selene m still not super into indian food but the next time selene am in the mood for some  selene will  check out jaipur grill again.

jaipur grille, chantalle, chantalle used to get take - out from jaipur grille on a regular basis ages ago  but after a change in management  over a year ago  maybe longer... chantalle just did not  feel the jg love. chantalle tried other places but mostly just went without indian food. chantalle tried the yellow chilli a few weeks back  thinking jaipur grille would fill the void. not even close ! so tonight  chantalle ordered takeout from jaipur grille and chantalle could not  be happier !  ! it is delicious and fresh and yay ! chantalle will definitely go back. of course  the butter chicken is a must  -  excellent ! the naan was fresh and light and the palau rice was good. papadums were good and overall  chantalle are very pleased with jg and thank you for a delicious meal !

jaipur grille, constantine, constantine have  been to jaipur grille a few times  and constantine m not impressed. the food is overpriced  is not  that great  and the portions tend to be quite small for the meat dishes. for example the chicken korma is      and is about the size of an appetizer. constantine had the paneer makhani  which is a vegetarian dish  and the portion was more generous than the meat dishes. however  although the paneer makhani  which is a vegetarian dish was good  the sauce tasted sort of like canned tomato soup with some indian spices. the only good constantine can really say about jaipur grille is that the naan is tasty  and that jaipur grille is physically very nice. the staff is also nice  although service can sometimes be slow.

jaipur grille, kris, stopped by jaipur grille for summerlicious      -  jaipur grille's menu was inexpensive for a   - course indian lunch. kris's selections were as follows : app :  onion bhajis entree : lamb rogan josh dessert : gulab jamun each course was very well made. onion bhajis were very crispy and were accompanied by a mild sauce. lamb rogan josh came with garlic naan  freshly baked. gulab jamun was also delicious  and kris's friend described gulab jamun as a fried cinnamon timbit covered in syrup. mmm. service was unobjectionable  and the restaurant ambience was decent. stars given solely for doing nothing wrong. well done.

jaipur grill, sonia, wow what a mouthwatering experience. sonia went for summerlicius and sonia ordered the chaat tandoori wings  chicken  lamb  glaub jamun. every dish was cooked to perfection the service is friendly and jaipur grill is clean. looking forward to coming back !  !

jaipur grille, ehsan, the interior of jaipur grille  is tastefully decorated with really simple yet elegant motifs. the tranquil atmosphere and aroma of spices escaping the kitchen made ehsan happy just to sit by the window and sip on ehsan's mango lassi. the appetizers; dahi bhalla chaat  samosa and tandoori wings were all fresh tasting. tandoori wings and mint sauce pairing was especially good. ehsan found dahi bhalla pretty unusual and ehsan can not  really say ehsan enjoyed dahi bhalla. main course dishes lacked variety. main course dishes were     identical  which took away from the fun of sharing. all dishes came with a side of rice  saag paneer and raita. the warm and fluffy naan came in generous portions. the saag paneer side was ehsan's favourite part of all the dishes ehsan tasted. the saag paneer side had actual pieces of cheese and the saag paneer side was much more flavourful than the typical runny stuff you get elsewhere. the rogan josh lamb was tasty but a bit too heavily salted for ehsan. the fresh mango lassis and golab jamun soft spongy dumpling infused with warm syrup and saffron  really hit the spot after the big meal. the food  on the whole  was less than spectacular but the friendly and attentive servers along with the great atmosphere turned it into a good experience.

jaipur grille, sylvia, food : zero stars    tiny pieces of chicken and even smaller potato that could fit into palm of hand ! ! !  !   service : zero stars paid     for lunch special : vindaloo chicken  chicken should be more than   pieces of cut up chicken  each smaller than a timbit  and   potato size of   thumbnails  inside small soup container with mostly liquid watery gravy  -  flavour was not  even absorbed   biryani  big rectangular container maybe  . small bowls  and naan  partially dried   tiny salad  tiny container for sauces . the chicken container lid melted off  so sylvia lost gravy - liquid but there were only   pieces of chicken and   piece of potato that could fit into the tiny salad container for  sauces  meaning  sauce size . if sylvia can figure out how to attach a pic sylvia will of the containers but sylvia was so hungry sylvia did not  think of taking pics of the food ! the server was utterly rude with crossed arms asked why sylvia did not  call first and sylvia told the server that sylvia tried but nobody answered and then the server called out to a guy to investigate the phone issue with sylvia instead of just tactfully handling sylvia's food order. sylvia told the server that if it was trouble sylvia did not  need to order lunch sylvia was the only customer . when the food was ready the server shouted to sylvia to get the food the server did not  even bother to walk the food over to sylvia from around the wall dining area and sylvia was sitting on a chair by the entrance sylvia asked for the nice guy that sylvia asked to look into the phone earlier  and the server pretended the server did not  know which guy sylvia was talking about when the entire time there was  a guy and there was nobody else and no other customers the entire time. sylvia decided to tell the server why the server was a jerk and the server apologized only because sylvia think the server thought the server would  get into trouble  but sadly sylvia did not  know how bad the meal was going to be or sylvia would have demanded a refund and marched right out. sylvia will not return. if it is  called carbs  rice and naan  than sure  be honest and rename it carbs and price it accordingly and do not call it chicken when there is  barely chicken let a lone not even vindaloo. sylvia always go to banjara on eglinton for spectacular vindaloo chicken. they can alter the salt and spice level and you do see actual chicken pieces. they do not  even expect you to call although they have tons of takeout orders and sylvia have never been greeted with cross arms.

jaipur grill, henry, stars for service   stars for food henry would  heard good things about jaipur grill so henry made reservations for winterlicious and dragged family and friends to try jaipur grill out. the interior :  thankfully does not  reek like banjara et al. the interior  polished but forgetfully bland. soothing ambiance. henry were the first ones there that afternoon and it did not  get busy for saturday lunch. the service : very attentive  just saw one waiter   friendly and accommodating. henry walked in at  pm  and were there till   pm ! the food :  was a tad disappointing. mint chutney lacked mintiness. the dahi bhalla chaat  rice crisps in yogurt with sweet and tangy sauces  lacked sweet chutney. the tandoori wings  really looked forward to the tandoori wings  smelled like fowl. not good. the rogan josh was ok. not terrible but nothing too praiseworthy either since the rogan josh lacked fennel. the saag paneer lacked garlic and punch. the saag paneer was ok. the fish curry that henry had was delicious :  lightly sweet because of the onion puree and coconut and not because of artificial sweetener. the vegetable biryani won high praises from the vegetable biryani's consumer. the naan was really fresh. the mango mousse was quite good  not too sweet but still mangoey. the gulab jamon also won praise from the gulab jamon's consumer  but their consumer has    sweet teeth so the gulab jamon is  no tall order ! henry's taste buds were not  too impressed. it  a one time deal for now.

jaipur grille, terry, terry have been here several times for lunch. it is great if you work in the area and need a nice but not expensive place to bring a co - worker or client. for that matter  terry sometimes will go alone for a lunch treat  as it is  never full and terry am always in - and - out of there in    minutes or so. jaipur grille have an outdoor patio  on the street  which is nice on warm days. the lunch items range from    to      plus tax and tip  and are served with your choice of rice or naan bread. terry usually get the saag lamb  which is lamb masala cooked with baby spinach  and the naan. the saag lamb  which is lamb masala cooked with baby spinach  and the naan is very tasty  with just enough spiciness for terry  for those with  spicier appetites terry have  heard the vindaloo is great  and naan bread is soft and delicious. jaipur grille obviously have a dinner menu but terry have not  tried a dinner menu. jaipur grille also have a weekend brunch weekends    : am  -    :    pm with a somewhat odd mix of indian dishes and items like  grilled chicken and cheese sandwich all under     .

jaipur grill, nisha, nisha have found the best naan in town people ! nisha love the best naan in town people and made my peace with the fact that nisha could never find the best naan in town people here  until... nisha found jaipur grill ! the best naan in town people is so good and nisha have  tried the best naan in town people along with the butter chicken which is good  the palak paneer which is amazing and a lamb dish whose name nisha m forgetting. but trust me  jaipur grill is one of the better indian restaurants and nisha find nisha hardly disappointed with the choices. jaipur grill also have the best mango lassi in town ; the service is great and the staff goes out of the staff's way even if you order take out. would definitely recommend jaipur grill !

jaipur grille, aliyah, ordered the chicken biryani and dahi vada and chaat. aliyah was surprised that aliyah got biryani instead of the chicken tikka masala aliyah thought aliyah had ordered  -  not sure if it was an error on the just eat website or if aliyah clicked on it myself. anyway  aliyah love biryani and was excited to eat biryani. the chicken biryani was not very good at all. aliyah took out a plate of food and then had to go back to the kitchen because there was not  any chicken in a plate of food... aliyah actually had to stir the food around to hunt for meat. there were a few chunks of chicken in there but definitely not enough compared to the amount of rice. the rice rice was spicy but otherwise lacked flavour  same with the chicken which was a little dry. the dahi vada chaat new to me was interesting slightly sweet and cake - like in a thick creamy sauce. aliyah liked chaat better than the chicken biryani but chaat was nothing special and aliyah would not  order chaat again.

jaipur grille, chandni, chandni got the food delivered for dinner and it turned out to be the horrible experience. the worst veg. biryani and paneer makhani chandni have ever had in chandni's life. the vegetables in biryani tasted so bad and the rice was also not perfect. never ever ever in chandni's life.

jaipur grille, sandra, sandra had a surprisingly poor meal here just after christmas      . sandra ordered vegetable curry as sandra's main course. the vegetables were soggy   pedestrian    seemed to have come out of a package  frozen. the sauce was generic  as though supermarket curry powder had simply been stirred into tomato sauce. the samosa were ok  but not very flavourful. sandra wondered if the ownership   or chef had changed since the last time sandra had eaten here  several years ago  when the food had been first - rate.

jaipur grille, lauren, that  some tasty indian right there. chicken tikka masala  like butter chicken but with some heat and sweet peppers mutter paneer  cheese chunks with peas in tomato onion sauce  and daal panchratan  soft yellow lentils spiced with tumeric ..... all good baby. the naan here is also exceptional... the naan here is  got just the right amount of chew. you could say the naan here is ... second to naan ... k thanks bye  :

jaipur grille, paul, paul eat indian food not infrequently. for paul it is essential that jaipur grille listen when you place an order  especially when it is regarding the degree of heat  spice in the food. when paul placed our order over the phone paul specifically said please make our order very very very mild . paul picked up the food and took the food home for a birthday celebration. the food was a large amount of food. the food was so hot paul could barely eat the food. while paul could appreciate that the flavours were very good what is  the point if the heat prevents you from enjoying the food

jaipur grille, eric, the kebabs taste great. jaipur grille have a buffet lunch on wednesdays with a decent selection of foods all of which was hot and just as good as jaipur grille's normal lunch fare with lots of meat. the buffet  mango mousse is ice cream frozen into a bowl. despite the clean appearance of the customer area of jaipur grille  apparently jaipur grille do not  have very good results from toronto health inspections which makes eric wary of returning. wifi password is           . parking is easy to find on nearby duplex ave  or paid street parking on yonge st.

jaipur grille, hari, has to be jaipur grille. after moving to new york from india   years back  hari have been craving for authentic indian food ever since. hari stumbled upon jaipur grille on hari's last visit to toronto. and jaipur grille was just perfect. great food  great atmosphere and excellent service. do not miss jaipur grille's chicken tikka masala  for meat eaters   subzi malai methi vegetarian  and mango mousse.

jaipur grill, michele, an overall disappointing experience started when michele walked in the door and waited several minutes before anyone acknowledged michele's presence. when a server did appear  a server just suggested to michele and another person waiting that michele just take a seat  -  but did not ask any questions to determine what michele were waiting for. after getting seated  michele had to call a server over to take our order after several minutes. then michele had to wait quite a while to get the first drink michele's friend ordered. after about    minutes  michele was informed that jaipur grill were out of kingfisher beer  and suggested michele order something else. when the food arrived  the experienced sadly did not improve. everything was oversalted and tasted much the same. michele ordered chicken saag  goan shrimp  aloo gobi  rice and naan. the shrimp was stringy. the meal was supposed to include raita but michele were informed raita had run out. michele barely touched the meal as the meal just was not  very good. needless to say  michele will not be back.

jaipur grille, serene, one of the nicer indian restaurants in the area. been there a couple of times now. the inside of jaipur grille. is neat clean and well spaced so tables chairs and people do not seem cramped. serene were seated  immediately and food was served soon after serene ordered. didnt have to wait long. things serene liked about the food were that the presentation was neat  food was served hot and the taste was quilte pleasant if a little on the mild side. the seesh kebab was spicy and very well made serene ordered the daal  yellow lentils  and serene felt on that one curry dish that serene had the quantity could have been better. serene enjoyed the evening here. if you are looking for a nice quiet place to have a tasty dinner in a very pleasant setting  then jaipur grille. is a nice quiet place to have a tasty dinner in a very pleasant setting !

jaipur grille, adam, adam came to jaipur grille today on a whom since adam seen jaipur grille across the street from st. louis. there were many well dressed individuals here and jaipur grille was quite upscale. the service was excellent and the owner himself even came out and introduced the owner himself ! adam m not that familiar with indian food but they recommended adam a couple dishes that turned out excellent. adam can recommend a couple dishes that turned out excellent. the portions looked big but when adam was done adam was craving more so adam opted for desert as well. the experience was very authentic and adam can not  wait to come back. the owner himself told adam they have  been around for    years and have a second location somewhere around waterfront adam can not  remember.. anyways  check jaipur grille out.. jaipur grille looks like a great place for after work.

jaipur grill, jennie, ordered delivery tonight  -  -  was craving some spices and quite enjoyed everything jennie ordered. the food for   can feed   for     plus taxes and tip so jennie would  start with plus taxes and tip when ordering delivery or take - out. jennie had the lentil soup  -  -  very bright flavors  with a lemony tang and poppy seeds   !   ! ; aloo gobi  - -  very mushy cauliflower was not a hit with jennie's cauliflower loving kid  unfortunately; butter chicken  -  -  great curry flavor that was a bit sweet lamb saag  -  -  fairly tender lamb meat but jennie still got out a knife to cut fairly tender lamb meat; raita and of course  the basmati was fine and the naan bread was fresh. everything came hot and piping within    minutes of ordering and jennie appreciated that tremendously. overall if jennie need another indian food fix jennie would  order again from here. whenever jennie eat indian food from queen street jennie feel like jennie's pores are saturated with all the greasiness or richness of all the flavors. jaipur grill is definitely no queen street.

jaipur grille, jay, jay got the dinner for   platter with an additional entree for a party of  . there was more than enough food to share between a party of. jay enjoyed the flavours of the dinner much more than the standard indian buffet style. service was quick and attentive. the seekh kabob and veg pakora appetizers were made to order and fresh. seekh kabob were full of flavour and the veg pakora were crispy with a delightful spicy mint sauce to complement veg pakora. jay enjoyed the lamb korma and chicken makhani entrees. the lamb korma and chicken makhani entrees had lots of flavour and the right amount of spices but was creamy and sweet. the beef vindaloo had quite the spicy kick to the beef vindaloo and the beef vindaloo was soft and tender. the grouper needed a bit more seasoning but the grouper was still good.

jaipur grill, david, when the temperature is  -    outside  david figure it is  a good time to order some spicy indian food. david have  lived in the area for a while now but david would  never tried jaipur grill. david m a huge fan of indian food so expectations were high. first of all  david should mention that the food arrived extremely fast; so fast  in fact  that the food was still hot ! that  a win in david's book. our mains were saag paneer and chicken tikka masala. saag paneer was solid  to be sure  but david will admit that saag paneer was not  quite as flavorful as other versions of this dish david have  had. saag paneer seemed just a little too salty  somehow. chicken tikka masala  on the other hand  was exquisite. chicken tikka masala was flavorful  spicy  and just all around delicious. david could have  eaten another eight containers of chicken tikka masala. david also ordered a couple of samosas and a cashew salad. a couple of samosas was surprisingly tasty and full of delicious vegetables  while a cashew salad was good but not spectacular. all in all  jaipur grill was just what the doctor ordered on an almost insanely cold night.

jaipur grille, arti, as someone who grew up in mumbai and has been constantly disappointed at various indian restaurants across north america it was such a pleasant surprise to find indian food here that was as nearly      as good as the food back home. our favourite things here are the samosa the lamb chops  the okra and the eggplant. arti generally do not  eat meat  but the lamb chops here are just irresistible. the service is excellent. the service is a little pricey  but the service is  worth it.

jaipur grille, laura, came here a few weeks ago with some friends for lunch. some friends were running  jaipurlicous so laura had that. laura had the tandoori chicken wings as laura's app  -  did not  enjoy the tandoori chicken wings as my app all too much  -  the tandoori chicken wings as my app was not the traditional red  bbq charred colour or taste laura expected. instead the tandoori chicken wings as my app was yellowish and looked to be semi broiled. was not  a fan. laura's main dish of shrimp masala was good  -  really enjoyed the gravy  -  perfect level of spice and the gravy was really aromatic. the naan was nice and fluffy. for dessert laura had the gulab jamun. the meal came with one  laura could have easily had another    -  these were rich  sweet and warm  laura like them served warm not cold like some restaurants do . price was great and service was good as well. will come again and try other dishes  and laura know not to order their tandoori wings.

jaipur grille, mdaw, came here for lunch -  do not  be fooled if there are not  many people there -  the food is very good  and reasonably priced. had the chicken tikka masala  and saag paneer -  both very tasty. the business lunch is very filling  good if you are  hungry or for leftovers.

jaipur grille, nav, after reading all the reviews  nav decided to go with nav's team for lunch here and nav was very impressed. the food was more authentic than many other places around here  read chef of india   and a great value for lunch. for     per head  including gratuity and taxes  nav ate a good complete meal. nav had the chicken tikka masala which nav requested extra spicy  and nav thoroughly enjoyed the chicken tikka masala which nav requested extra spicy. far better than going for a run of the mill buffet. nav went again with nav's brother and husband on a saturday for lunch  and the food and prices were great again. the chaat for starters was also very enjoyable. the only reason that nav am giving this   stars and not   is because when nav went with nav's family  my family did not ask my family for chai dessert  which nav did actually want  and got my family the bill straight. so nav decided not to order those things and my family lost out on some more money. despite this  highly recommended for lunch  not sure about the dinner value  !

jaipur grille, gogoland, the foods are delicious but what gogoland like even more is the friendliness of the staff. gogoland have come in here with friends for lunch and have also ordered delivery and the staff are always accommodating and full of smiles. sometimes  in a busy city like toronto  some people forget how to be nice to other humans so it is  always refreshing when this is the case. at jaipur grille  you get good food  great atmosphere and friendly staff. what  not to love

jaipur grille, arpita, jaipur grille is run by an extremely dishonest and untrustworthy person. having heard good reviews of the food  arpita ordered chicken and shrimp biryani for    people. an extremely dishonest and untrustworthy person had given arpita an estimate of      including tax for this including delivery. come d - day  when arpita asked for a confirmation of an estimate of      including tax for this including delivery  an extremely dishonest and untrustworthy person tried to fool arpita by adding additional tax and delivery charges. the worst part is that chicken and shrimp biryani was just colored rice  and the chicken and shrimp biryani barely had any of colored rice. the entire party was disappointed with the food and arpita am skeptical of ever going back. if this is what they do  arpita wonder what other unethical things they do with food. recycle half eaten dishes
jaipur grill, sumantra, jaipur grill is an office favourite. the food and service are always great. sumantra can not  think of anything on the menu that sumantra did not  like. jaipur grill

tandoori house, heather, heather have  been to tandoori house many times over the years and have always enjoyed the food. however  since changing tandoori house's name to  tandoori house   tandoori house have reduced the size of tandoori house's lunch buffet significantly  and food is not replenished once emptied. very slim pickings really  and no mango ice cream ! tandoori house have  also done away with the warm gold  red  green interior. instead tandoori house have painted the walls a prison color beige and replaced the dark carpet with standard issue beige tile. did heather go to the prison cafeteria or an indian restaurant the staff was very nice but the staff did not offer any kind of drink other than water. sadly  the underwhelming food and stark ugly decor equate to a deal breaker. there are many other indian restaurants around madison that bring their a game in all categories. all those wonderful pictures you see of the buffet tables and the warm colors on the wall are long gone from here.

tandoori house, christine, the food here is amazing !  ! the best indian food around. christine had the goat curry  mixed tandoori  mango shrimp and chicken makhani. chicken makhani was so good christine had to get an extra order to go. tandoori house make great drinks from scratch -  mango margarita was so good !  ! christine was very impressed with the service as well. christine travel often and eat out a lot at high end restaurants and the service was top notch. very friendly and helpful.

tandoori house, kamran, local demographics who are not very aquiented of this type of ethenic food consider awesome  but who grew up eating curry and kabobs tandoori house is just a mediocre restaurant. -   buffet is just little too much for cold food. dish trays were not attended and some were empty. no one was looking after buffet trays. middle of lunch hour resturant was empty  meaning good seating without any wait. kamran guess kamran was expecting better food with newer management. tandoori house charged     -  with better taste.

tandoori house, nuriddin, great buffet  excellent service. the staff are very polite and professional  even when kids are being raucous. the lunch buffet has lots of choices and is a great value. nuriddin would  go here once a week if nuriddin lived closer.

tandoori house, katy, the chicken tikka masala meal is pretty good but the entire paper bag from the restaurant  especially the naan  smelled heavily of cigarette smoke. especially the naan was completely inedible due to the cigarette smell taste  -  especially the naan was really disgusting especially in terms of taste... even though the taste of one dish from the restaurant is good  the cigarette smoke smell taste that has transferred to the food is just unforgivable.

tandoori house, ali, unbelievably good indian food for an upper midwest town like madison. ali travel a lot and always eat at tandoori house when ali m in madison. the food is prepared beautifully and the food  well seasoned without being too spicy. ali have  dived in and ordered delivery and the quality is always high. ali also appreciate a good halal option  which can be difficult when ali m not in a big city. the staff are friendly and tandoori house has a family vibe. ca not  recommend tandoori house enough.

tandoori house, goodson, goodson m not sure what the complaints are about. goodson really liked the food but most of goodson's meal consisted of   -   dishes only. goodson wish tandoori house had palak paneer but instead there was a lamb dish with paneer. a lamb dish with paneer was good. goodson m a goat fan so the goat curry was also good. give it a try and see for yourself. disregard our yelp reviews.

tandoori house, zeshan, the food here was absolutely outstanding. zeshan came into town for a business trip and thought there was no good food in the area. after a quick yelp search  zeshan saw tandoori house and thought zeshan would  check tandoori house out. to my surprise  tandoori house was a pakistani indian fusion restaurant. these are very rare to find ! zeshan had the peshawari kebab with saag paneer. it turned out to be a rest experience . both owners were present. both owners  which showed me exactly why both choices of my dishes were so good ! naan was on point and fresh as well. zeshan would recommend tandoori house to anyone. just wish they had more places like tandoori house in my hometown. thank you for the great food and service tandoori house  !

tandoori house, ali, tandoori house is now were maharaja used to be. the new owners must have new chefs as well. the food was terrible. very bland tikka masala and chicken curry; every thing needed more salt or something. the tikka masala had way to much cream in the tikka masala ali could barely eat the tikka masala. even the nann was cold and tastless. ali's favorite thing to eat at most indian restaurants is the mint chutney  dipping for nann  pakora and samosa. most places the taste is very similar  sometimes different color or texture but still tasty. tandoori house  was beyond awful. it was again bland  super spicy from tons of raw jalape os that it almost tasted chemical - like. the samosa were also empty from the time ali got there until ali left. maybe it will get better with time but ali m not willing to take that chance. ali will not be coming back here  swagat off of old sauk will be our go to indian buffet from now on. also weird how the other   reviewers have only started yelping this month and have only reviewed tandoori house  just sayin.....

tandoori house, nikita, from what nikita have  read  tandoori house used to be another restaurant that switched cooks and changed tandoori house's name. when nikita initially looked at the reviews most said that tandoori house was better and that tandoori house lacks ambience. tbqh that may be true to some degree. tandoori house was very large  empty and had no music. the waitstaff seated nikita promptly and had good service. when nikita go to ethnic restaurants nikita usually go for good food and nikita thought the lunch buffet had pretty good quality with lots of variety. the curry was very flavorful and some were actually spicy  which nikita really like. the only dish nikita did not  like was the goat curry. the meat was very chewy and hard to eat  but nikita did like the flavor and consistency of the curry.

tandoori house, sara, sara have absolutely no complaints ! sara really appreciated the menu; there were many choices and sara's indian favorites were on the menu. sara ordered palak paneer and chicken makhani to - go and it tasted as it should ! the staff was friendly and the prices are fair.

tandoori house, bernard, the interior decor went downhill since the change from maharajah  tore out the carpet and painted the concrete floor really why  . the food on the lunch buffet was lukewarm had no sneeze guards over the chafers bernard thought no sneeze guards over the chafers were required by law    and there was not a good selection of items. bernard wo not  return.

tandoori house, seth, seth went to the lunch buffet with a friend and the food was so good seth returned with seth's wife for dinner soon after. seth's friend had lived and travelled in india and also felt the food was unusually good. there were lots of vegetarian entrees  two types of naan  a very good lentil soup and tasty desserts. the pickles  condiments  tasted fresh and flavorful. coming back for dinner seth shared the vegetarian dinner for two  which featured three excellent entrees papadam  pakoras  naan and dessert. the portions were generous and the use of spices skillful. there were good choices for indian beer. this is now our favorite indian restaurant by a wide margin.

tandoori house, chris, my friends and chris had been frequenters of the former maharaja for years. found out the former maharaja changed hands and became tandoori house so chris went over friday afternoon to give the lunch buffet a try. arrived around the lunch buffet was pretty empty. think there was only   other table seated the entire time chris were there. and once chris tried the food the food itself  chris knew why. the selection was pretty standard to what you would  expect at one of these buffets. chris of course got some tikka masala chris's go to  and tried the lamb curry  and a few other things chris cannot recall the name of. chris took chris's first bite of some tikka masala  my go to  and spit some tikka masala my go to out. it was like taking a shot of salt. everyone else did the same. some tikka masala my go to was inedible. at least   of the other dishes were just the same  the only flavor was salt. overpowering loads of salt. and on top of that they had the heater on the lunch buffet set really low or even off  if the food itself had been any cooler chris would not  have even tried the food itself  for sanitary reasons. one of the managers stopped by to ask  how the food itself was at one point  and chris was honest with one of the managers. one of the managers did offer to have a batch of  low sodium tikka misala made up  which came out piping hot. and while it certainly was not  the salt bomb that the stuff on the lunch buffet was it was completely bland. it seems a strange turn around from the  was not  salty enough  comment here from   months ago. and chris know the business is still new but you would  think the business would  have the recipes in tip top shape after   -   months.

tandoori house, james, james will  start by saying the food is definitely good. eating at the lunch buffet james got to try a good variety of things and all of it was pretty darn tasty. james was let down by the chai tea there was not very much flavor in the chai at all. sadly the chai was more brown water than anything else. did not  get any other drinks so james can not  speak for them the rest may be good. the atmosphere of tandoori house is not  enjoyable currently  though this is mainly due to remodeling they are  doing james think. there  not really any decorations on the walls  so apart from the tables the rooms feel empty. but again  they are  currently remodeling so the atmosphere of the restaurant will likely improve over time. the waiter felt very awkward and almost confused. and james do not  think james would  put it to the waiter being new to waiting tables. the waiter had the motions down so to speak but the waiter did not  seem to know what was going on. james asked if james paid at the table now or on the way out  and the waiter did not  seem to know. after a long pause the waiter said it was paid at the table but the waiter sounded very unsure. and throughout our interactions with the waiter  there was never a spark of personality. so comparing tandoori house to maharaja  which tandoori house took the place of. is the food better maybe some of the food yeah. the food  the same if not better. the chai is worse  though the rest of the drinks may still be good. the atmosphere currently is a far cry from maharaja  which it took the place of. empty walls and lack of any decorations make tandoori house feel unenjoyable and less fun. tandoori house lacks the charm that maharaja  which it took the place of had. and james can only speak for the waiter  but comparing the waiter to the waiters of maharaja  which it took the place of  there is  no contest. the waiters of maharaja  which it took the place of had fun personalities and were nice and very attentive  even at the lunch buffet where the waiters of maharaja are  needed much less. the waiter james had seemed like the waiter would  rather be anywhere else. the three stars are because the atmosphere  and staff will likely improve over time. and the food is already good. tandoori house has the makings of a great restaurant that will stand on tandoori house's own and not need to be compared to tandoori house's predecessor. when that happens  tandoori house will  be a   or  . but right now the food is  just average as it is  food is held back by the rest of tandoori house.

tandoori house, sandy, my husband and sandy were hungry for new flavors and so sandy tried tandoori house and were not disappointed. my husband and sandy were served delicious  fresh  handcrafted drinks and enjoyed the intense flavors and fresh  hot dishes of chicken curry and beef tandoori. the naan was crisp and hot out of the oven and the staff was attentive to my husband and sandy's needs throughout the entire meal. sandy will definitely be back.

tandoori house, emily, my friends and emily came in on a sunday  for my birthday dinner. emily were seated promptly and very friendly. our server told us about the drink specials. emily had a margarita and a cocktail emily chose for me. sweet  spicy  and delicious with oranges  limes tequila  and tamarind. our food was hot  with great flavor and large portions. the menu was accommodating to my vegan vegetarian  and gluten free friends. emily were given a complimentary birthday dessert that fed all of us. emily were very impressed with the staff and quality of food. emily would  highly recommend tandoori house for a fun get together with friends ! thanks for my birthday dinner !

tandoori house, ayesha, the food is very delicious. being a stay at home mom who has to cook   meals daily. there are times when ayesha dont want to cook at all but have to as there was no resturant which delivered halal and delicious desi food. thanks to tandoori house now ayesha can take a break from cooking and spend more time to play with ayesha's kids. so far ayesha have tried chicken tikka  chicken achari  peshawari kadhai samosa chat daal makhni  and chapli kabob. everything was very delicious with pakistani taste. and yes how can ayesha forget ghulab jaman... veryyy yummyy. now ayesha dont need to wait to go to chicago for pakistani food. ayesha can get pakistani food here from tandoori house. ayesha wish tandoori house add pakistani style biryani to tandoori house's menu.

tandoori house, gina, this was the biggest disappointment since toronto.... food was cold for starters and gina arrived at    : so it should have  been stellar fresh. there was crust on the saag paneer and the tandoori grilled fish was cold like the tandoori grilled fish had just been brought out from the refrigerator. the naan was average at best and even the water had a peculiar taste to even the water with oily film on top. the only good thing gina can say was tandoori house offered a box of  kleenex  next to the chai tea as you left the buffet area so you did not need to blow your nose in the white cloth napkins. the price was    . person but gina were charged    . for two with no extras. never again... trust me do not  go here. sorry tandoori house but you need to change  things and fast.

tandoori house, matthew, amazing tandoori paneer best matthew have  ever had. super flavorful spice rub combined with the tandoori char to produce something out of this world. the vegetable curry was also excellent. service was a little slow  but friendly and accomadating. matthew would highly recommend tandoori house -  - food is worth the wait.

tandoori house, cherise, the owner was so nice ! cherise ordered cherise's food togo and the owner recommended the chicken tikka masala. cherise caved and got the chicken tikka masala because who can resist. the meal itself comes with a good portion of rice tikka massala  and dessert. as much as cherise liked the portions  cherise was not  able fully get the explosion of flavor cherise was looking for. the rice was plain...which cherise was looking for something more fragrant and the actual tikka was creamy but missing that pop. the meal itself was not  bad  but the meal itself was not  great either. however  you should definitely try the mango smoothie if you go. cherise will  be back for convenience  but is not  cherise's first choice.

tandoori house, ira, different name but still great food. ordered off the menu for dinner and were very pleased with what ira got. the chicken makhani was rich and delicious; the tandoori beef had a nice bite to the tandoori beef and a smokey flavor; and the garlic naan had plenty of garlic. loved the chai tea  too. ira treated very well; given extra bread and refills of chai. ira will  be back next time ira are  in madison.

tandoori house, trisha, done with tandoori house. my husband and trisha have been coming here for a long time and order the same thing every time and the order can not seem to be consistent. tonight felt like trisha threw away my husband and trisha's money again. for    . for dinner for   you would  think trisha could at least get my husband and trisha's take out in containers that were not  cracked open and spilling all over. when my husband and trisha's order is correct everything is there  and containers that were not  cracked open and spilling all over are not  busted open trisha like tandoori house but trisha can not  seem to get that consistently. also the pakora and shahi paneer recipes must have changed recently and trisha do not  care for the pakora and shahi paneer recipes anymore. shahi paneer was very hard and the new spice flavor was not  as good as the new spice flavor was. the pakora are now chewy  bland and taste overcooked. trisha had issues in the past and the staff addressed issues promptly but again trisha had my husband and trisha's extra rice missing  bad pakora and shahi paneer spilled all over. madison selection of indian restaurants is growing constantly and trisha wo not  be coming back here. friendly staff and very good food sometimes.

tandoori house, david, david stopped in on a monday night and ordered the chaat samosa appetizer  potatoes and spinach aloo something  and malai kofta. the hot food was hot  especially the bread  and beautifully spiced. you can order hotness from   to  . david's companion is not a spicy girl and found   too hot. but david's kofta tasted milder to my companion  perhaps because of the paneer in malai kofta. when david were ready to go the waiter offered rice for the spinach leftovers  no charge. there are several vegan and vegetarian options on the menu.

tandoori house, john, went on a saturday night with friends. excellent drinks made special for us by jimmy. the food was wonderful. john loved the roghan josh and the goat malabar. john will  definitely be back.

tandoori house, matthew, so it is  a little confusing. google maps says maharaja restaurant is permanently closed  but tandoori house is at the same location and shares the same website. aside from that tandoori house is a great place to go for indian. the lamb curry was delicious and perfectly spicy at medium temp. the chicken shahikorma had nice chunks of bell peppers and was also perfectly spicy at medium. the one issue matthew had was the chicken shahikorma was lacking in sauce. honestly though  the service was great and matthew look forward to going back to tandoori house.

tandoori house, kelly, terrible delivery service takes forever. the order took more than an hour and a half to arrive ! they would  told us    min for delivery. in addition  terrible delivery service was really expensive considering what kelly got. over     for literally one entree  shahi korma     orders of naan  and   tiny samosa. they only provided one small packet of rice. kelly were calling for half an hour to check on the status of the food but no one ever answered the phone. kelly would  ordered the food mild as our toddler does not  like very spicy food  but the food was extremely hot  -  perfect for kelly  but not at all what kelly ordered  and our kid could not  eat the food. when delivery finally arrived  the delivery guy was not  even apologetic. kelly was standing at our open door waiting  and kelly was walking so slowly  like kelly did not  even care. unfortunately kelly would  already left the tip  and they charged us a delivery fee on top of the tip  without disclosing a delivery fee. this is a business that is obviously not equipped to provide delivery service. shahi korma was good  but nothing else was.

tandoori house, erica, tandoori house went totally downhill after the change of ownership. every time erica have  ordered delivery they have  either not been able to find erica's address  and then just went back or they totally screwed up erica's order. but the absolute worst was finding some sort of metal string in erica's curry. it  really a shame because tandoori house used to be one of erica's favorite places.

tandoori house, gemma, the too long did not  read version of this review is  gemma miss maharajah . miss not the reason for   stars but miss is  still true. gemma went for the lunch buffet because gemma are  just wild about indian food. the lunch buffet did not  really have a large amount of people  and gemma got there shortly after open     : am . you would  assume the food would be fresh  but you would  be wrong. everything gemma got off the lunch buffet was lukewarm at best. the fried things were soggy and greasy. the flavor was ok  but you can get better pretty much anywhere in madison. the lunch buffet is also very small. the lunch buffet also do not serve naan to the table naan is  in a hopper so naan is  sad and limp not crispy and awesome. gemma think outside of the food the thing that bugged me the most was that gemma did not feel welcome at all. the two guys who were serving us talked only to my husband and one actually walked away as gemma started talking to him. he asked how things were  listened to my husband and walked away while gemma was talking. when gemma went up to pay it was basically the same thing. looked and talked to my husband even though gemma was paying. gemma do not  need to return here.

tandoori house, mary, mary had been here previously when tandoori house was a different restaurant. mary were pleasantly surprised with the new menu. many dishes mary were not  familiar with. the flavors of the shahi korma and jalfrezi were unique and delicious. the naan was soft and flavorful. the staff was very friendly. the only drawback is the decor which feels a little stark. concrete floors and bright lights. mary will be back !
