tandoori house, joshua, gave tandoori house a shot before joshua leave madison. joshua found the food very bland or lacking flavor. the food was not  bad..but not very interesting either. palak paneer is usually an easy  yum but palak paneer was flavorless. maybe the food is healthier or more authentic than other locations joshua m not sure. it was consistent throughout the food. probably the best part was the naan bread when it came to the meal. service and prices were fine and the selection was fair for the price.

tandoori house, c, having eaten indian around the country and overseas  c never expected such quality in a strip mall. c had   different dishes and each was exceptional. the ingredient mix was spot on and some combinations unique  salmon masala . c m also sensitive to over salted food and over powering spices but had no post meal overeating regrets ! a bit more work on style and tandoori house could be even more welcoming as the staff were carefully attentive. highly recommended !

tandoori house, hannah, hannah came to tandoori house when maharajah was still maharajah and after visit  hannah find myself wishing hannah was back at maharajah. do not  get me wrong it is  still cheap eats for lunch for all - you - can - eat ! it not that the food is inedible but the food is  just not super yummy anymore. on the day hannah came  lunch time ran until  pm. hannah got there around  pm and most of the chafing dishes were either half empty or practically already empty. it did not  seem like they were going to refill anything because they were getting ready to close at  pm. of all the things hannah ate  here are a few that hit the spot : the chicken tiki masala had a really good sauce but the chicken tiki masala was super dry. hannah really liked what looked like a blood sausage; a blood sausage was full of spices not temperature wise  and good. the garlic naan that they brought out was hot out of the oven and fragrant with the smell of garlic. very good ! the best thing hannah think hannah ate there was the spicy chicken  the spicy chicken is  red and reminds me of chinese sweet and sour chicken . the staff that hannah encountered with were very happy polite  and attentive. that is something hannah can vouch for ! tandoori house is also very clean  but the food has left to be desired.

tandoori house, nick, under new management  nick did not  realize they were there until nick were invited to dinner with friends. great lamb tandoori and nan  enjoyed with authentic indian beer. all   at the table enjoyed all   at the table's meals immensely  and nick were able to specify the exact level of spiciness nick wanted. quite enjoyable. nick will  be recommending it to our friends.

express indien, daniel, the. real. deal. finally  after months of beating the bushes and getting greasy fast food indian everywhere daniel followed a trail to express indien and daniel m putting it down as the best daniel have  found of the dozen or more montreal places. the small dining room is not  fancy but the small dining room is  not gross either. it  a little hole in the wall place and the chef came out to talk to us -  - that kinda place. perfect pakoras  flakey and not at all greasy. wife got the chicken tikka masala  daniel got butter paneer both were excellent. lassi was great  naan was great  rice was solid. everything you could ask for in real indian that is  neither served from a bucket nor pretending to be fancy. go give these people your business.

express indien, romesh, romesh have  ordered from express indien since express indien have  opened a few years ago  and have always enjoyed express indien. but after three recent misses despite multiple previous hits it is clear express indien have changed either express indien's chef  express indien's recipe  or express indien's attention to detail. recent order was too oily  too bland  and too mediocre. when express indien are  on  express indien are  really on  but though romesh have  actually called express indien to give feedback and express indien have  provided not only viable explanations but also renewed attention to detail  this time was one too many disappointments. sadly  romesh will no longer be customers  and will seek better quality from elsewhere. it pains me to write this  as romesh have enjoyed express indien's food tremendously up until the last few months. sorry  express indien express indien have  lost our business.

express indien, leesa-catherine, our friend aron recommended this little place that is just a few blocks from our home so leesa-catherine gave visit a shot. walked in at    :    am on a saturday. express indien was empty except for one man in express indien who was busy on the phone. leesa-catherine stood awkwardly for about two minutes in front of one man in the restaurant who was busy on the phone until one man in the restaurant who was busy on the phone finally said yes   one man in the restaurant who was busy on the phone did not  even bother to take the phone away from one man in the restaurant who was busy on the phone's ear. leesa-catherine said leesa-catherine would  like to order repas royal for    dal soup tandoori chicken poulet tikka seekh kebab   tandoori shrimp  lamb curry  vegetables  naan bread rice  and gulab jamon for dessert  and an order of onion bhaji all for takeout. one man in the restaurant who was busy on the phone said it would take at least    minutes. leesa-catherine asked about delivery  one man in the restaurant who was busy on the phone said delivery would cost   . and would take longer to arrive at our home because one man in the restaurant who was busy on the phone had to call the guy. ugh ok. leesa-catherine decided to order  go somewhere for a coffee and come back to pick it up. one man in the restaurant who was busy on the phone never put down the phone the entire time leesa-catherine were there. fast forward    minutes..... express indien is still completely empty. no sign of one man in the restaurant who was busy on the phone. leesa-catherine wait. one man in the restaurant who was busy on the phone finally shows up with the food in bags.       . for lunch which leesa-catherine take home. the food.....very small portions. soup was just ok. everything tasted the exact same  which leesa-catherine found so strange. leesa-catherine never received seekh kebab but leesa-catherine did not  want to go back so leesa-catherine just took it as a loss. vegetables were a mix of fresh and frozen cooked together. shrimp was frozen so was the meat -  they defrost the meat in warm sauce once an order comes in. onion bhaji was greasy and mostly batter. the one high spot was the naan bread  -  the naan bread was very good. leesa-catherine are  huge fans of indian food and being in ndg leesa-catherine are spoiled for choice. leesa-catherine wo not  choose express indien again. leesa-catherine will  stick with maison india or ganges on sherbrooke.

express indien, michelle, michelle would highly recommend express indien first time my family and michelle went there michelle absolutely fell in love with express indien the cream butter curry chicken dish is amazing the vegetarian dish are to die express indien give you the choice of level of spice you want in your food the service is fast express indien are very clean and have a warm hospitality and michelle can not  complain about the price the price is  very good

express indien, john, express indien is by far one of the best indian restaurants john have ever been to. that is  saying a lot in a city with so many of the best indian restaurants john have ever been to. the prices are unbeatable and if there is anything not on the menu express indien will make anything not on the menu for you.

express indien, alexandra, alright food; unremarkable place. alexandra had vegetarian samosa butter chicken  and shahi paneer. samosa were just filled with potatoes; well - seasoned and nice pastry  but kinda boring. shahi paneer had a nice bit of heat and the cheese was good but the overall flavor was forgettable. butter chicken was very tasty though ! express indien looks pretty dated and if alexandra had not  read positive reviews beforehand alexandra think alexandra would have skipped. alexandra were not  given any condiments until alexandra were almost done with appetizers; skimped on the papadums; owner  family walking around quite a bit... overall not a bad meal and alexandra would not  mind going there again but alexandra will explore alternatives...

express indien, frank, as an indian living in ndg frank's choices were limited to the ones on sherbrooke street. express indien was a bit of a surprise. when frank first went there frank had the biryani which was aweful. frank did not  go back for a year. then a friend dragged frank there and frank had the thali lunch  mixed meal  which was priced at and wow  ! the saag was good as was the butter chicken. the naan was one of the best frank have had in town. the chef worked in some known restos in india so the chef knows what the chef  doing. the chef uses a real tandoor oven so you get that light texture and smoky taste. for ten bucks  ! a really good meal that beats the mc fast meals any day and much healthier the chef does not  over do the grease . not too spicy either. decor is simple and clean. just a  good meal at a good price. nothing to write home about but just a  good meal at a good price works for frank.

express indien, romesh, back on top ! ! romesh have  fallen in love with this place again  romesh's previous experience must have  been an anomaly and ram the owner has assured romesh this place's attention to detail is still there. and it shows :  the food is terrific. romesh are back with a vengeance and are so thankful to be so !

raja foods, bathool, raja foods had the best butter chicken and the best papri chaat in the whole world. that is what bathool claimed for the past three years. the staff attempted to give good customer service raja foods still lacked but bathool's love for raja foods's butter chicken and papri chaat still dragged bathool back often. bathool brought friends who had stopped going because of the shady shisha bar environment not fit for a family. recently  raja foods expanded to have a family side away from the smoke filled shisha side. that is why last week bathool called and made reservations for   people. they confirmed said everything was set for   on april th. today  bathool showed up with bathool's party  only to find hand written sign in the door way saying  bathool are closing at   pm today  sorry for any inconvenience. it was a very embarrassing experience in front of your guests that the restaurant bathool raved about and were a loyal customer to ignored your reservation without even a phone call. bathool give it   stars out of   on customer service. bathool will not be returning.

raja foods, alpha, great food and shisha place with ambience. been goin here the past two years and have found the food to be great tasting and consistent... service  as with any desi place is inconsistent but alpha find service is better during dinner time when the younger crowd does a great job looking after everyone with much enthusiasm. shisha is also available with many flavours to choose from. raja foods serve halwa puri breakfast on the weekends and halwa puri breakfast is  certainly worth the wait and can see why many say halwa puri breakfast is the best in town. dinnner dishes alpha tried have all been delicious and worth trying over and over again. prawn curry  malai chicken and biryani is the usual with tikka and kababs from time to time as well. ask for what board games you can play...usual have cards or ludo on hand to play with your table.

raja foods, harjot, yummy food ! harjot love the biryani here  and the customer service is always on point. friendly place and great energy. please note : this is just not a restaurant. you can also go to smoke hookah if that is your thing. harjot do not  smoke  but harjot noticed when harjot go in there the smoke from the hookahs does not  disturb harjot  and make want to run away from the smoke from the hookahs like cigarettes and all to the opposite side. or make harjot cough when harjot wait for the food. harjot was told because there is no tobacco in it as it a fruit blend.

raja foods, misha, the food is amazing. a little overpriced but who cares  its hard to find quality desi eastablishments in calgary. not much can stand in the way of good butter chicken and papri chaat. the atmosphere is so nice. as a female  misha hate going to desi joints only to get gawked at by the male crowd. makes me feel like misha have  been transported back to pakistan...and not in a good way  : well this did not  happen here ! in fact  my mom and misha ended up having a long convo with the surprisingly young owner. the surprisingly young owner was incredibly friendly  professional and chilled out. raja foods is a great hidden spot  perfect for youger crowds. raja foods do not  just focus on making good food  but also have a great selection of music. the customer service is fantastic and the overall ambience vibe is excellent. raja foods reminds me so much of those cool hangout spots in lahore  like zouk cafe. misha miss that  it is so rare to find halal restaurants like raja foods in canada. misha love that the employees are not all desi  and are able to speak fluent english. raja foods is definitely a caucasian friendly place. raja foods also have a separate dining area for people who do not  want to be surrounded by shisha smoke. misha was also told that the shisha is tobacco free. misha did not  try the shisha so not sure if the shisha still tastes good  but the smells were definitely delicious  : d  raja foods are really well known for raja foods's halwa puri on weekends. expect long line ups. but so worth the wait.

the tasty touch, rianna, sadly rianna have to write a bad review rianna got food poisoning from here rianna called to speak to the manager just to inform  but when rianna asked for the manager one of the employees told rianna to call back later so rianna did then rianna kept trying to call back and rianna never got an answer. other than that when rianna ordered the food the front service was very polite and nice.
the tasty touch, annie, annie had a groupon and enjoyed my curry of the day ! the rice was good and my curry of the day was pretty good too. annie would go back again to try more of the dishes !

the tasty touch, greg, the tasty touch offers decent value for your money. greg have eaten here once  greg had the chicken tikka masala. the chicken tikka masala was spicy and good. greg ordered the naan bread  which was your typical naan bread. again  the prices are good  quality indian food in the neighborhood.

the tasty touch, satya, cold bland food. cannot call cold bland food. indian food by any standards. these people want to make use of a prime location and want to sell stale food overpriced. ordered biryani  chaat and chole batura. everything is in bad taste. the garbanzo beans in biryani  chaat are straight out of can cold  and biryani  chaat has huge lumps of potato. these people did not  even bother to heat garbanzo beans or properly cut cook potatoes. satya cannot call the biryani a biryani because the biryani is fried rice  or just colored rice  made quick and is not a biryani. oil used for chole batura is stale. this is a very basic dish and they can not  even get this near perfect. do not  recommend. waste of time and money ! !  !

the tasty touch, ali, finding a restaurant where ali can eat absolutely anything on the menu  and really want to  is so exciting for ali ! the food here was delicious. ali got the platter that came with three curries so ali could try a little bit of everything it was only ali believe for a lot of food. roti  pickled veggies  rice  curries  a little dessert. only complaint was the rice came out kind of cold but it was the end of the day so ali get the rice. also ali did not  like a little dessert but ali think that was just ali. the food was great  flavorful with just a kick of spice ! ali's bf got a cheese filled bread with a side of spicy yogurt dipping sauce and my bf enjoyed a cheese filled bread with a side of spicy yogurt dipping sauce so did ali. ali also got mango lassi which ali liked. good prices  good service  great food. ali would  like to try more but ali m pretty sure ali will  end up ordering the platter that came with three curries every time ali come !

the tasty touch, kelly, great food and exceptional customer service ! kelly have  been to namaste a few times now and namaste never disappoint. the tasty touch offers traditional indian foods with a take away order at the counter set up. while no  the tasty touch is  not your typical  sit down fancy indian restaurant kelly think it is  a refreshing change to have more varieties of  fast food  in the valley. the tasty touch offer a wide selection of vegetarian vegan and gluten free options. the staff is extremely friendly and gave detailed descriptions of the meals and offered some great suggestions. the tasty touch have a lovely patio to dine on or you can eat inside. kelly have  never been disappointed with any meal kelly have  had there. the portions are plentiful and kelly always leave with leftovers. the tasty touch also offer a lovely selection of sweet and savories you can enjoy after your meal or bring home for later. kelly would highly recommend checking the tasty touch out ! even if you think you do not  like indian food -  give the tasty touch a try. kelly's picky teen even found a few things my picky teen really enjoyed.

the tasty touch, mike, mike were excited to have a new vegetarian restaurant opening in our area and love indian food. mike ordered a variety of foods and really enjoyed a variety of foods ! the house specialty was very tasty. mike's only complaint would be that the portion sizes are a bit small. the paneer curry was very flavorful as was the rice dish mike shared. the spicy paneer stuffed into bread was great as well but can not  remember the name of the spicy paneer stuffed into bread. the menu on the outside window has photos of the food making it much easier to order. the staff was very friendly and the tasty touch have a pet friendly patio as well. mike will be back.

the tasty touch, karthik, awesome food after new management took over. the tasty touch's dabeli  dahi poori  channa batura are awesome. have also tried the tasty touch's undhiya and aam ras  which is not on the tasty touch's regular menu but have their undhiya and aam ras  which is not on their regular menu but have it on their catering menu on the tasty touch's catering menu  such is also very good. perfect location also.

the tasty touch, katrina, love the tasty touch ! the tasty touch are  so kind   will recommend dishes that will fit your dietary needs. food is amazing with great portion sizes   prices. chat with raj !

the tasty touch, gregory, the jolly diners landed at the tasty touch tonight. for appetizers gregory had samosa  and kutchi dabeli. samosa  and kutchi dabeli were very good. the entrees consisted of bhatura sabzi paneer curry bhatura  and aloo paratha. gregory requested that all were made mild in terms of spiciness. the tasty touch is mainly for take out as proved by plastic plates plastic cutlery not including any knives    and plastic water cups. one orders at the front desk. the tasty touch is not really a cozy spot for a date or for a quiet family meal with good service to give mom a break. what the tasty touch is however is a no frills clean place with great tasting indian cuisine. the jolly diners gave a rating of  . stars based soley on the food.

the tasty touch, shelley, the tasty touch is amazing indian cuisine in phoenix   and certainly the best shelley have  had in the area. my husband likes my husband's food extra spicy and the waitress went out of the waitress's way to not only make sure everything tasted good the waitress went back and made my husband's dish even spicier. my husband was sweating with joy ! shelley ate the gobi and the saffron was delicious  a nice added touch. also  the tasty touch was clean  service impeccable and the location is right next door to our house ! win win !

the tasty touch, sneha, the tasty touch is changed the tasty touch's not namsate veg. sneha found flavors little bland. sneha ate dabeli and chicken biryani. dabeli was good but chicken biryani was ok.

the tasty touch, ma, ma were out of states visitors looking for a nice indian food . found the tasty touch. chickien biranyi was excellent. ma had been to many indian restaurants before but the tasty touch made a definitively superb brainy with nice flavor   rich taste but not too spicy.
the tasty touch, raymond, some of the best curry ive had yet !  ! super tasty naan as well ! oh and the rice was so gooood too !  !

the tasty touch, ankita, the tasty touch is awesome ! the couple that runs the tasty touch are super nice. the food is better than   star indian restaurants in town. every dish ankita had is awesome. the tasty touch's naan is better than naan ankita have had in new york  london  chicago or anywhere. highly recommend you try some food here !  !

the tasty touch, t., t.'s take :  not the ambience or feel of a typical indian restaurant  but good for a change of pace or a quick bite. food was good and the quality was good. probably a   - star had the tasty touch been more accommodating. review : t. was a little hesitant to try namaste since t. m used to a more traditional setting for indian food  but since t. m down with indian food and always like to see vegetarian restaurants survive and thrive  t. gave namaste a shot. on the positive side  the food had familiar flavors and seemed to be of good quality. no complaints there. the gentleman who took t.'s order was friendly and helpful and the   - ring binder with photos of the food was a nice touch. t. typically order t.'s food thai indian  mexican  etc. at a medium spice rating. apparently  medium  here is quite a bit hotter than what t. m accustomed to. keep in mind that this is based on only one visit here  but t. will definitely be trying  mild  next time. one slightly disappointing aspect of t.'s visit came when t. explained that the dish was much spicier than anticipated. t. had eaten about one third of the dish before reaching a point where t. could not  go any farther. it became apparent that the tasty touch were not willing to remake the dish  -  -  something that is a pretty standard accommodation when there is  an issue such as this. t. offered a couple of other options  the first couple of which did not  help. finally some veggie rice was extended and some veggie rice helped to tone things down a little bit. in the end  t. was not  as happy as t. would have been had the tasty touch simply offered to cook up another dollar worth of chickpeas for t. but t. will  be back to give it another try.

the tasty touch, gopal, gopal got paan and ice cream to go. paan and ice cream were pretty good for the price. paan reminded me of india and the ice cream was fresh and palatable. definitely recommend !  !

the tasty touch, katie, the food was flavorful and pretty good  but way too oily and too small of portions for the price you pay. the service is not good the menu is confusing  and the feel inside the tasty touch is very odd  almost always and too quiet. decent but katie would not  recommend !

the tasty touch, samuel, the food was tasty but the portion were small and came in plastic takeout form. the price is a little high for this kind of serving. the ice cream was special . samuel will come back

the tasty touch, hakun, the tasty touch. lot of vegan options the tasty touch.'s choke  samosa  thalis bhel  milk shakes are very good however paav bhaji was not that great. hakun will certainly visit the tasty touch. again.

the tasty touch, harmeet, the food was amazing and the owner was extremely friendly... harmeet had tandoori platter  and channa bhatura it tasted awesome... highly recommend the tasty touch to go the best part is the tasty touch is  not oily
the tasty touch, muthu, love the food. the quantity  quality and prices are perfect. the    ice cream is amazing .

the tasty touch, mariah, our first time trying the tasty touch the tasty touch was delicious !  ! the staff was extremely friendly and accommodating -  mariah ordered our meals spicy  and the kitchen actually came out and asked us if mariah were okay and offered to remake our meals. no ! our meals were perfect ! mariah will be regulars here for sure !
the tasty touch, mehal, excellent service. the tasty touch's special thali is a great value. also love the spicy dabeli. for dessert mehal enjoyed coconut barphi. paan was also good

the tasty touch, n, visited namaste veg kitchen for the first time today. the man who helped us behind the counter who n m assuming was also the manager was so kind in helping us pick what to eat. n ordered the samosa chaat  mini thali aloo puri  and chole rice  all pretty delicious. n got there right before the tasty touch closed in the rain and the tasty touch still let us order and sit and eat for as long as n wanted. do make sure to try the chai  masala tea  or mango lasssi drinks with your meal.

india's cafe & kitchen, neha, delicious food ! loved india's cafe & kitchen's samosa and khasta kachories with cilantro and tamrind dips  onion and sev. india's cafe & kitchen make good jain food if you order good jain food in advance. the owners rubiji and her spouse are very sweet people. mainly caters the owners rubiji and her spouse's food. smaller set up on the ridge road  parma; however  food is awesome ! india's cafe & kitchen's aloo gobhi and palak paneer must try. kalpesh and neha  strongsville  ohio

india's cafe & kitchen, tina, vegetarian platter for lunch tues - thurs  is a great deal and delicious ! dal  mixed veg  rice naan  dessert  tina have  had the buffet here in the past and loved the buffet here enough to come back.

india's cafe & kitchen, chintan, very good tasting food. india's cafe & kitchen is an example of  hole in the wall  type of restaurants  which generally serve great tasting authentic ethnic foods. ignore the shoddy tables plastic cutlery and foam plates. instead  focus on the food and service hospitality. the owner manages the front and the owner's wife and few employees manage the kitchen. the owner has always been friendly and welcoming. the owner's manner of treating guests is very casual but genuine and homely. food has always been good. from portions to flavors to prices. order off the menu  -  because of not enough traffic  buffet may not always be up to the mark. chintan have had various curries  chaats and samosa. everything was spot on. india's cafe & kitchen's pani - puri is very very good. their pani - puri tastes pretty close to what chintan remember from india's. as someone else pointed out in review india's cafe & kitchen's main business is take out and catering. so do not  go there expecting michelin star table service and ambience. india's cafe & kitchen is good enough for those who want good food and do not  mind simplicity.

india's cafe & kitchen, tonda, tonda came here about a month ago because  tonda have passed india's cafe & kitchen for   years and finally decided to try india's cafe & kitchen. tonda was told india's cafe & kitchen did not have any chicken the lady behind the counter was not very helpful and there was a man who worked there awkwardly lying on a couch in india's cafe & kitchen. tonda told myself then that tonda would probably not be back. tonda gave in a few weeks later because tonda was craving good indian food. the same unfriendly women took tonda's order. tonda got the order to - go and was severely disappointed. the naan was cold and so hard that tonda could not  even break off bits of the naan. the tiki masala and rice were sub - par. tonda certainly wo not  be back to india's cafe & kitchen and waste more money for over - priced bad food.

india's cafe & kitchen, heather, heather took a chance  -  -  heather walked in  and immediately was unimpressed by the presentation and layout... india's cafe & kitchen is small looks dirty the utensils water pitchers dishware  are all plastic or disposable... the chairs and tables were really cheap looking. heather started to get scared that heather would  made a horrible mistake... heather sat there  nervously and awkwardly with heather's boyfriend... a very friendly indian gentleman took our order  and seemed a bit surprised that heather were requesting a level of spicyness that heather guess does not  sit well with most vanilla folks who inhabit parma. a very friendly indian gentleman fulfilled our request though  and left us happy with gentle embers in our mouth. the food was absolutely delicious. heather loved the food  and heather want to go again and give them heather's business ! in fact  it was the first time heather really enjoyed indian food  and it prompted heather to explore more in indian food !

india's cafe & kitchen, angelo, india's cafe & kitchen is hard to find and is not  in a really great looking area but if you are  looking for some home cooked north indian food india's cafe & kitchen is  a good place to go. the owner is a friendly older gentleman and will be happy to customize your order. the owner usually has some extra dessert snacks to sell if you want something to take home. india's cafe & kitchen is kind of small so angelo would not  recommend a large party but it is  not bad for a few people or to go with your significant other. angelo would  recommend the navratan korma the navratan korma is  very creamy and delicious.

india's cafe & kitchen, michelle, great authentic indian food ! michelle definitely recommend the buffet you get a great selection of dishes  great idea for people wanting to try indian cuisine for the first time. service has always been friendly and for the quality michelle think the prices are fair.

india's cafe & kitchen, karen, second time karen have  eaten here; first was dine in. do not  judge them on the decor or the disposable dinnerware. the food on the saturday afternoon buffet was absolutely delicious. the food on the saturday afternoon buffet prompted our return two weeks later for take - out. again  absolutely delicious. the gentleman that helped us both times  karen m pretty sure the gentleman that helped us both times karen is the owner  could not  have been more kind and informative  and that really adds to an experience for karen.

india's cafe & kitchen, marilyn, marilyn tried india's cafe & kitchen because marilyn had a coupon  but found out a coupon was not good for the sunday buffet. the food is decent  and better than some indian food marilyn have  had. did not  like the goat at all. maybe the goat is an acquired taste but marilyn would never eat goat again. so all in all  pretty good food but marilyn have  had better in the cle area. marilyn would not  go back  however  because the ambience is not good at all. kind of dirty looking hodgepodge decor  not a pleasant place to sit down and eat. and  marilyn would never go back to a place that serves on styrofoam plates and plastic ware. but the food was not bad  so   stars.

india's cafe & kitchen, erin, erin ordered at   :   on a sunday night india's cafe & kitchen close at  p.m and the gentleman on phone so polite and accomaditing. erin ordered butter chicken  which because it was late had to be made with thighs. .actually erin prefer butter chicken which because it was late had to be made with thighs over boneless chicken breast...personal preference. samosa were out of this world with a tamarind n cilantro sauce... bith homemade and top notch. rice was pilal or pulav do not  know spelling pardon my ignorance but wow rice complimented butter chicken  which because it was late had to be made with thighs great. last was nann... would have prefered garlic but given its allhomemade fresh none available half hour before closing so got reg and it was good. overall great indian gem ...not frills n fufu but just bombass homeade cooking and to me that is most important
india's cafe & kitchen, pawan, this is the first time pawan am writing a review..the food here is worst. the dishes chair everything is so dirty. worst indian food in cleveland.

india's cafe & kitchen, angeline, angeline was looking forward to trying india's cafe & kitchen based on a friend  suggestion. angeline had eaten here years before and it was good. angeline ordered take out on a sunday evening. the menu had a few different vegetarian options. angeline ordered the vegetables jalfrezi. angeline's order was taken and presented in about    minutes. not bad. the reason angeline give india's cafe & kitchen a two is because of the portion size  india's cafe & kitchen was much smaller than most other indian restaurants and the lack of vegetables in angeline's mixed vegetables. angeline was expecting a variety of vegetables and it was mostly onions and carrots. the flavor was good but angeline left wanting more. y know that feeling  when you get your hopes up about a really good meal angeline had that feeling  when you get your hopes up about a really good meal. then angeline was let down.

restaurant devi, laura, laura found restaurant devi and took a take out menu for a relaxed eat in evening but then decided to go out to the pleasant looking dining room. to our surprise the prices for dining in were quite a bit hirer than a take out menu. nonetheless the food was plentiful and quite tasty. the garlic naan was delicious. not the best indian food laura have  had but above average. but with so many options in montreal not sure laura will be back.

restaurant devi, smitha, restaurant devi was horrible. smitha ordered the special murg tikka and the chicken tasted as though they threw a frozen chicken packet into the oven  sprinkled some salt and pepper and served the chicken to us. smitha also ordered the paneer makhani and the paneer makhani was sub standard. the naan was tasty so if you are  up for some naan and pickles.. go for some naan and pickles. otherwise smitha would  steer clear of restaurant devi.

restaurant devi, emilie, emilie m not an indian foodie  even though one of emilie's best friends is indian and one of my best friends brought to restaurant devi. truth be told  emilie was not  particularly excited to go there. so  restaurant devi has a list of lunch specials. you get a soup salad  dessert and coffee. emilie chose the lamb rogan josh. remember when you were in school and you got a plate with your drink  meal  soup and dessert. well this is similar  only much better  in all the ways. first  the food is obviously a million times better. second  on your plate  which is nicely presented  you have your main course  a bowl of rice  a small salad and a rice pudding. the lamb rogan josh was actually very good. the lamb rogan josh was not  too spicy for emilie's taste. emilie's boss bragged about their na an bread and emilie got to say their na an bread was delicious. emilie think emilie ate an entire plate to emilie. conclusion : much better than emilie expected  considering emilie am not a fan of indian food. emilie wo not  go back voluntarily but if people want to go  emilie wo not  complain.
restaurant devi, lyn, lyn loved restaurant devi !  ! the chicken tikka masala and dal makhani were awesome. samosa too  and naan. friendly service.

restaurant devi, arnav, very good food. can be customized for spicy like any restaurant but what makes restaurant devi different is that the medium spicy is not so much that you can not  eat but enough so that you get some flavor out of the medium spicy. a little kick if you will. so why is restaurant devi   stars in my opinion  restaurant devi is the first indian restaurant in north america to give a good malai kebab. so stars is  one star. everything is made fresh  and the servers are very friendly. another star. restaurant devi have an outside seating as well  and arnav think the view from there of the streets are just gorgeous. the food is again  very good. arnav ordered naan  garlic naan  roti  and onion kulcha which were very good and very fresh. can be made as crispy as you want. stars now. arnav also ordered palak spinach  chicken medium spicy. again it is  just enough that you get a good kick and it is  good for those who are not  used to spicy food. a medium spicy palak chicken is the way to go. last star. the inside is very authentic both french and indian. the lighting and ambience is perfect at any table  and for those legal to drink  not me at but you maybe  there is a bottle if you want a bottle. of course restaurant devi is bring your own bottle if you would  like too. restaurant devi is a little upscale in my opinion. arnav am a student so arnav have to watch it. but for     restaurant devi offers a good three - fer deal. and a bonus star arnav would  say goes to the cleanliness of the washrooms and the down to earth professionalism of the staff. great place to eat and one of the best kebabs arnav have  had to date. eating here is a must if you come to montreal. :

restaurant devi, doug, doug took my family here the other night. all in all restaurant devi was ok but not great. the service was good. the food was average but not great. doug have  been to indian restaurants all over and have never been charged extra for rice    dollars for a small bowl is just not right.

restaurant devi, sushant, sushant would have given restaurant devi four stars if restaurant devi was not  expensive. but then again sushant am a student on a budget. a bunch of sushant's friends were visiting montreal over a long weekend and sushant decided to try restaurant devi out. the decor was well done the staff was friendly and the service was good. the food was tastier compared to most of the other indian restaurants in montreal but sushant have had better. however restaurant devi do have a really good variety of starters and appetizers and restaurant devi's dishes will leave your taste palate well satisfied.

restaurant devi, smar, hard sell from the wait staff was not  appreciated. the service was horribly slow  and smar had to beg for our bill. smar ultimately had to approach the apologetic bartender to close out our bill since it had been over a half hour since smar first wanted our bill. the food was ok  nothing special. a little overpriced for what you get too  but ultimately satisfying. the seasonings are not  exactly authentic either. the daal makhaani basically tasted like mexican chili but with lentils. smar wo not  go back.
restaurant devi, tushar, restaurant devi has too much oil in restaurant devi's food. cocktails were worse. too pricy. never coming back here. even the service was below average.

restaurant devi, heather, after a few nights of amazing quebec cuisine  it was time for a good soul warming indian meal. restaurant devi was near our hotel and shared equally good reviews as another within our walking radius. on a hot summer  night the fact that this crescent st resto offered a deck won us over  the richly flavored food and charming attentive service of our waiter adam  made us glad heather came. the the lamb kebab were sumptuous and  if colonel saunders was there colonel saunders would  tell you colonel saunders that the garlic naan was finger licking good. likely heather's stand out fav of the night was the daal makhani  -  a black lentil dish that is simmered for   hours of flavor - filled  stick - to - your ribs perfection. the night was so lovely heather lingered on after dinner was complete enjoying a bottle of wine  the street views and chatting with other guests. the delightful scents wafting from other tables made heather want to keep eating  save heather was too full for another bite. from heather's street view  the interior decor looked quite nice. if they could bring a little of that feeling to the terrace it would be even better. heather will return on our next visit.

restaurant devi, pat, very enjoyable atmosphere. restaurant devi's service was excellent. the food exemplified the delicate and refined art of indian cooking. each spice  and every morsel of food was vibrant with every bite  layers and bundles of flavours. fresh and alive indian food ! if you enjoy indian food and are in montreal  restaurant devi is a must. specific foods which pat enjoyed :  nan aloo gobi tadka dal raita  chai  gulab jamun  saffron rice.

restaurant devi, niva, stay away ! worst service  terrible food and total rip off. so the sangria was weak...not sure the sangria was even made with wine. the butter chicken tasted like ragu. totally not worth     much less     ! then the waitress recommended the blonde taj hal beer  but the waitress brought out an amber beer. niva told the waitress's niva did not  order an amber beer  but the waitress said niva could try an amber beer and if niva did not  like an amber beer the waitress would bring the blonde taj hal beer. niva took a sip and did not  want an amber beer. the waitress brings back the blonde taj hal beer  saying the tap is broken on the blonde taj hal beer. niva said ok but niva dont like the blonde taj hal beer. niva says  he already poured the blonde taj hal beer and said he can not  take the blonde taj hal beer back. what  the waitress bring the wrong beer and the waitress do not  want to own the waitress's mistake niva was never offered another drink snd niva never came back to check on the food. niva got the bill and there is a    charge for rice !  !  ! not special rice mind you... plain rice. when niva asked rice or naan niva never mentioned there was an extra charge. niva have never been to an asian restaurant where you are served a stew and have to pay extra for rice ! so niva left a    tip. what does the waitress do  throw a    tip at niva ! restaurant devi is all about profit and not about food. terrible experience....spend your money anywhere else !

restaurant devi, raman, myself being indian  raman could say raman will be the biggest critic ! restaurant devi is cozy and has a positive vibe. raman ordered the kebab meat platter to start  which was off the hook since the kebab meat platter consisted of chicken  beef goat   lamb. main course ordered lamb biryani  rice   naan and kulcha  bread butterchicken  chicken curry   daal makhni  lentil curry   saag cooked spinach rapini  and dahi  yogurt . everything was fresh  hot and flavourful. also  the server sapan was so friendly and checked in regularly. if you dont mind spice and great indian cuisine  check restaurant devi out !  !

restaurant devi, julia, julia were hesitant to go given some of the yelp reviews. however  it was raining and restaurant devi is close to the apt julia are staying at  and julia are so glad julia made the choice ! julia ordered the veggie samosa for an appetizer and thy were incredible...almost like a dessert. julia had a blonde beer  my husband an ipa  though my husband says a blonde beer my husband did not  taste like an ipa . julia both ordered vegetarian meals  rice and garlic naan. the server  jeff  was very welcoming and provided service above and beyond what julia experience in the states. julia did not  finish julia both's food simply because julia were full and upon noticing the server  jeff checked to make sure julia were satisfied with julia both's choices. julia will surely be returning !

restaurant devi, yatin, very good food.. lunch thali was a deal.. very filling and perfect for   person.. good sizes.. yatin had the seekh kabab  lamb roganjosh  dal makhani rice naan ras malai.. all for      per person.. taste is good unlike kashmir in old montreal..

restaurant devi, bg, bg order a couple of times a year from restaurant devi. bg am not expert of indian food  but personally bg love restaurant devi's food. this time  the food was good as always. and bg would rate starts bg was not disappointed about the changes restaurant devi made to the menu :   - bg had to choose between a naan and rice... bg wanted both so bg had to pay for rice  which arrived in a quite small portion  not even big enough for one person. restaurant devi used to provide both a naan and a decent rice portion with each main dish. - no yogurt sauce anymore sorry bg do not  know the actual name   bg will admit though  that the entr e were bigger than usual. still  all these changes came with a     price increase compared to last time... so bg think bg will  be shopping to see if bg can get more value for the money at other indian restaurants.

restaurant devi, sneha, went to restaurant devi for a mid afternoon snack and to escape the rain. was pleasantly surprised at the modern interior and indian decor. from the outside  restaurant devi does not  look like much but the inside is really well kept. restaurant devi was playing olden day bollywood music and added to the cute ambience of restaurant devi. sneha ordered tomato soup and used the yelp check in deal to get free chai. both items were excellent since both items arrived hot to the table and were delicious ! unfortunately  sneha did not  get a chance to order anything else since sneha were not  that hungry but sneha would definitely return to restaurant devi for a full meal. sneha also saw the lunch buffet on display when sneha went and for    . the lunch buffet on display sounds like a steal !

restaurant devi, david, atmosphere is good  waiters and waitresses were nice  price was not  too bad if you just stick to entrees  appetizers . naan  as always  is good. tried to get the lady server to try some of the food the lady server had not  had before the lady server declined. out of   big globe lights.

restaurant devi, david, restaurant devi is a wonderful place with fantastic food ! be prepared to take your time to enjoy every mouthful. restaurant devi  an expensive place for dinner but worth it. try the lunch special for a real treat. the staff is very friendly too. do not  expect to get in and out quick. just sit back and enjoy.

restaurant devi, long, restaurant devi is very good  although restaurant devi is quite expensive compared to other indian restaurants. one order can easily go up to      the portion is not large but enough for a nice dinner. naan and rice are not included so you usually have to buy extras. the quality of the food is great though  long had some lamb and butter chicken and were very satisfied with the meal as well as the service.

restaurant devi, irina, restaurant devi  is on the hip and popular crescent street. going up a dozen steps  you enter a very lovely interior  beautifully decorated and accented with gorgeously carvel wooden doors  shutters and columns. the unusual arrangements of colorful lamp clusters hanging from the ceiling definitely add an element of understated pizzas to the elegant decor. irina snagged a table for two in the window  and promptly placed our order :   keema naan for appetizer; vegetable jalfraze  chana masala and a small rice to share for the main course  paired with red wine. while waiting  irina were served papadum with the usual green and red sauces but restaurant devi makes a lovely sin on the standard offering :  restaurant devi's papadum is shaped into cones. quite different.... stands out. keema naan for appetizer arrived  and keema naan for appetizer was superb :  the meat was perfectly seasoned  fresh and moist; the dough was tasty  baked to crispy edges  but not dried out. a perfect start. vegetable jalfraze  chana masala was good very spicy  even a bit too much for me  the fire - eater. irina can deal with that  but the consistency of vegetable jalfraze  chana masala was a bit too liquidy. still  went quite well over rice. the stir - fried jalfraze veggies were excellent :  perfect mix of flavors and heat  with thicker sauce  and veggies still retaining their texture. irina took our time to enjoy and savor the meal  sip our wine  and people - watch through the large bay window. satiated with a fantastic dinner  irina ventured into the snowy and frigid montreal streets. one star off for a slow service :  only three tables were occupied.

restaurant devi, eoz, by far  one of the best samosas eoz have  ever eaten; restaurant devi's naan bread is simply delicious  and eoz have  only tried two  plain and spinach  of the several kinds restaurant devi offer. the tandoori chicken was fantastic  cooked to perfection in my honest opinion  and the portion was generous enough that you could easily share the portion. one tip  do not  disregard the little white sauce that accompanies your chicken  mixed with the tandoori chicken and the vegetables make a superb flavor combination. restaurant devi  there is  just so many dishes to try out.

restaurant devi, chanel, great food. had lamb vindaloo and chanel's friend had lamb rogan josh so tasty that chanel had to come the next day before chanel leave the city ! must have the butter nann it has a special creamy sweet taste  heaven !

restaurant devi, aaron, sitting outdoors on rue crescent was delightful. the chicken tikka was well spiced. aaron m used to the chicken tikka being creamier. the portion was plentiful with rice and naan each ordered on the side. aaron found naan pretty strong. if you are  sensitive to naan  get the regular. the service was quick and polite if not as friendly as the surrounding area that tends to go out of their way to please.

restaurant devi, peter, food was uniformly excellent. appetizers and mains. great naan. had lamb jalfrezi and chicken chettinad. lamb jalfrezi and chicken chettinad great. channa masala was ok. prices are high for indian but it has a real upscale feel a great downtown location and delicious food. people at every well for just over      plus wine and tip. definitely recommended.
restaurant devi, justin, my wife and justin had my wife and justin's new years eve dinner here. the food and service were both fantastic.

restaurant devi, rachel, rachel had a delightful dinner here. the costumer service was top notch the ambiance was perfect for a date or a group of friends. very beautifully decorated ! the somosas were great and the cauliflower appetizer was also good  although the cauliflower appetizer was heavily breaded. rachel did not  want both naan and basmati with our main dishes because rachel feared both naan and basmati with our main dishes would be too much food but rachel regret not getting the rice. naan was delicious but rachel got the eggplant and the yellow lentil dish. the yellow lentil dish was very liquidy almost soupy. the flavor was amazing though. overall this was a great evening ! rachel would  for sure check it out  :  -

restaurant devi, kevin, the food was pretty good. kevin really liked the interior decoration of restaurant devi. restaurant devi also have special set deals that kevin really enjoyed. wide selection  really difficult to choose something to eat. the only downside though is that it is fairly pricey. kevin would recommend restaurant devi as a place to try  restaurant devi.

restaurant devi, r, enjoyed lunch on canada day. choices for lunch were excellent and presentation of food was superb. rogan josh  shrimp masala butter chicken  daal makhaani were very tasty. naan bread served with lunch had a special taste also. desserts -  gulab jamun and rasmali were nice too. service was good as well and price was very reasonable.

restaurant devi, lana, craving an indian snack  lana stumbled across restaurant devi on a particularly hot day in montreal. located on the shady side of very busy and popular crescent street  lana were concerned that lana would  be the only people on the small patio and therefore felt lana were taking lana's chances  but were determined to have indian over pub food. having had some terrible service while visiting montreal  lana was not  holding out for exceptional service here either. lana was pleasantly surprised. the wait staff was very attentive and the appetizers lana had were incredible and fresh. lana ordered the samosas  vegetable skewer  the potato patties and spicy chicken mikka. all were very satisfying. the only disappointment was restaurant devi's lack of variety for indian beer... the only available ones being on draught. lana chose heineken to compliment lana's afternoon snack. looking forward to trying a full dinner here next time lana are in montreal.

restaurant devi, lu, abfab indian food  lovely decor love the ceiling lanterns and the food even more. lu would  have to say  so far  that in lu's not so humble opinion this place is the best indian restaurant in the downtown area. lamb patties  okra.... not the usual slimey okra  but believe it or not  crispy and just delicious you will  change your mind about the vegetable forever. lamb with cumin a potato dish lu can not  remember the name but the name was a revelation  as lu was not even aware potatoes were even consumed in india as accompaniments. live and learn. spiced eggplant  always order it  several varieties of naan  which one to pick :  the plain is super   but the onion   garlic  and lu have  forgotten which others. such a dilemma ! lu have  been here several times already and lu have  never been disappointed. this place is not cheap  but worth it service always good.

restaurant devi, robert, restaurant devi ! food was excellent  made exactly how robert requested food. restaurant devi have a wide selection of both meat and vegetarian dishes. service was good  attentive but not annoying. location is great and atmosphere is nice but not overly formal. robert will  be back for sure.

bombay's chutney, sarah, the lamb biryani that sarah had was delicious and very filling. sarah especially enjoyed the metal ornate bowl that the lamb biryani that sarah had was served in. price - wise everything could have been a bit cheaper  maybe by a dollar or two .

bombay's chutney, devan, bombay's chutney is a neat little indian restaurant located in the heart of richmond hill. devan have eaten here on many occasions devan's guests and devan have always enjoyed our meal and the experience. religiously  devan will start devan's dinner with an order of beef samosa. beef samosa arrive at your table piping hot served along side some stellar tamarind chutney. the beef filling is bountiful and seasoned well; beef samosa will forever be a staple of devan. from the tandoor devan would typically select the chicken tikka  seekh kebabs or paneer tikka. for mains the butter chicken here will make the cut every time. the blend of masala and spices is near perfect and the boneless chicken pieces are tender and definitely pre - marinated. devan have eaten butter chicken everywhere  and bc  bc holds bc  bc's own. it is important to note that if devan were vegetarian devan would be most pleased with bc  bc. devan find most veggie heads love paneer  as do devan. bombay's chutney boasts   vegetarian curries which showcase paneer :  chili paneer  paneer makhni  butter sauce   saag paneer  spinach   karahi paneer and mattar paneer  peas . in addition to the plethora of paneer dishes bc  bc have several other vegetarian ones including devan's absolute favourite  malai kofta. to accompany the dishes you can order biryani or naan. unfortunately devan have never tried biryani because bc  bc's garlic naan has always been way too spot on to deviate away from. their garlic naan is brought to your table straight from the tandoor and is always perfectly cooked. if you order the garlic rendition the garlic rendition will be brushed with butter then absolutely riddled with garlic bits before going into the tandoor. garlic bits caramelize and crisp up and my goodness it is  perfect. overall a solid experience each and every time devan visit bc  bc. the only quam devan have with bc  bc is that bc  bc now have a huge sign at the front of bc  bc advertising a   . lunch devan feel that this takes away from the class of bc  bc a bit but you gotta do what you gotta do. service is always awesome and bc  bc have a bar complete with various wines  liquors and beers including kingfisher ! nice.

bombay's chutney, emperuman, my family and emperuman have been to bombay's chutney   times since my family and emperuman's first visit which was back in     . this year this year itself  emperuman have been here   times. this shows that the service  and taste of food meets my family and emperuman's expectations. being indians  and vegetarians emperuman enjoy the quality of food  and can easily spot if something is wrong in terms of taste  especially if a short cut method has been applied. sure it gets busy inside  and there is a wait  but its always good to make a reservation on weekends. emperuman normally order the paneer tikka skewers  a gravy dish such as dhal makhani and a dry vegetable dish such as gobi or bhaingan bharta  spelling . the quality of food has been consistent throughout for the most part  except for the naan. usually emperuman ask that the naan have some butter applied to make the naan not dry  but even doing so the naan still is semi dry. the staff are very friendly  and emperuman have had no issues with the orders taking longer than usual. the food is always piping hot  and therefore there is no need to complain about the temperature of the food. the spice level is perfect. definitely recommend bombay's chutney to locals and to those who want to venture out a little bit.

maison de cari golden, jonathan, experience was beyond subpar. food took an hour to arrive to the table. some dishes were warm  while others were cool. saag paneer tasted like frozen spinach mixed with saputo mini bocconcini. butter chicken was a putrid yellow colour and the kitchen must have the kitchen's own direct pipeline into the redpath sugar plant because one bite of the sauce gave jonathan immediate cavities. the waiter forgot to bring items but remembered to try and bill us for items. the one positive is that the naan was warm and fairly chewy. normally  jonathan will  try a restaurant at least twice before passing judgement. however  after jonathan's first experience at maison de cari golden jonathan jonathan not sure if that second chance will ever come. hence  the lowest jonathan can give is   stars.

maison de cari golden, a, awful. used to be good decades ago. now they just do not  try. every other indian restaurant on this street is better. every other indian restaurant on this street use bad ingredients. one of the vegetable pakoras was actually rotten. everything was limp and lifeless and the flavors were one dimensional. even the naan was dry. even the naan must have been from the day before.

maison de cari golden, celine, maison de cari golden is tiny and adorable and celine love going there. the food is really good  but always a little bit sweet for my taste. even the naan tasted sweet once. but celine still love even the naan...

maison de cari golden, justine, stars ! one of justine's favourite indian places to get takeout ! one of my favourite indian places to get takeout ! make justine's favourite of all time onion bhajis with a special yoghurt base sauce. justine also always order the naan bread and papadum. justine usually get either the chicken tandoori butter chicken lamb korma  and  or rices. one of my favourite indian places to get takeout ! 's butter chicken is a bit too sweet for justine but it is  ok to share. it  always so delicious here love love love it !

maison de cari golden, tina, worst indian food tina have  ever had  awful sweet nan bread palak panner was sweet  dry and with shredded paneer the chicken curry was so badly cooked that the chicken curry was inedible  -  service was incredibly slow and rude. maison de cari golden  also very expensive compared to other indian restaurants. if you want authentic curry do not  waste your time or money here. go to park ex where you a choice of delicious  affordable indian food

maison de cari golden, tahrim, tahrim had naan  tandoori and saag paneer from golden cari as takeout and naan  tandoori and saag paneer was amazing ! their naan tastes super fresh even later and naan  tandoori has a great finish.

maison de cari golden, lucy, lucy love maison de cari golden although maison de cari golden is a little dingy and scary looking. lucy would not  have even tried maison de cari golden if it was not  for a friend who insisted maison de cari golden was good. the only downfall is that many dishes here are sweet when lucy am not sure many dishes here should be  namely the butter chicken  the naan and the yogurt sauce. lucy usually order the naan anyways  with tandoori chicken  samosa  bhaji and the very best beef madras in town super spicy but the taste is just amazing .

tamarind savoring india, v, last night v had a take out of butter chicken. v ordered butter chicken as medium spice. the butter chicken sauce tasted like sweet tomato sauce. the butter chicken sauce reminded v of panera bread tomato soup. the butter chicken sauce was that sweet. tamarind used to have good delicious food. v do not  mind paying more for delicious food but delicious food's quality has gone down. it  more expensive than other local establishment and food quality has degraded as well.

tamarind savoring india, anne, anne called them at    : am on a thursday and asked if anne could order lunch for    to go  which is not something they normally do. the waiter checked with the chef and they were able to accommodate anne and it was ready by noon. anne left a huge tip and was so thankful that they were able to help anne out. anne ordered saag paneer  chicken tikka masala  naan  and rice. the people who ate the food said the food was the best indian the people who ate the food have had in tamarind. anne will defiantly be back.

tamarind savoring india, aditi, aditi love tamarind savoring india ! aditi have been here for lunch and dinner and it is  awesome for both. would like to come for breakfast next time too ! aditi have had tamarind savoring india's dosa and idlis and their dosa and idlis are really good ! the chutney and sambar and all that are awesome and tamarind savoring india's service is friendly and fast. aditi would definitely recommend coming here for authentic indian food  especially south indian !

tamarind savoring india, lenae, lenae's most favorite place to eat. the service is terrific. tamarind savoring india really aim to please. paneer tikki masala is lenae's favorite. tamarind savoring india make a wonderful  smoky buttered naan. lenae's kids love the mango lassi. lenae crave this food when lenae are not there.

tamarind savoring india, sm, sm go back and forth on how sm feel about tamarind. sm love tamarind's chicken tikka masala and tamarind's samosa. delicious. their chicken tikka masala and their samosa  pretty much what sm get every time. when sm deviate from their chicken tikka masala and their samosa it is  hit or miss for me. with that said  everyone sm have  ever taken there has liked tamarind. the vibe of tamarind is nice. there always some entertaining indian music video airing in the back corner  and the tables are nice. portions are generous  and there is  always leftovers for the next day. nom ! however -  and this is a big however : the employees are really unfriendly. like  unfriendly to the point where sm wonder if sm m supposed to apologize for coming in to patronize the employees's establishment. combine that with the extremely high prices  and sm come away feeling a little fleeced. if udipi were close enough to order from all the time  sm probably would not  go to tamarind again. alas...

tamarind savoring india, kristin, my fiance and kristin had a wonderful dinner at tamarind savoring india. it was my fiance and kristin's first time visiting and there were plenty of open tables and the staff were incredibly friendly. kristin ordered the chicken chettinadu  which was rich and flavorful. the chicken chettinadu  which was rich and flavorful was cooked perfectly - tender and delicious. my fiance had the chicken tikka  and as a newcomer to indian food my fiance loved the chicken tikka ! kristin rounded out a wonderful dinner at the tamarind savoring india with a couple roti and spiced paneer for an appetizer. great experience overall  kristin will  be back !  !

tamarind savoring india, john, the food was fresh  well prepared and delicious. the service was friendly and attentive. not a fan of the ambiance  but john m not there to eat the decor. john went on a saturday night around  pm it was busy but not packed. john had samosas and samosas were freshly made  crispy on the outside and tender inside with a little spice. john tried the szechuan chicken  basically fried chicken pieces with onion  green peppers and hot peppers which again were freshly made  crispy outside and tender inside. john was looking for palak paneer  cheese in creamy spinach which they call saag paneer  and they were helpful in pointing john to what john was looking for. it was a large portion with tender rice. john also had the garlic naan  which was good but john wished they had cooked the garlic a bit before putting on the bread the garlic came out kind of raw. regardless it was delicious  including the mango lassi. john like spicy so john asked for some chili sauce which went wonderfully with everything so be sure to ask for some chili sauce which went wonderfully with everything if you like spicy. a bit on the expensive side considering there are paper napkins but the portions were generous enough that john had plenty for a meal of leftovers. all of the servers were friendly and professional  no complaints there. john's one complaint was the music  -  a bit obnoxious and a little loud for john's taste. overall a very good indian meal. the strip mall it is in is on top of a hill with only a sign with all the shop names visible so keep your eyes peeled if you are from out of town.

tamarind savoring india, keeka, tamarind savoring india was a great place to go for thanksgiving  besides tamarind savoring india's usual amazing indian food in a beautiful buffet spread  there was tandoori turkey  cooked to perfection. the food is always amazing and the service is ridiculously friendly. one of keeka's favorite indian restaurants in pittsburgh.
tamarind savoring india, bela, very good food. very friendly staff . prompt service and smiling faces. idli was soft and food was hot and fresh.

tamarind savoring india, erik, the food was amazing the service was really friendly and helpful  as erik do not  understand most indian cuisine items . erik tried new stuff that surprised me. the atmosphere was the only thing lacking in making this experience better.

tamarind savoring india, rajagopal, some of the worst indian food in tamarind savoring india ! ... everything is extremely terrible ! ... when rajagopal mentioned to the owner that the roti  were hard  the owner said it is  very difficult to maintain quality of rotis in pittsburgh weather ! .. how on earth is that a valid justification  rajagopal can never tell ! ... best to avoid tamarind savoring india at all costs ! ... there is a perfectly fine place down the street serving edible food !  !

tamarind savoring india, mary, tamarind is an ok place to eat in strip mall in pittsburgh. the waiter did not seem to understand us  and mary had trouble understanding the waiter. mary had the tandoor variety appetizer that was spiced so hot that it really hurt. then mary had the chicken tikka and mary's partner had the lamb vindaloo. the lamb vindaloo was hot  the chicken tikka was perfect. mary like that tamarind have indian beers - - mary was pleased to have a kingfisher. tamarind was just ok.

tamarind savoring india, tushar, do not  know what the fuss is about. tried the menu vada sambhar and rava masala dosa. vada sambhar and rava masala dosa were good and tasty  but disappointed with vada sambhar. vada sambhar was not  spicy and did not  have the zing needed  kept on thinking something was missing. chutney was not  great either. mango lassi felt more watery and a bit too sweet. staff was really weird. staff were not attentive had to keep calling staff several times only to go unnoticed. the restaurant was not  busy at all and tushar still do not  know why staff was so reluctant to help customers. the restaurant did get busy by   : pm when tushar left. did not  try any of the curries  since tushar was disappointed with vada sambhar. the mango kulfi was not  all that bad though. the restaurant is also a bit out of the way  as the gps does not  lead you to the right location and the name on the board is not  bright enough on a busy street to get noticed. not coming back.

tamarind savoring india, john, thoroughly enjoyed ourselves at the tamarind on greentree rd. south of pittsburgh. john will  be the first to admit that john have  never traveled to india so john m not qualified to judge whether this is authentic indian cooking or not but john do know delicious  tasty fresh well prepared food when it is served to john. and tamarind puts out some delicious food. john had some appetizer sampler platters both a vegetarian   non - vegetarian as well as a curry dish a biryani dish a saag dish  and one other vegetarian dish. all of the food was wonderful  bursting with fresh flavors. john do not get indian food very often  so it is  a real treat when john do  and tamarind made it extra special. all   of us enjoyed everything that john had. overall  tamarind is  a great place to go  and john would  highly recommend tamarind. when john dine out john m looking usually looking for really good food  good service a nice ambiance and that is the order of importance for us. john can live with mediocre service   no ambiance  so long as the food is good. but bad food cannot be compensated by service   ambiance. tamarind had really good food  and good service. the ambiance is the weakest card in the deck for them but tamarind is  a restaurant in a strip mall  and the food was so good john will  be back there again any chance john get.

tamarind savoring india, sharon, wow ! sharon m not usually one to give a restaurant   stars after trying a restaurant   stars only once  but tamarind savoring india totally deserves a restaurant   stars ! sharon went here with a couple of friends who are regulars and a couple of friends who are regulars and their baby's baby. the staff was so excited to meet the staff's new edition and the staff came over to say hi and get some facetime with sharon. sharon ordered some appetizers to share which included the vegetable pakora and the idly manchurian which had a nice kick and texture. the vegetable pakora and the idly manchurian were delicious. sharon really liked the idly manchurian which had a nice kick and texture. for sharon's entree sharon ordered the paneer tikka masala and an order of poori. the paneer tikka masala was the best tikka masala sauce sharon have ever had. sharon was enjoying eating an order of poori over rice  even though there was plenty of paneer in the paneer tikka masala. poori was much different than any other poori sharon have ever had  but poori was also delicious ! sharon can not  wait to go back  but knowing how good the paneer tikka masala is sharon am probably already roped into ordering the paneer tikka masala again !
tamarind savoring india, anilkumar, food is ok  not that great compared... but service is too bad .. you cant imagine how slow and how unresponsive it is. even food is ok service is bad so   star
tamarind savoring india, adarsh, adarsh's first time here and a great time. adarsh's friend recommended tamarind savoring india to adarsh.. adarsh really liked the gobi manchurian a lot.

tamarind savoring india, courtney, courtney have  had indian all over the world  and tried just about every one in pittsburgh. tamarind is by far the best. friendly staff and large portions. buffet is good  but ordering off of the menu is better. the samosa and chicken vindaloo are excellent.

tamarind savoring india, caroline, may be my new favorite indian restaurant in pittsburgh ! loved my new favorite indian restaurant in pittsburgh. the vegetable biryani and chicken tikka masala were both delicious  flavorful and spiced to perfection. portions were huge  -  caroline had plenty to take home. the service was friendly and attentive. my new favorite indian restaurant in pittsburgh was packed on a tuesday night  but my new favorite indian restaurant in pittsburgh still sat us quickly. caroline will definitely be back !

tamarind savoring india, linda, did not  even realize there was an indian restaurant so close to us ! linda ordered the chicken tikka and lamb biryani and a slice of their death linda's chocolate cake. could not  have been happier ! everything was moist  flavorful and delicious. even though linda ordered for pick up the waiters were still so nice courteous. linda will definitely linda going back  :

tamarind savoring india, kelly, both times kelly have visited both the food and the service have been absolutely excellent ! kelly tried the chicken tikki masala and the garlic naan  - the garlic naan is to die for ! and the garlic taste is the perfect accompaniment to this dish. both times kelly visited  tamarind savoring india were in the middle of renovating the restaurant; from what kelly hear that has now wrapped up  so kelly will be visiting again soon to check out the updates ! the restaurant

tamarind savoring india, sunil, sunil have been going to tamarind savoring india for last     years. sunil always liked tamarind savoring india. sunil thought sunil should share sunil's opinion with all yelpers. tamarind savoring india is in green tree area. tamarind savoring india is really nice and cozy. tamarind savoring india have a party room available on same premises. if someone wants to have a party for    people tamarind savoring india provide you enough private place and cater food. parking is a bit struggle though. tamarind savoring india  in a strip mall where parking is shared with bunch of other places. staff is very well managed and staff are always ready to help you if you are new to indian food. the owners are from south india and so the food is inspired by the south indian receipes. the owners also are very flexible with how much hot spicy you food you want. so tell the owners up front and the owners make sure your taste buds are not burned. tamarind savoring india have some great appetizers. chicken    is sunil's dish. other appetizers are also great and sometime sunil order too much other appetizers since everyone has there own preference. if you like hot spicy stuff order   cut mirchi . cut mirchi are chiilies deep fried in a lentil batter served with onions and lemon. excellent ! the rice dishes are also very authetic and one should give it a try for tamarind savoring india's biryani items. biryani is indian version of paella. tamarind savoring india serve pure veg biryani as well. chicken curries are excellent and sunil always like dish called chicken curry. chicken tikka masala is also another dish you can not  go wrong with. veg entrees are also excellent and sunil like spinach with panir  channa masala. breads are also well prepared and you will be happy no matter what bread you get. sunil love tamarind savoring india's butter naan. overall tamarind savoring india do a excellent job and prices are very reasonable. sunil recommend tamarind savoring india to anyone who is looking for a nice indian food joint.

tamarind savoring india, andrea, andrea love indian food. love indian food. andrea really wanted to like tamarind because tamarind is really close to our house and one of the only indian places in the area. andrea was so disappointed in tamarind tamarind is unreal. the server did not understand what grapefruit juice was  for andrea's cocktail andrea just gave up and ordered soda with andrea's vodka. soda with my vodka no big deal. however  andrea ordered muttar panir  and muttar panir was easily the worst andrea have ever had. muttar panir tasted like velveeta with tofu in muttar panir. tasteless and gross. my husband and andrea were spoiled by the authentic indian restaurants in my husband and andrea's previous town  and are also puzzled by the indian patrons in tamarind. the indian patrons in this restaurant cannot possibly be eating the same food andrea were served. andrea did not eat our food and will not return. andrea continue to look for a good authentic indian restaurant in pittsburgh. sigh .

tamarind savoring india, dushyanth, went to tamarind savoring india at a relatively low - traffic time. unfortunately  the service at tamarind savoring india is not very good. takes a long time just to get water have someone take your order or even get you your check. on multiple occasions  dushyanth did not  receive more drinks etc unless dushyanth asked multiple times. with regards to the food dushyanth had vegetable pakora to start and then had four orders of naan  navaratan korma gobi manchurian  and tandoori chicken. tandoori chicken was well done and tamarind savoring india give you a lot of naan. overall the food is quite flavorful and can make up for the restaurant  bad service. gobi manchurian is a bit spicy for the average person so beware you only get   gobis. navaratan korma is very flavorful and the creamy sauce goes well with naan; however  dushyanth was a bit disappointed that the amount of vegetables was so minimal. the food seemed to be mostly a cream sauce with scarce green beans and potato here and there. overall  tamarind savoring india has flavorful food but tamarind savoring india do not  do the little things well.

angara india spice grill, alberto, alberto came here for dinner recently and had a very pleasant time. the staff was very cordial and polite. angara india spice grill at the time alberto went  around   : pm on a friday night  was quiet but alberto believe more people come here for more people's lunch buffet. the food was delicious and alberto happy to rely on yelp to find angara india spice grill.

angara india spice grill, ankita, ankita do not  even know where to begin... ankita had been here before and the first time around the food was amazing ! everything was fresh and prepared exactly how ankita had requested so ankita were excited to be back. ankita live in henderson and made the drive here to eat here again. ankita walked into angara india spice grill around  pm for dinner with ankita's parents and grandparents. ankita ordered a very basic dinner of dal makhani  chicken tikka masala  tandoori chicken  a couple of roti and a garlic naan. it  really hard for us to judge spice levels in some indian restaurants so ankita always order medium. when the tandoori chicken arrived the tandoori chicken was bland  and ankita mean like completely bland to the point where ankita were drowning the tandoori chicken in mint chutney. ankita asked our server to change the spice level on our entrees since medium was bland. so food arrived and guess what. food was bland !
