ankita asked our server whether our server had changed the spice level in the kitchen and ankita did not  quite get a clear answer. ankita's grandmother tasted the dal and my grandmother almost spit the dal back out on my grandmother's plate and stated that the dal tasted old like the dal had been reheated and the consistency was off as well. dal is supposed to be bisque like consistency and the dal was just this unappetizing blob. the owner happened to be around and ankita's dad told the owner that the food was terrible. the owner offered no apologies but instead offered to reheat the dal and make the dal spicier. ankita quietly finished our  dinner  and made it very clear to our server that ankita would not  be back our server did not  seem to care. ankita's grandfather hated angara india spice grill so much that my grandmother actually said eating off the dollar menu at mcdonalds would have  been a better dinner. needless to say ankita would not  return to angara india spice grill ever again. if you are  looking for good  fresh indian food ankita suggest taj palace on eastern and richmar.

angara india spice grill, kara, angara india spice grill is clean and the price for lunch buffet is super good ! the waiters are very friendly the waiters offer a choice of garlic or original naan. the samosa is very big the samosa goes well with the sauce. the interior is grand it is fun watching indian music videos while eating.

angara india spice grill, jason, there is a lot of great things to say about angara india spice grill. the owner staff are super nice and on top of there game. jason have tried the chicken biryani   butter chicken   chicken vindaloo   and the tandoori chicken.. the chicken biryani butter chicken   chicken vindaloo   and the tandoori chicken were amazing to be honest. flavorful   spicy   to your liking   and delicious. the rice was cooked perfect ! the garlic naan goes great with everything. defiantly give angara india spice grill a try.

angara india spice grill, jessie, jessie got the chicken tikka masala via ubereats and the chicken tikka masala came and jessie could feel how hot the chicken tikka masala was through the takeout container  which jessie loved. however  when jessie actually started eating jessie was waiting for the flavor to kick in and the flavor never did. the flavor was rather underwhelming and jessie was quite disappointed. the flavor had a nice spice level but the dimensions of flavor were really just not there. maybe jessie got a bad batch but jessie would rather not order from here again. angara india spice grill also did not  include any utensils or napkins so that was inconvenient for jessie. the food was not  horrible at all but jessie m not coming here again  sorry.

angara india spice grill, paul, this is my  th visit to angara india spice grill and paul must say angara india spice grill is the best indian food in town. the waiters are really nice and friendly. my wife told me about angara india spice grill and it took a little convincing but paul m glad that paul came here  there food is great and the prices are reasonable. paul would definitely recommend angara india spice grill.

angara india spice grill, harpal, harpal have  been here many times for angara india spice grill's lunch buffet since harpal moved to vegas and this food is excellent. almost as good as harpal's mom  cooking. service is excellent and very friendly. you can not  go wrong here. the goat curry is amazing ! highly recommended.
angara india spice grill, a, the delivery was timely  but the tandoori chicken was rather tasteless  got medium spice . go with one of the spicier options to avoid the blandness.

angara india spice grill, eric, food was good the service was excellent...wish eric can give you guys that last star but... food was good....missing something..... but maybe eric can come back for lunch buffet... eric felt like the oven baked chicken needed a little more... eric will  be back tho try it and hopefully give you guys that last star

angara india spice grill, phil, what a great place. these people who run angara india spice grill are extremely pleasant and attentive and the dinner was fabulous. phil could not  figure out what phil wanted as everything sounded so good so phil ordered a couple bowls of mulligawnee soup and their non - vegetarian dinner for two and garlic naan. everything was cooked to perfection and these people who run this place's timing of serving as phil went through each course was completely on - point. awesome !

angara india spice grill, erik, not very impressed. angara india spice grill has lots of offerings for indian food but this does not rise to the rest of the pack. came here for lunch and had the buffett. a buffet should be a good representation of the food that angara india spice grill offers and if that is the case than erik will not be back. erik had the saag  chicken tika masala  and the goat curry. along with the garlic naan. both the chicken and goat were bland and the saag  chicken tika masala was so spicy that the saag  chicken tika masala killed erik's tastebuds for the rest of the meal. the garlic naan was gummy and under done. so if you are in the mood for indian.. try lazee or mint.

angara india spice grill, kat, hands down best indian food in the city. kat hit the weekday lunch buffet every couple of weeks  kat can not  tell you how many times kat have  said how badly kat am craving angara india spice grill on a saturday . it  definitely a treat to feast at the weekday lunch buffet...quite a few chicken dishes the chicken tikka is the best kat have  ever had anywhere  a few vegetarian options and even a goat dish kat's other half  favorite . do not  forget to save room for dessert too ! the kheer  a rice pudding with cardamom and ground nuts is amazing and the mr.  who usually skips dessert  always gets a bowl of the gulab jamun  a ball of milk solids fried and soaked in honey . the owners and the servers are always happy  courteous and quick to remove plates and refill your glasses. kat always leave with a huge smile on our face and a full belly...and usually have the  kat can not  wait till kat can go back  conversation on the drive home. it  that good !

angara india spice grill, linden, linden now have angara india spice grill. the food was especially good  particularly the samosas which were large and crisp. linden eat a lot of indian food  and angara india spice grill is fantastic ! linden also loved the bollywood films that were showing on the tvs. angara india spice grill have a lunch buffet  which linden will have to come try soon. angara india spice grill is family owned  and the service was exceptional. do not  miss angara india spice grill !

angara india spice grill, edith, edith have not  had indian food since moving to vegas a       years ago so edith have  been craving indian food for somtime. edith had been my search for an indian buffet nearby  thank you to whomever added angara india spice grill as a business for ending edith's search. angara india spice grill is on grand canyon behind mcdonalds  next door to tropical smooth and two doors from bite. buffets is available only during lunch and is only    . person. if you have never had indian food angara india spice grill is a very good deal and allows you to try all the popular indian dishes. in fact  edith recommend trying a little bit of everything. the staff at angara india spice grill is very helpful. if you wanna know about a dish the staff at angara are more than happy to answer your questions. as you are seated  you are offered two types of naan  plain or garlic. edith chose plain as edith had to return to the office  and edith wanted to be sure edith could taste the flavors of the other dishes. at the beginning of the buffet angara india spice grill have large sized samosas edith's all time favorite  indian pastry filled with potatoes and peas    followed by the vegetarian entrees like saan paneer edith's all time favorite indian vegetarian dish  creamy spinach with cheese cubes lentil and eggplant dishes. edith m not a hot spicy dish person. in the past  edith have known saan paneer as a mild dish  but angara india spice grill makes saan paneer spicy that edith had to eat saan paneer with the naan instead of the rice. unfortunately  because edith filled up on the samosa  vegetarian dishes  rice and naan the only meat dish edith could get to was the chicken tikka. proof that one can get very full on vegetarian dishes alone. next time  edith will  have to start with the meats. other meat dishes available were chicken tandoori and goat curry. one dish edith wish angara india spice grill had is fried fish bites. at the end of the buffet were desserts that edith m unfamiliar with  but will try in a future visit  and  regular house salad which baffles edith with all the vegetarian dishes available  but to each his her own.

angara india spice grill, martin, my wife and martin went for lunch. the food is excellent and service was excellent. my wife and martin had a small but well done lunch buffet. all the dishes were well done. slightly spicy for my wife  perfect for me. my wife and martin both tried a little bit of everything and were pleased with all the dishes. the goat was not my favorite  even so it was well done. angara india spice grill was clean  played nice relaxing music with some interesting artwork. martin look forward to coming back for dinner.

angara india spice grill, silly, silly had the dinner for two non - vegetarian.. the dinner for two non - vegetarian comes with garlic naan bread butter chicken curry    other vegie dishes kabob  cinnamon rice and rice pudding desserts. did not  expect that much food for    . the curry was silly's favorite though the curry was not  as spicy as you would expect on curry dish but the curry was pretty good. the service was good. silly might come back to try the buffet lunch.

angara india spice grill, john, john had the chicken tiki masala and the tandoori chicken from the lunch buffet. the chicken tiki masala and the tandoori chicken from the lunch buffet were tasty and slightly above average considering the chicken tiki masala and the tandoori chicken from the lunch buffet came from a buffet were food tends to be less spicy and also has to be continuously heated for a while. john will be back to try some menu items and provide a review of some menu items as well.

angara india spice grill, joshua, new favorite ! angara india spice grill  only been open for several weeks. the indian buffet was outstanding. the value of    . with as much rice and naan as you want was a huge surprise. the service was friendly and prompt. the food.... joshua had everything and everything was phenomenal. ca not  wait to go again next week !

angara india spice grill, patrick, angara india spice grill is our new favorite restaurant find for      ! the samosa are amazing ! my wife loves the chicken curry the lamb rogan josh is excellent. angara india spice grill's service is great too ! patrick will definitely be back often.

angara india spice grill, milen, angara india spice grill is an unbelievably good establishment. the people are so genuinely kind and milen loved the people's recommendations. milen ate the chicken tikka masala per a friend  request and was surprised by how well put together the chicken tikka masala was. to keep this shorter  milen highly recommend coming here. angara india spice grill  a wonderful place.

angara india spice grill, michell, love angara india spice grill ! every time michell eat from here whether it is take out  dine in  buffet or delivery. the food from here is consistently delicious. the staff is always so friendly. michell recommend angara india spice grill whole heartedly.

angara india spice grill, dustin, dustin were so fortunate to stumble upon angara india spice grill. dustin arrived just as the lunch buffet started. the atmosphere is stunning. the atmosphere gives you a fine dining feel when you walk in. dustin tried the chicken curry first and the chicken curry was delicious ! then dustin tried just about everything else and was equally impressed. angara india spice grill is also reasonably priced. great service ! great food !

angara india spice grill, mike, mike are in town for a wedding and angara india spice grill was near our hotel. found angara india spice grill while out for a walk and decided to try angara india spice grill out. mike were very pleased with the experience. my wife and daughter had the vegetarian meal for two. the vegetarian meal for two included a variety of their vegetarian dishes  rice  daal and naan. the vegetarian meal for two was very good and the portions were ample. my wife and daughter brought enough back to our hotel for lunch the next day. mike tried the goat curry and loved the goat curry. if you are squeamish about got angara india spice grill have a number of lamb  chicken and fish options as well. mike highly recommend angara india spice grill if you are in vegas.

angara india spice grill, michelle, michelle had the lunch buffet on sunday and well worth the    . . loved the curry chicken and the tikka masala chicken the garlic naan is so soft and flavorful. love angara india spice grill  great food and great customer service !

angara india spice grill, alice, one of alice's favorite indian places in the summerlin area. buffet is great  especially since angara india spice grill have everything alice would order anyway  vindaloo  korma  tikka masala . naan and rice is included so naan and rice is  totally worth the price. heads up  the curries for buffet do rotate every day so it is  not always the same and if you have anything left over  even a few pieces of naan you are  not allowed to take anything left over  even a few pieces of naan with you. that  only for buffet though  if you are  there for dinner  angara india spice grill give you foil and to - go boxes. angara india spice grill has not  been super packed the last few times alice have  been here  but service has been efficient. the waiter the waiter is  always been the waiter is great about refilling water and bringing naan when you are  running low. overall angara india spice grill is clean and cozy  with awesome food. definitely recommend angara india spice grill if you are  in the area.

angara india spice grill, stephanie, stephanie have been waiting so long for angara india spice grill  and let me tell you  angara india spice grill is delicious. angara india spice grill have a fantastic lunch buffet that has tons of variety  and only     per person. angara india spice grill even let you take a fantastic lunch buffet that has tons of variety  and only     per person to go  which is great if you need a quick lunch on the run. angara india spice grill's lunch buffet has all the usual favorites and some of the selections change based on the day  which is nice. the most important part  the food is fantastic  with several vegan and vegetarian options which was great since stephanie had a vegan person eating with us. the owners are very helpful and pointed out which items a vegan person would be able to eat  and even got a vegan person's special bread  as the naan is not vegan. stephanie did enjoy the garlic naan a lot  of course  and is made fresh to order even if you are getting a fantastic lunch buffet that has tons of variety  and only     per person. if you are a fan of indian food  especially the spicy dishes  give angara india spice grill a shot  stephanie can see us becoming regulars here !

angara india spice grill, jason, my wife and jason have had my wife and jason's lunch buffet twice and really enjoyed their lunch buffet. the variety of foods was good  and the descriptions were clear and understandable. the garlic naan is delicious and you can get refills on the garlic naan. the gentleman who served us was very attentive  courteous  and answered any questions jason had. jason will be going back for more !  !  !

angara india spice grill, pierre, pierre really wish pierre didnt give up white rice and flour  because everything pierre ate at angara india spice grill  lunch was so flavorful and delicious. oh garlic naan how pierre have  missed you. the ambiance is very nice and the gentleman working the dining room was extremely pleasant. pierre can not  remember the names of the dishes pierre had besides the tandoori and curry chickens  but the dishes pierre had besides the tandoori and curry chickens were all prepared well with unique flavors and spices. the cold bar items were fresh. pierre especially enjoyed the yogurt and mint chutney. pierre would recommend angara india spice grill to any fan of indian cuisine or diners with ambitious tastebuds.

angara india spice grill, nichole, nichole ordered on yelp was sooo easy..... delivery was super fast and food ..... omg the best everything is so yummy nichole ordered the butter chicken the butter chicken's amazing ! angara india spice grill is nichole's new favorite place   stars  !  !  !  !

angara india spice grill, bhushan, tonight bhushan dined here  after a friend recommended angara india spice grill. bhushan ordered the standard lamb kebab  panner tikka and chicken curry with a couple of rotis. food quantity  is small. compared to the price. so if you have a average eating appetite then these servings are small. you will need more  which means the bill goes up -  items are really pricy -  lamb kebab were    . for   small pieces of lamb  chicken curry was    . less then    ounce of curry  -  oh also there is no rice included  angara india spice grill is a pricy menu the taste  was ok  nothing that would stand out. maybe to new indian cuisine diner angara india spice grill maybe a great  but for indians angara india spice grill is an outright average north indian flavor. service was great  that is why bhushan give angara india spice grill three stars otherwise service would be lower. there was only one employee  on duty  and only one employee  on duty was the server  +  busser  +  matre - de all in one. only one employee  on duty was prompt  respectful and efficient. overall bhushan would rate angara india spice grill a pretty avg  clean local north indian restaurant with similar menu items as all other north indian restaurants.

angara india spice grill, trina, wow. angara india spice grill blew trina's mind. trina have yet to have indian food as excellent as angara india spice grill. from the chutney and tamarind sauce the chutney and tamarind sauce provide the table  to the dessert that trina experienced for the first time in trina's life and slapped trina for never eating before the meal was an experience. trina cannot go wrong here. trust me. bring a tiny container because trina will  want to bag that mint chutney for home. that mint chutney would taste good on a dry navy cracker ! as for our main courses our main courses were both creamy  nice heat levels and the chicken was tender and flavorful. good thing trina ordered naan along with rice to remove all evidence of food in the dishes. the veggie samosa was crispy hot  and the filling was perfectly seasoned and creamy. trina shoved the chutney and tamarind sauce inside and had a moment with the veggie samosa. it was intimate. trina shared a moment. come and eat here ! ! and how can you say no to all   days lunch buffet  ! ! trina cannot wait to eat through the menu. what a great restaurant. service and excellent food is all trina ask for  and angara india spice grill delivered beyond expectations.

angara india spice grill, mike, great indian buffet. clean restaurant  staff is friendly and  quick. the food was really well prepared. had just the right spice. the goat was tender and the chicken as well. mike find that if you cube chicken in a dish and cook chicken becomes tough and over cooked. not in this case very tender. overall mike give angara india spice grill a   star rating and from me that hard to earn. amhara keep up the good work and excellent standards.

pakwan indian bistro, amanda, decided to try out pakwan indian bistro tonight and much to our surprise pakwan indian bistro was pretty good ! amanda dined and the service was as expected. though amanda have traveled to india and understand cultural differences the service amanda received was just fine. pakwan indian bistro was clean and amanda ate a good meal. our server brought us everything amanda asked for. the food quality was great. gobi manchurian was excellent tikka masala was good  butter chicken was good  and the biryani was tasty. not the same as paradise in hyderabad but good. amanda will definitely be back to eat at pakwan indian bistro !
pakwan indian bistro, adeel, food was not great. chicken kebab was too hard and rubbery. chicken tikka masala was average. biryani was decent. would not recommend.

pakwan indian bistro, vamsi, vamsi visited pakwan rwstaueant yesterday. pakwan indian bistro opened one day ago. the interior is decent enough to dine in. ordered mutton biryani  and andhra chicken curry. mutton biryani was authentic and flavorful. vamsi especially liked the kata gravy pakwan indian bistro gave along with mutton biryani. andhra chicken curry was spot on. the prices are reasonable and even the food quantity was good. hope pakwan indian bistro maintain the same taste and quality.
pakwan indian bistro, abe, pakwan indian bistro is pretty damn good. the lamb biryani is excellent. open seating and the owners are very nice people. definitely coming back for more.

pakwan indian bistro, arnie, pakwan indian bistro is a decent place for indian food. arnie went here in a group of     people  at a pretty late hour  and ordered a ton of food. pakwan indian bistro's service was prompt and quite good. however  the quality of food could certainly be a lot better. the naan seemed stale and was not very soft. pakwan indian bistro's chicken dish were pretty oily  and could have  used better different ingredients for flavor. pakwan indian bistro

pakwan indian bistro, omar, so disappointed. when omar heard pakwan  omar was relating it to the relating it to the amazing pakwan resturant in san jose california. a muslim living in the east valley it is  damn near impossible to find a good halal joint  and omar was hoping pakwan indian bistro was a gem. unfortunately  when omar walked in   the atmoaphere was bleak  with only one frame on the wall and inappropriate bollywood movies playing on a screen. omar ordered the food   the lady behind the counter was nice omar could tell the lady behind the counter was trying. the service was actually pretty good and the food came out quickly which omar was very happy about. unfortunately what the food came out in was very very very disappointing. plastic dixie bowls and styrofoam plates. it should be a crime for any resturant to do this. mind you omar was not getting take out  omar sat and ate in the amazing pakwan resturant in san jose california. when omar asked the lady behind the counter for silverware the lady behind the counter said the amazing pakwan resturant in san jose california only have plastic forks and knives. this is one of the amazing pakwan resturant in san jose california's biggest fallbacks in my opinion. plates and silverware is not a big ask. the food was actually pretty good. the vegetable samosa were tasty as was the chicken tikka masala and the tandoori chicken. the naan was mediocre at best did not  seem too fresh. the rice looked sad and bland however. but regardless of the food the styrafoam threw the whole meal off. a lot of potential  but very disappointing. if any of this changes  let me know because omar would love to come back   give pakwan indian bistro another shot.

pakwan indian bistro, aasma, pakwan indian bistro was a little disappointing. the food was definitely tasty our server was super sweet  our servers the owners daughter. aasma ordered the chicken tikka masala the chicken tikka masala was delicious the chicken tikka masala did not  have too much food coloring like many restaurants do. also  the chicken tikka masala was cooked with boneless thigh meat which was a nice touch because boneless thigh meat was super tender. aasma also got the veggie samosa which aasma's husband loved  and the garlic naan which was pretty good as well. unfortunately  aasma have to give it three starts because of the quality. all the food was served in paper styrofoam plates which really threw aasma off. aasma's husbands super picky about stuff like that so my husband definitely did not enjoy after that. pakwan indian bistro only had plastic utensils. aasma understand if pakwan indian bistro was a fast food restaurant  but pakwan indian bistro isnt. youre meant to sit down and eat a meal there  and the plates and utensils really threw all of it off. . the food is great  but pakwan indian bistro really need to up pakwan indian bistro's atmosphere. if you are  gonna eat here get it as takeaway   eat it at home. aasma definitely recommend the chicken tikka masala the chicken tikka masala was delicious.

pakwan indian bistro, uday, absolutely best biryani in phoenix metro. uday am surprised how uday overlooked pakwan indian bistro in the last few years. pakwan indian bistro is that hole in the wall place that you need to get introduced to and would keep coming back. must try :  pakhwan special biryani andhra chicken curry pakwan indian bistro's vegetarian biryani is also a surprisingly good one

pakwan indian bistro, moni, moni went to pakwan indian bistro last week to check out what specials pakwan indian bistro can offer.. as soon as moni entered  moni's friend spotted mutton paya on the today  special board. moni could not stop moni as moni am a big lover of goat and lamb meat. moni ordered dosa and chicken biryani along mutton paya first came dosa with roti pachadi and coconut chutney.. roti pachadi was so yummy that moni finished off half of our dosa before moni could get the sambar and paya.. seriously guys roti pachadi was worth selling in a jar.. then mutton paya.. delicious.. right amount of spice and heat.. good proportion.. moni had a big smile on moni's face when moni finished off moni's dosa with mutton paya then came chicken biryani. chicken biryani was not bad but not the best in town

pakwan indian bistro, kevin, sitting and waiting for kevin's order of tandoori chicken  vege korma  and butter chicken to be made fresh to order and wanted to check - in to say pakwan indian bistro is a blessing. pakwan indian bistro is a family - run business with a uniquely southern indian twist that puts the traditionally northern indian food spots you see everywhere to shame with it is  quality and variety of flavors  and kevin do also love northern indian cuisine but northern indian cuisine has become all too commonplace . kevin work in a nearby office park and love that kevin can even walk here to enjoy pakwan indian bistro's menu. it is really sad that the local competition goes out of the local competition's way to lower the reputation of successful newcomers to save successful newcomers from having to evolve  as you can tell by the obviously planted   - star reviews mixed in with all of the legit   -  and   - star ones from people who actually came in to eat. still working kevin's way through their menu and have loved everything kevin have tried so far whether for lunch or dinner. kevin eat keto as well which can be a challenge but gems such as butter chicken come chock full of delicious creamy protein fat and you can make it low carb by passing on the rice and naan bread. consider kevin a happy regular and soon to be king of check - ins if kevin remember to load up yelp each time !

pakwan indian bistro, heather, the best butter chicken heather have had since moving to arizona ! heather also thought pakwan indian bistro's garlic naan was amazing. overall the food is simply fantastic !

pakwan indian bistro, amanda, wow  pakwan indian bistro is hands down amanda's favorite indian restaurant ! the food is very good and amanda m quite the picky eater. amanda's favorite is the butter chicken as well as the palak paneer which is a creamy spinach with cheese. amanda's only wish was pakwan indian bistro was closer to amanda !
pakwan indian bistro, farzana, the food was good -  chicken    is always the best. really glad to have a halal option in the vicinity.
pakwan indian bistro, sam, enjoyed pakwan indian bistro's haleem. medium spicy is the way to go. sam would say that their haleem is the best haleem in town.

pakwan indian bistro, sabrina, beware ! what started out as a seemingly normal indian dinning experience quickly turned into the most horrific culinary experience of my life... sabrina really wanted to like pakwan indian bistro but sadly sabrina have nothing but awful things to say about pakwan indian bistro. sabrina think sabrina m developing ptsd just thinking about the meal sabrina received  but enough with the jokes let fill you in on the details that matter... sabrina started out our dinner with a mixed pakora which was super greasy but had a good flavor. for the main course sabrina decided to try out the lamb korma and the chicken tika masala... this is where it all went horribly wrong... when the lamb korma arrived at our table the lamb korma smelled rancid... the smell will forever be etched into my memory. the chicken in the chicken tika masala was pink  and sabrina m not talking just a little pink... the chicken in the tika masala was raw. needless to say if you value your health please take caution when choosing to dine here.
pakwan indian bistro, viswanath, viswanath tried multiple items in the menu at pakwan indian bistro. viswanath find the chicken biryani to be amazing.

pakwan indian bistro, emily, food was good which is why emily m leaving it at   stars but emily  and my husband  had food poisoning for three days straight. emily have an iron stomach and can handle any spice  and additionally have never had food poisoning before.

pakwan indian bistro, raeanne, this is the best indian food raeanne have  had thus far. raeanne ordered chili paneer as an appetizer and shared cashew curry and shrimp biryani. the whole time raeanne was praying that god would send raeanne an extra stomach so raeanne could eat more once raeanne was full. it is a little weird that pakwan indian bistro use disposable dish ware  however the service is good the food is fantastic and raeanne think pakwan indian bistro is  a true hidden gem. if you come here be sure to wear your yoga pants for maximum food consumption.

pakwan indian bistro, wade, pakwan indian bistro fantastic. pakwan indian bistro tout pakwan indian bistro as having the best curry in the valley and wade would have to say that wade can not  disagree. wade had the veg korma which had rich flavor that is hard to describe. the people wade was with had the chic tikka masala which was every bit as satisfying. mom and pop feel to pakwan indian bistro which adds to pakwan indian bistro's appeal for me. pakwan indian bistro  a recommend for me.

pakwan indian bistro, miguel, just ordered take - out from here. the owners are incredibly friendly and answered all of our questions on the menu. my wife and miguel ordered the chicken tikka masala  garlic naan  and a paneer dosa. the chicken tikka masala garlic naan  and a paneer dosa were extremely well made and flavorful and came out in exactly    minutes as promised. every restaurant  level of spiciness is different. miguel asked for a mild chicken tikka masala and to our palette a mild chicken tikka masala was more of a mild medium  which was fine . but  just mentioning as a tip when ordering your level of spiciness. pakwan indian bistro is a quintessential family restaurant and miguel highly recommend pakwan indian bistro for eat in or take out.

pakwan indian bistro, rav, amazing briyani that is full of flavor and spice. amazing briyani that is full of flavor and spice. is the hands down favorite so far. curry dish are also great. lots to choose from and try. service is a bit slow but the family is very nice and the focus is on the food.

pakwan indian bistro, prasanna, tried goat biryani yesterday. goat biryani was pretty good but a little bit salty. compared to other indian restaurants here in the phoenix area pakwan indian bistro is pretty good. will be trying again for sure. thank you.

pakwan indian bistro, sakina, tell it pure luck or a great find but sakina end up here while looking for a good biryani. sakina ordered chicken    biryani and chicken biryani. place was clean and  staff was friendy. chicken    biryani and chicken biryani  had an authentic taste and was very tasteful. sakina like pakwan indian bistro better than paradise biryani point. my husband enjoyed pakwan indian bistro throughly and pakwan indian bistro satisfied my husband's craving for good biryani. will definitely recommend pakwan indian bistro to anyone who loves   craves for good biryani.

pakwan indian bistro, ajay, god bless these hyderabadi guys. amazing food. ordered  -  mysore bonda  -  best ever mysore bonda ajay ever tried in us. cut mirchi stuffed -  serrano peppers  battered fried and topped with onions and peanuts. loved it. idly  -    count for just   . . chutney are great. veg ulavacharu biryani  -  best biryani ever. better than paradise  bawarchi.

pakwan indian bistro, lindsey, lindsey ordered takeout from here. lindsey's chana masala looked like chickpeas swimming in curdled milk. lindsey did not  even have a bite my chana masala went straight into the trash. medu vada were fried well but had a strange flavor. onion biryani portion could be sufficient at     of what was in the box. lindsey's boyfriend said that my boyfriend's  meat  samosas what kind of meat who knows  were not  good and my boyfriend's butter chicken was bland and not at all spicy. lindsey lindsey both woke up feeling a tinge of food poisoning  too. in the future lindsey will  skip pakwan and make the drive to the dhaba.

pakwan indian bistro, keith, keith would give zero stars if keith could ! slow and unorganized ! ! if you are  going for a quick lunch  reconsider ! the food was good  till keith were getting ready to leave and out  lunch special cost x what out  lunch special was supposed to because the person taking orders  does not  speak english well  and put our order in wrong... it was also very warm inside pakwan indian bistro. keith would never return or refer anyone here !

pakwan indian bistro, raghav, food is excellent and delicious  ! best combo is mirchi bhajji and paneer biryani. best hyderabadi food in phoenix. friendly environment  time taking  but worth waiting. true hyderabadi style food enjoy by visitng pakwan  ! !  !  !  !  !

pakwan indian bistro, mike, the food is very good. lots of flavor and even some heat. the archana chicken had a ton of flavor. the rice was also delicious. pakwan indian bistro even had spicy lemon achar which were delicious. the service was friendly. the space needs some work  as do the paper plastic - ware. mike would  like more than a plastic spoon in a paper bowl. please.

pakwan indian bistro, farmer, my girlfriend and farmer wanted some indian food the other day and decided to try pakwan indian bistro out and were glad farmer did !  !  ! pakwan indian bistro have tons of different food options and farmer decided on the veggie samosas and pakwan briyani and was not disappointed ! the food took a little longer than expected  but was well worth it ! the chicken serving was huge and so worth it ! the staff was really friendly and accommodating and farmer for sure will be going there again. think pakwan indian bistro has only been open for about a week and hope pakwan indian bistro continue to grow ! highly recommended !  !  !

pakwan indian bistro, shreyas, shreyas generally do not  review often however for pakwan indian bistro shreyas felt shreyas should. shreyas tried chicken biriyani and chicken biriyani was one of the best shreyas have ever had. for that  shreyas will give    . my wife had paneer dosa which was good. the sambhar and chutneys could be better. definitely recommend for non - veg food.

pakwan indian bistro, mukarram, food is great here  pure authentic taste. very generous on their portion but that will change in future for sure. not great restaurant ambiance but its ok. been there twice ever since pakwan indian bistro have opened up and will definitely go back for more.

pakwan indian bistro, ish, this review is for the chicken biryani which ish ordered for a party  full tray a great quality biryani was absolutely delicious and everyone loved a great quality biryani. pakwan indian bistro went out of pakwan indian bistro's way and agreed to deliver before pakwan indian bistro's normal working hours. ish wanted a non - spicy biryani  and pakwan indian bistro made a non - spicy biryani exactly as per the instruction. people said a non - spicy biryani tasted home - made and were raving about the huge portion. thank pakwan indian bistro so much for delivering a great quality biryani.

pakwan indian bistro, dee, dee love pakwan indian bistro ! dee and dee's hubby comes here few times a month. dee love pakwan indian bistro's special pakwan biryani. their special pakwan biryani can get too spicy so make sure you request to be just mild spicy. highly recommend !

pakwan indian bistro, som, pakwan indian bistro's biryani is as good as biryani gets ! if you are tired of indian restaurants passing off rice mixed with chicken or mutton curry as  biryani   try pakwan indian bistro. perfectly cooked goat meat  falling off the bones   generous portions and right amount of spice.

wanlee loy, shaheer, wanlee loy is not a typical hakka restaurant. wanlee loy's food is light and easy on the stomach their food's also not overly spicy or salty ! wanlee loy have some options that are very healthy and you can have some options that are very healthy without breaking your diet plan ! diet meal :  try the cashew chicken the cashew chicken comes with white rice and the whole dish is just chicken and vegetables with some flavorful curry. the whole dish  not oily either. you can skip white rice and just have chicken and vegetables. a little bit more spicy : beef chilli with gravy was a tad more spicy  but beef chilli with gravy was still very easy on the stomach and very flavorful. wanlee loy seems to be very quite and off the radar. there were some old people sitting and having tea but nobody besides us was having food. wanlee loy also have great chicken corn soup ! would definitely recommend for a light lunch.

wanlee loy, jittu, hakka indian chinese with a better flavor there are umpteen hakka indian restaurants in the gta. however  this outlet definitely offers better taste than most. envoirnment is very simple and clean. service was great; food was even better. amount of food served for a lunch special at a very reasonable price is incredible. jittu would prefer this outlet above many other hakka indian restaurants if this outlet was any closer to where jittu stay. a must for anyone living in the area.

wanlee loy, yvonne, my bf and yvonne came here last night after work. yvonne were not  sure where to go as it was already    pm by the time my bf was off work. yvonne found this place on yelp.. was not  sure what to expect as there was only    reviews and no one inside. only    reviews were good and this place was open till so yvonne are  like what heck .. the venue inside was nice and clean inside  yvonne were the only ones there. yvonne ordered seven vegetables with cashew  manchurian chicken  and beef chilli fried rice. water was from the tap yvonne could hear yvonne pour water  and a can of diet coke. the service is like any other asian place  you get their attention when you need their attention. yvonne was quick as yvonne was in the front  but not the type where they come ask you if you are  okay every    mins. food tasted wonderful  yvonne had lots of left overs and the overall price was about    before tip. the only weird thing was some man came in half way through our meal to order a beer. . stared at yvonne for a few moments then went to sit down behind us... then    mins  later sat at a table beside us and was pretty much staring the whole time until some man was done some man's beer.. that was just a little uncomfortable.. not their fault ..but was still weird lol there was lot on the menu yvonne still want to try.. yvonne will  be coming back again  !

wanlee loy, allen, allen have  been to a lot of hakka places like federicks  lin garden hakka work etc... and wanlee loy stands out due to the food and value. the pakora here are excellent. the pakora here are crispy  not oily at all  and full of flavour. portion size is also huge. chili chicken is also good compared to other hakka places. allen usually get takeout and it seems like the choice for most people as wanlee loy is normally pretty empty in terms of dine in customers. you also get     off on orders over     if you pay cash.

wanlee loy, faraz, wanlee loy  a small place for large groups to come and eat. the service is nice and polite usually but today the service was a bit rude. a few customers came in and say down and the waiter did not  even notice so a few customers had to go up and ask for the menu. when ordering food   the waiter questioned us for adding more to the already ordered dish in a rude   mean way. the food can be better   but overall great place.

rajdhani sweets & restaurant, jacklynn, rajdhani sweets & restaurant has the best naan bread the best naan bread is  so good. the food is authentic vegetarian indian food. jacklynn admit the sitting area is not too big and appealing. but the food really triumphant that. the value is really good too. when ordering the veg thali you do not  have to order a sweet dish if you do not  like a sweet dish. you can get another vege curry dish instead  no extra charge.

rajdhani sweets & restaurant, meenakshi, rajdhani sweets & restaurant great and tasty north indian food. lunch combo nominal price and tasty curries. chaats are very nice. paav bhaji gulab jamun parathas badam milk are popular and tasty here

rajdhani sweets & restaurant, sonia, when sonia walked through the door  sonia could tell rajdhani sweets & restaurant was going to be a real authentic indian restaurant. the food here is delicious. the sweets are fresh and the staff let  you sample before you buy. prices and service are fair. if parking is full  park across the street. sonia would highly recommend rajdhani sweets & restaurant and will definitely return !

rajdhani sweets & restaurant, dominique, my go - to indian restaurant  dominique have  never been disappointed. rajdhani sweets & restaurant       vegetarian  affordable and delicious. parking can be tricky. do not  let the plaza discourage you  the food is delicious and the girls who work there are very nice. rajdhani sweets & restaurant curries often times change but rajdhani sweets & restaurant have the staples like daal and palak paneer.

rajdhani sweets & restaurant, jawid, stopped in for lunch and puck some sweets. if you keep your eyes and nose close outside and make your way inside then you can find great sweets and decent punjabi vegetarian food. there is a pan shop next door and outside is coated with people spitting that on side walks. disgusting : ordered a thali and you can pick which sides. do not order puri since the one jawid got was cold and made who knows when. completely deflated and was more like batura instead of puri  supposed to be fluffy but was chewy . chana was bit hard and so was ghobi... they had some rice and attempted salad but some rice and attempted salad were not edible. ended taking a spoon each and throwing rest away. naan looked fresh. all in all people who miss home cooked punjabi meal should visit. there are ana poorna in santa clara with better taste yet home cooked. sweets looked good and yet have to try sweets. will visit again if the outside area gets bit cleaner.

rajdhani sweets & restaurant, neha, rajdhani sweets & restaurant  good but the staff is a bit rude. since last   -   weeks neha have been to rajdhani sweets & restaurant   times but still the behavior is same. food is ok. neha just like jalebi and imarti that is  all. otherwise all the curries have same taste.

rajdhani sweets & restaurant, monika, rajdhani sweets & restaurant  fast food style. rajdhani sweets & restaurant  not fancy but that is  ok. staff are happy ppl. food is amazing. monika hate the parking lot. and the windows are always so steamy. you will leave smelling like curry. kinda like when you leave grandmas house  lol.

rajdhani sweets & restaurant, vikram, vikram's extended family catered food from here for thatha  satyanarayana puja and thatha satyanarayana puja's   th birthday. apparently rajdhani sweets & restaurant can prepare food w o garlic and onions for thatha satyanarayana puja and his   th birthday. the white rice w peas veg pulao    malai kofta mixed vegetable curry  mattar paneer  and bhoodi raita were all on point. naan looked slightly different than most of what vikram have  seen but naan was still delicious nonetheless. there are so many indian restaurants here and in vikram's   -   times vikram have  been here over the years it is been great to try so many of so many indian restaurants out because so many indian restaurants are all so tasty.

rajdhani sweets & restaurant, nalini, nalini love to try foods from different cultures  and nalini found rajdhani sweets & restaurant while on the bus and decided to check rajdhani sweets & restaurant out... nalini got   veg. thali  for nalini's sister and nalini nalini were so excited ! the food was decent the plating and packaging are so neat !  ! and the staff are nice nalini happened to get extra naan so nalini's total came up to     not bad actually ! the only complaints nalini have is that there was a pepper of some sort that was fried and nalini ate a pepper of some sort that was fried and a pepper of some sort that was fried was extremely bitter nalini had to spit a pepper of some sort that was fried out also the naan tasted sour nalini have  never had naan like that. nalini was an experience and nalini do not  think nalini will  be back again.

rajdhani sweets & restaurant, james, right on bovaird   location is convenient. james tried twice but james are  not convinced with the taste of food  ! breads were good but gravies needs attention  !

rajdhani sweets & restaurant, bryce, bryce love rajdhani sweets & restaurant. rajdhani sweets & restaurant way out of the way from just about everything but bryce make the hour plus transit journey frequently on weekends. the food is delicious. the food  not the best indian food you will  ever eat  but the food is pretty darn tasty just the same. bryce live for rajdhani sweets & restaurant's saag. the naan is freshly made and so good bryce have  never bothered getting any other roti. the gajar ka halwa is also dreamy. soooo sugary and soooo buttery. the food is not  terribly hot - spicy but bryce find the food is  increased in heat a little over the last couple of years. the excellent part is that for like   bucks you get three veg dishes of your choice  roti  rice dessert  and pickle. it leaves you stuffed. way better than most buffets for a lot less money. the other handy thing about rajdhani sweets & restaurant is that you can pick up all manner of sweets to take home for your diabetic coma needs. one can never have enough jalebi or burfi in my opinion. anyway  if you are hungry in etobicoke or looking for a nice long bus ride then bryce highly recommend rajdhani sweets & restaurant.

rajdhani sweets & restaurant, jessa, neat bright diner with simple and easy to read menus. prices are cheap  seating area is limited compared to brars but rajdhani sweets & restaurant is  slightly cheaper and a bit less grungy looking. jessa ordered a veggie thali for   . with tax.

rajdhani sweets & restaurant, aasawari, pros :   -  naan is amazing. seriously good ! ! -  thali is at a great price for the quantity. value  =  extremely high ! -  malai kofta was exquisite. mushroom masala was amazing. cons : -  place is pretty small. rajdhani sweets & restaurant had around   tables and none of around   tables seated more than    unless you counted the first table which is near the main door. the first table which is near the main door is usually avoided as cold air enters through every time someone enters rajdhani sweets & restaurant. fix the seating arrangement interior and easy   stars !  ! : -  achari paneer was too dry and not as tasty as aasawari would have liked. verdict : takeout !  !

rajdhani sweets & restaurant, roma, like singh a.  roma have  got a pretty soft spot for rajdhani sweets & restaurant. thali - style restaurants fill that falafel type of fast food niche where indian cuisine is concerned. for   . you get an assortment of dishes with dessert  rice and buttery naan. though lots of the items are greasy and  whited out  the variety and presentation is great. do not  expect a spice - attack because you wo not  get a spice - attack. the food just is not  that spicy. the food  high on salt. the mango and plain lassis are made really well here  though sometimes a little too sweet for roma's liking so adjust your order accordingly  because rajdhani sweets & restaurant are  very accommodating to requests. customer service is great and roma have  repeated roma's visits to rajdhani sweets & restaurant as rajdhani sweets & restaurant is  a lot cleaner than rajdhani sweets & restaurant's competitors nearby.

rajdhani sweets & restaurant, pooja, this review is for rajdhani sweets & restaurant's catering services. pooja was extremely impressed with rajdhani sweets & restaurant  catering. rajdhani sweets & restaurant prepared excellent food for a fair price and also delivered excellent food to pooja's home for a reasonable fee. excellent food was also delivered on time and packed securely so excellent food did not  stain or spill. excellent food was t particularly spicy  but excellent food was tasty. pooja would be happy to order rajdhani sweets & restaurant's catering again.

rajdhani sweets & restaurant, justin, justin have  been going to rajdhani sweets & restaurant for well over a decade  and rajdhani sweets & restaurant is  always been good ! the food is spot on consistently  and the service is quite fast. the thali has always been justin's go - to dish but the thali is  not the only thing on the menu. the assortment of sweets and snacks is also something which everyone must try !

rajdhani sweets & restaurant, andrei, rajdhani sweets & restaurant is not where you should take your date or go out with your friends if you want somewhere to chill or share a drink. if  however  you are  in the area hungry  looking for a place to have a bite rajdhani sweets & restaurant is it. for   . + tax you will  get a big metal plate with rice  salad and   options of veggies. no  there is  no chicken  meat  lamb  fish or any other traditional options. rajdhani sweets & restaurant is strictly vegetarian but man rajdhani sweets & restaurant's food is tasty. where else can you pay    for a healthy meal that will  leave you full  andrei do not  know that many places in toronto. the value for the money is unbeatable imho. today was imho's first time here and andrei absolutely loved the food. did andrei mention that rajdhani sweets & restaurant sell traditional indian sweets  which are equally good

rajdhani sweets & restaurant, jay, jay have done a takeout from here a couple of times and a takeout has been great. rajdhani sweets & restaurant have quite limited vegan options but having said that  quite limited vegan options are good. jay have tried samosa chat pani puri some of the non - dairy sabzis and rotis. the food is delicious and the portions are filling. the staff is quite good. not that very friendly in a north american way but the staff do the staff's job well which is pretty enough for jay. parking can be a problem since this plaza has a small lot and too many shops. but there may be some empty spaces in the lot on the opposite side of the road or the rbc branch next to this plaza.

rajdhani sweets & restaurant, roopika, roopika's husband bought chole bhature yesterday. while eating roopika saw that the batura were soaked with oil approx   table spoon of oil in one bhatura very disappointed  !  !  !

urban hakka, jessica, jessica are so happy that this restaurant has come to jessica's neighbourhood ! the chowmein is delicious as is the crispy beef  manchurian fish  and butter chicken. jessica also like that this restaurant deliver !

urban hakka, richa, probably richa's favourite indian chinese restaurant in toronto. the service and the food  the service and the food  both were fantastic. richa ordered the manchurian style chicken and chicken hakka noodles. delicious ! ! !  ! just amazing. richa got hot and sour soup to start with. the temperature  flavour  consistency everything was just perfect. and richa ended richa's lunch with their mango lassi which was so refreshing with just enough sweetness. ca not  wait to go back and try other items on the menu.

urban hakka, ann, ann was excited that a hakka restaurant opened up in the area but was very disappointed with the portion size for take out. the portion size for take out are very small ! ann ordered several meat dishes and each container was barely filled half way. most of each container was filled with sauce  hardly any meat. ann was not  expecting generous portions  but something at least decent for the price ann paid. the rice that came with it was warm  but dry and hard. overall the flavour of several meat dishes were decent but ann would not  go back. it  simply not worth the money.

urban hakka, lindsey, urban hakka is new and clean. staff is very friendly and accommodating. the food is just ok  lindsey m not sure lindsey would  ever feel the need to go back. urban hakka's hakka game is weak. the chili chicken was lacking all the chili  lindsey m so confused as to why urban hakka served us chili chicken with no chili. lindsey's crispy sesame beef had more heat to my crispy sesame beef than the chili chicken. having said this lindsey's beef was good lindsey would  order my crispy sesame beef again if lindsey went back. lindsey do not  think lindsey will be going back because chili chicken is a staple for a hakka restaurant. if lindsey want chinese food lindsey already have lindsey's go to and if lindsey want indian lindsey know where to go. urban hakka is nothing special and urban hakka is  also not terrible. overall lindsey was disappointed in urban hakka. lindsey was excited to have a hakka restaurant in the neighbourhood and lindsey will still make the drive to scarborough when lindsey want hakka.

urban hakka, kikee auviance, this place was absolutely amazing ! good lighting intimate setting  and great food ! kikee auviance tried the chilli chicken  crispy beef  and the chowmein with chicken  beef  and shrimp. all were absolutely delightful. this is kikee auviance's first time in canada and this place is a great first stop !

urban hakka, tameka, the food was amazing ! tameka would definitely come back here. tameka got here almost an hour til closing and the staff was super pleasant and helpful. since this was our first time at their location the waiter helped us pick delectable dishes :  sesame crispy chicken  chicken beef shrimp chow menu  and the chili chicken.

urban hakka, mehrab, amazing place. upscale feel with jazz and moderate pricing. clean flavours and spices. a very rare spot with actual table cloths and rice dishes at the     mark with shrimp. small soup is enough for   or   ppl for    only ! for a place like amazing place mehrab was expecting the pricing to be higher and flavours to be more common among the dishes but no ! amazing place maintain quality of flavours in the food and decor. definitely enjoyed mehrab's time and will return.

urban hakka, jessica, jessica walked by urban hakka and realized jessica were craving hakka so decided to stop in. our waiter was  super friendly and attentive. urban hakka was not  busy on a sunday evening so the atmosphere was very relaxed. the food was satisfying ! jessica do not  know if jessica would  say urban hakka was the best hakka jessica have  ever had  but jessica was not  disappointed. jessica ordered the vegetable chow mein  chicken wontons  and chili chicken  with  gravy  . jessica loved the chili chicken -  - definitely jessica's favorite  of the three. jessica could definitely see jessica stopping by again if jessica was in the neighborhood  ! would recommend if you are  looking for a low - key restaurant  with fair prices.

urban hakka, r, was here last week while on a work meeting .. r got the crispy beef and chilli chicken. crispy beef was well cooked and the  chicken  was  tasty. wont be back  but only because r am rarely in the area .. r do recommend you try the food here if you are in the area  because the food here is very fresh and tasty.

urban hakka, david, unlike any other hakka restaurant david have been to. urban hakka is more of a fine dine kinda feel. david ordered the hot and sour soup  lollipop chicken   shrimp green curry  crispy chicken and chicken tandoori chowmein. all the dishes were very flavorful and at the end david finished everything david ordered . the presentations of all the dishes were very nice and the service friendly . urban hakka has been opened for over a month and david see a lot of take out orders for uber eats and skip the dish.

urban hakka, rachel, this is based on uber eats. rachel have been complaining for so long that there are no hakka restaurants in the area  which sucks considering rachel grew up in scarborough where they were everywhere. rachel's prayers have been answered ! rachel saw this on uber eats and decided to try two things rachel absolutely love from hakka restaurants :  chicken and corn soup  and chilli chicken. two things rachel absolutely love from hakka restaurants :  chicken and corn soup  and chilli chicken were both so delicious. chicken and corn soup had delicious  big chunks of chicken pieces inside  and was a huge portion for a small. chilli chicken was so flavorful  and although rachel do like a bit more spice to rachel chilli chicken still was so delicious. the prices were extremely reasonable  especially for the area. rachel will definitely be ordering from here again.

urban hakka, ares, take - out order. food was terrible. everything tasted the same everything was just very salty  bland and black coloured. no colour or sign of freshness. our pakora were raw on the inside. the tom - yum soup was so salty and also had a weird sweet after taste and the garnishes in the tom - yum soup were really odd. wo not  ever order take out from here again. even the bombay paneer was very odd. was a stock based sauce thickened with cornstarch. wtf. was expecting a cream sauce. almost      spent on garbage. dont get me wrong the quantity was very nice for the price but quality was way down.

urban hakka, josh, food is pretty good with generous portions for the price. the hot and sour soup has large pieces of meat  chicken  beef or veg options josh think . decor is tasteful and music classical   jazzy. good for a date  passing by or even take - out. tldr; good value for the quality of the food and ambiance.

urban hakka, pooja, been here thrice within a month and would go back again when in toronto ! the best part is that the portion of the servings is good enough and the price is reasonable. loved their singapore noodles  american chopsy and veg curries options served with rice.

urban hakka, akash, akash have been to urban hakka as part of office lunch on fridays. urban hakka has a good lunch menu with a variety of options. food is decent but not the best hakka akash have had in the gta. for the lunch price urban hakka is an ok place to visit.

urban hakka, jia, urban hakka had a very pretty in the dining area but then the floors to the bathroom and the entire hall was sticky and greasy. dishes were not spicy  but the flavor was quite good. and the hot sauce on the side with peanut and oil was great ! jia had fish pakora and bombay chicken. urban hakka an okay place really. but jia still prefer some of other hakka places in scarborough.

urban hakka, sarah, sarah got take out from here  -  chilli chicken  crispy beef  tandoori chicken chow mein gobi manchurian  cauliflower  veg pakora and fried rice. the standouts were the chilli chicken  with gravy  and gobi manchurian  dry . the chilli chicken  with gravy  and gobi manchurian  dry had decent heat and were very flavourful. veg pakora and fried rice were pretty good. sarah was disappointed with tandoori chicken chow mein as tandoori chicken chow mein did not  have that  smoky  flavour usually you have with hakka noodles. lastly  crispy beef was a little more on the tough side although the flavour was nice. overall the good outweighs the not so good and sarah would definitely return here. it not the best hakka food sarah have  had before but decent. sarah did find the prices and portions very reasonable -  sarah got a ton of food  !

urban hakka, vincent, vincent came here for a late lunch around  pm on a sunday as a party of five and were seated immediately. the first thing vincent noticed was how spacious the interior was  with both a front and a back dining area  along with an outdoor patio that was not  being used at that time. there were a number of other patrons and the place seemed decently busy. vincent ordered the chicken pakora  shrimp hakka style rice noodles  tandoori chicken fried rice  crispy beef  and chili chicken gravy. the chicken pakora came out first  and were covered in a sweet sauce. vincent was only used to eating the dry version  but the sweet sauce pakoras came as a pleasant surprise. vincent also loved how savory all the entrees were. crispy beef was a party of five's favourite dish. so sweet. so sesame - y. so savory. they also make their own chili oil garlic hot sauce inhouse. vincent would definitely recommend trying their own chili oil garlic hot sauce. it was a party of five's first time trying hakka cuisine  but vincent were very impressed despite the complaints. hakka is a great thing to happen to toronto !

urban hakka, mark, came by on a weekend for dinner with a few friends easily the most classy hakka place mark have  ever been to...they obviously need to make the locals feel comfortable. mark was a bit scared for the quality of the dishes as mark's favourite hakka places do not  have    tablecloths    good service and    ambient music mark ordered chili chicken  chicken pakoras and singaporean noodles. mark m relieved to say all of it is outstanding and compares favourably to mark's favourite east end spots. the dishes are brought out crispy and hot with a solid amount of spice. prices were also surprisingly affordable for the location. the location do a steady stream of takeout too mark think everyone is happy to finally have a good non - italian spot in the neighborhood !

urban hakka, james, solidly  . stars  but james will give the benefit of the doubt  despite my price concerns  because james like having hakka food available in the neighbourhood. ordered lunch for the crew through  skip and everything was solid. james ordered the crispy beef chili chicken  tandoori chicken chow mein  plus veggie and chicken pakora  -  hot garlic style. everyone enjoyed the food. pros : crispy beef and chili chicken james spicy and flavourful good quality  and enjoyed by all. cons : -  prices are quite high for hakka  perhaps due to yonge street rent vs. scarborough for many places. -   tandoori chicken chow mein was rather bland and not extra spicy  as ordered. -  pakora are very much on the dry side  and required a lots of sauce to rescue pakora  the hot - garlic sauce coating on the chicken pakora was odd  but saved the chicken pakora from being a total bust. veggie pakora were a dry disappointment. federicks or wong  pakora win by a long margin. overall a nice date - night location  solid food overall  but rather pricey  and skip the pakora.
urban hakka, viko, the food and portions are awesome. the staffs are friendly and the place is nice and clean. highly recommend !

urban hakka, ruth, oh urban hakka... such a mixed review. probably somewhere between a   and a  . on one occasion ruth dined in urban hakka and had the tandoori chicken chow mein. the tandoori chicken chow mein was probably one of the best in ruth's life  -  such an amazing blend of indian and chinese dishes. the tandoori chicken chow mein was ruth's first time trying hakka and ruth was a true convert. desperate for more  ruth ordered take out from urban hakka just days later. ruth ordered the cashew chicken and was super excited because ruth love love love nutty chicken dishes  but the cashew chicken turned out to be a real disappointment  as was ruth's partner  dish. the sauce was just blegh and ruth could not  even eat my partner  dish. the tandoori chicken chow mein would keep ruth coming back regardless  but ruth would  be wary of trying new dishes here.

urban hakka, kabir, amazing place to have lollypop chicken  also urban hakka's bombay chicken is absolutely brilliant. for convenient location  friendly people and out of this world taste everyone should visit urban hakka. highly recommended !  !  !  !  !

urban hakka, natalia, great indo - chinese food and natalia am so happy that great indo - chinese food is  in urban hakka  easily accessible by ttc. a lot of indian friends miss and crave indian - style chow mein but have shared that indian - style chow mein is  tough to find in toronto  and even brampton. urban hakka is the first place that seems to satisfy even the biggest indo - chinese food connoisseurs. natalia personally like the fried rice and chow mein  both hakka style. as well as the paneer with gravy and the chili cauliflower. pro tip : get the kulfi  indian ice cream  for dessert ! the malai flavor is pro tip's favorite.

urban hakka, vimal, the restaurant is on yonge street and finding a parking spot is a bit difficult. the restaurant has a bright board and hard to miss. thinking the restaurant was a chinese place seeing the  indo chinese cuisine  threw vimal off. seeing the menu was a surprise as the menu indeed have a mix of both indian and chinese cuisines. you would find both chowmein and rice. the restaurant is a long corridor and vimal find the inner most room might have some warmer tables as the front tables can get cold easily due to the doors proximity. the menu has lots of dishes so take your time to go through the menu. our waiter was from nepal and our waiter was very friendly. vimal got some singapore rice noodles and chow mein. the dishes came in quick and hot. some singapore rice noodles had a bit too much herbs in some singapore rice noodles but vimal's friend really liked some singapore rice noodles. and vimal loved chow mein -  chow mein was dry and the chicken and shrimp pieces were juicy and fresh. over all had a great experience at the restaurant  -  defined recommending. oh btw  yelp also gives a     discount when you checkin.

urban hakka, leonard, not bad if you are  looking for your hakka fix. leonard had the chilli chicken  with gravy   crispy beef  dry   shrimp fried rice  hakka noodles cantonese style  and shrimp pakora. leonard were not disappointed. leonard also asked for extra spicy gravy on the side and they gave us a huge portion free of charge. service was great and the staff had great recommendations.

urban hakka, david, given the hype david was hoping urban hakka would be amazing but david found urban hakka just ok overall. david got   dishes and  balancing out the outstanding with the not - so - good  david put this at   stars  though would have bumped it up to  . if david could  -  bonus points for offering a good alternative in the area . david got :   -  sesame crispy beef :  really amazing flavour  and sesame crispy beef was properly crispy  though started to become rubbery as the meal progressed . david would  definitely order sesame crispy beef again. -  singaporean noodles with shrimp :  singaporean noodles with shrimp : were a bit dry  though the faint curry taste was nice. also not as much shrimp as david would have liked. david would  pass on singaporean noodles with shrimp. service was attentive and personable  though a tad slow. the place itself was a bit  fancy   with white tablecloths and cloth napkins. and again  it is  a different taste to other offerings in the area so hope the place itself lasts.

urban hakka, david, david have  walked by urban hakka a couple of times and have definitely been curious  so when david were trying to decide on a restaurant from which to order food it did not  take long for david to choose this place. david decided to order a couple of old standbys : pad thai chicken  shrimp beef : though this is far from the worst pad thai david have  ever had  - it does not   at least  taste like it was made with ketchup -  it is  certainly nothing special or worth ordering again. the big problem here is that it is  just so darn sweet; david m not sure which ingredient caused this or if sugar was added separately  but it mostly tasted like a pad thai dessert. the proteins were plentiful and cooked well  and the pasta was not  soggy so the pasta was definitely edible  at least . chilli beef :  david chose the gravy option and chilli beef : was one of the sauciest dishes david have  eaten in a while. and  like the pad thai  chilli beef : is  fine but completely forgettable. the pervasive taste here was basil  oddly enough  and the one - note nature of chilli beef : did ensure david got a little sick of chilli beef : towards the end. chilli beef :  kind of spicy  at least. urban hakka needs to step up urban hakka's game  because if the quality of the rest of urban hakka's food is similar to what david got it is  hard to envision this place lasting much longer within this crowded marketplace  david.e. put a  little  effort into your offerings  guys .

where the river narrows, rachel, rachel have  lived in the neighbourhood for years but always overlooked this spot which has re - branded and is now called  kingston gourmet  . what a gem ! it tiny  but cozy  two tables for dining in but they also do take out and delivery  and the owner chef  gulam  truly cares about the food the owner chef  gulam prepares. rachel had a fabulous spaghetti carbonara and my husband loved rachel's lamb curry. do not  walk past this one  -  go in and enjoy !

where the river narrows, christopher, yelp let us down. my wife and christopher ordered from star of kingston using justeat. christopher thought  based on the interviews  that the food would be tasty. christopher were sadly disappointed. christopher ordered the butter chicken and christopher ordered a neapoliton pizza. because christopher had a coupon christopher decided to get an order of onion rings as well. the butter chicken was not  terrible; the butter chicken was watery  and no better than what christopher get in a bottled grocery store butter chicken sauce  but the butter chicken was not  terrible. the portion was massive with the rice. onion rings were cool when the food arrived  and christopher are  very nearby !   and had a gross fishy taste to onion rings. onion rings were edible but not appealing. a neapoliton pizza was a travesty. there were multiple calls between us and star of kingston because star of kingston did not  know how to make a neapoliton pizza ! apparently star of kingston changed star of kingston's menu but their menu is not  updated on justeat so christopher had to walk star of kingston through the items of a neapoliton pizza. while that was annoying  it was understandable. the problem was star of kingston absolutely loaded a neapoliton pizza with anchovies  to the point where a neapoliton pizza was almost inedible. christopher threw out more than half of a neapoliton pizza. christopher can not  warn people away from star of kingston enough. based on our experiences christopher will  never spend another dime here again.

where the river narrows, orange, the food is quite good and the staff are very friendly. every time orange order  the staff thank orange for orange's business which is not  something you hear too often not much to the look of the place and agree with other reviewers that the place is for take out. orange have  had a few dishes including the fish and chips blt burgers. the place have a super cheap breakfast for around   or   bucks. a super cheap breakfast for around   or   bucks a little small but a super cheap breakfast for around   or   bucks is  under   dollars so can not  really complain about the size. if you are  in that area and looking for some good diner style take out  orange would really recommend.

where the river narrows, patrick, patrick ordered pizza yesterday  pizza was burnt and tasteless. when patrick called the answer patrick got was  that is the way it comes . patrick understand that the edges could be a little burnt but most of the bottom should not be. patrick suggest you try somewhere else if you want pizza !

where the river narrows, kris, almost each time kris eat there  kris's stomach feels bad because food is too oily and kris  ordered pasta carbonara veggi samosas burger with fries at different times but kris's boyfriend likes it. breakfast items were at the very good level. do not  take apple pie. prices are fine and service is fast.

where the river narrows, teresa, teresa live nearby and drive by this restaurant every day  but never stopped in until today  and teresa are  glad teresa did. teresa ordered the oyster stew  caesar salad  short ribs and pasta of the day  penne with sausage . for dessert teresa got the strawberry cheesecake. everything was so good ! the oyster stew was so fragrant. and teresa am still thinking about the strawberry cheesecake ! teresa only wish teresa had more room in teresa's stomach so teresa could try more items off the menu. teresa will  definitely be coming back again soon.

where the river narrows, ganni, a local gem. a local gem  a small restaurant with exquisite food. tonight ganni's husband and ganni split a shrimp with bacon appetizer. the shrimp were perfectly cooked and blended nicely with bacon. for entrees  ganni absolutely loved ganni's risotto with yummy fiddle heads and peas that popped with freshness. ganni's husband  short ribs were out of this world  served with carrots  bok choy  zucchini and mashed potatoes flavoured with a hint of banana. extraordinarily delicious. ganni will definitely go back.

needle and pin, eva, was excited to try needle and pin. to start off  eva's one friend and eva split the plate of lamb chops. lamb chops were quite overpriced as two  lamb chops were    . in addition  eva's friend had the vegetarian curry and was not impressed. the vegetarian curry was a dish  but not substantial at all. my one friend is vegan so my one friend was really disappointed when my one friend could tell that the meal had been contaminated by oil used in meat. my one friend barely touched the vegetarian curry and they did not  even take the vegetarian curry back or get another option. after a lot of back and forth  they finally took off the vegetable curry. eva had the tikka masala grilled cheese  which was fine. the tikka masala grilled cheese  which was fine was good and the soup had some hints of indian spices. eva's friends enjoyed my friends's tikka masala. throughout the duration of our meal  three of us never even got refills on water. towards the end our waitress became apparently hostile. overall  needle and pin's food is overpriced for the quality and quantity and needle and pin's management was just not accommodating. unfortunately  eva will not be back.

needle and pin, caroline, caroline live right down the street  and this is my first time coming here. caroline have  been missing out. the drinks.... caroline think caroline tried   of the drinks... caroline can not  say a bad thing about the drinks. the drinks were perfection. the atmosphere was great and the food was super good too ! between the both of us  caroline split    plates   and   entree - it was a good amount of food  but a wonderful combo of everything. will. definitely. be. back. !  !

needle and pin, missy, drinks are off the hook  so nice to have a craft cocktail spot close to home ! food is indian british style and pretty good but missy really go here for the drinks. bar service is very friendly and decor is cozy.

needle and pin, sara, sara enjoyed our dinner at needle and pin. definitely make reservations if you are planning on having dinner during the weekend. needle and pin was very busy. one downfall was that even though sara had a   : pm reservation sara were already out of fish and chips pani puri  and rabbit masala. this is understandable but still a bummer.

needle and pin, nikole, the drinks are absolutely amazing. the food is very good but not  off the chain good . somewhat cooler weather type dishes but this is expected since its english and indian.... the impossible meat dish is really amazing.

needle and pin, kate, this is kate's second time here. the first time there were moments of brilliance so kate went back for more. the salad was the best ever on the first time -  so fresh and wonderful combination of tastes and textures. tonight the salad was wilted. the tikka grilled cheese and tomato soup was also a real downer. the tikka grilled cheese and tomato soup was first serve and not even warm. they took the tikka grilled cheese and tomato soup back and the tikka grilled cheese and tomato soup came back curdled and bland. the grilled cheese was more like grilled farm bread with a piece of cheese that stayed for a minute. kate could go on but why bother. if it is a change of chefs then a change of chefs does not  bode well. all kate know it will be sometime before kate consider going back and spending kate's hard earned cash

needle and pin, mark, mark was very excited to try needle and pin for needle and pin's selection of gin cocktails and it is  british pub indian style food. the food was not bad  but as opposed to the interesting mix of traditional pub food with indian spiced and flavors described in the menu the dishes mark had were just pub food with very little indian flavoring or pub food with an indian side sauce. the unexciting food aside the service was terrible. mark were a table of two  each ordering an entree and one appetizer to share. an entree was brought before one appetizer. when the server was informed that mark were expecting an appeziter first the server made it clear this was not the server's problem nor was the server going to address the situation. so an entree sat on the table getting cold while mark waited for one appetizer and the second entree to be server  which was a total of about    minutes. in additional the wait staff was rather inattentive and made few appearances at the table. because of this experience mark will not be returning to needle and pin for a meal. mark would however go back for cocktails at the bar. the gin cocktail list was unique and the cocktail mark ordered was very good.

needle and pin, pris, holy crap ! mouth orgasm. as a group  pris ordered   or so dishes and shared amongst ourselves. the brunch dishes were delicious ! the only sub par one was the omelette. for having only one other table to service  the food took quite a while. to deal with our hangriness pris ordered mimosas and boy were mimosas good.
