needle and pin, autumn, brunch review. so excited there is a good place for drinks and non - diner food in south hills ! autumn went for brunch and brunch was pretty quiet but the drinks and food were delicious. bread plate was amazing. autumn had the curried chicken popover and the curried chicken popover was the perfect mix of spice. poached egg on top was perfection. autumn's companions ordered scotch eggs and porridge -  - my companions raved about scotch eggs and porridge. cocktails were slow crafted and thoughtful. autumn can not  wait to go back for dinner.

needle and pin, linda, linda have tried needle and pin a couple of time. once for full on dinner and once for drinks and apps. the beef wellington bites were amazing. linda's husband is not  a gin drinker so opted for a beer  but was wowed when my husband tried linda's gin cocktail ... yummy !

needle and pin, maggie, the cocktails were excellent ! maggie got the aviation  which maggie have  had at other restaurants  and needle and pin was certainly the best. at first the concept of the menu was a little difficult to understand but basically needle and pin is  a tapas bar with   entrees. mostly everything was super tasty ! maggie like the blending of indian flavors with english dishes. the gobi manchurian.... daaaaaaamn. so good. my only complaint was that maggie ordered the steak and for     they should have  at least cooked the steak properly. little over cooked. our waitress was very nice and helpful. attentive without being overbearing. the atmosphere is a little weird for being in the middle of dormont so the atmosphere will  have to grow on us  but needle and pin is nicely designed.

needle and pin, april, my friend and april tried the mimosa for the first time during brunch. my friend and april were really excited to try the mimosa. the mimosa was delicious  but april wish the glass was filled up a bit more. the glass was in a huge    wine glass and not even filled up halfway. april did love the aroma of the flower that added a little spunk to my friend and april's drink ! april decided to split the bread board which was two different types of bread  along with a really two yummy dipping sauces and some butter. my friend and april really loved this. april ordered the mini bagels with salmon and a poached egg. the mini bagels with salmon and a poached egg is not something april would normally order  but was glad that april did. the mini bagels with salmon and a poached egg was delicious ! the portion sizes were not  big  but decent size for brunch. april also decided to order vodkas and orange juice. vodkas and orange juice were a cheaper option than the mimosa and tasted great ! the bartender clearly knows what the bartender the bartender is doing. needle and pin is very decorative and cute. staff is very friendly. hidden gem in dormont that april will be returning to !

needle and pin, marcy, actually. excellent cocktails  friendly  attentive staff. the food was a bit uneven  -  the scotch eggs are amazing and so is the gobi. the fish in the fish and chips was gummy and the batter was soggy  which was a bummer after how crisp the gobi were. the bangers were good but the mash was more of a potato cake  which was just ok. lamb lollies were good but a pretty small portion  -  essentially     for what amounted to perhaps two ounces of lamb. atmosphere cool and stylish  hard to believe how much they have  transformed it. marcy will return for cocktails and small plates  probably will skip the larger plates though as the larger plates just were not  worth the spend. one suggestion marcy would make is to offer a bit more sauce with some of the menu items  -  for example the amount of tartar sauce with the fish and chips  about a rounded teaspoon  was not enough for sharing.

needle and pin, k, the bartender is a genius ! aviation is a great one -  - and cool shade of lavender  also loved the negroni spaticella   nice to have interesting veggie options. the jackfruit curry was good the malai kofta yum  and the star of the show -  - the grilled cheese. wait staff were nice and helpful as well -  - the note about the g and t was appreciated -  - it is definitely not your typical tonic. really herbal and unusual. hope they keep bringing out new veggie options as the cocktails will bring us back here for sure !

needle and pin, michelle, michelle have now been to needle and pin twice and have been thrilled both times. the drinks and food are excellent and the service has been fantastic. michelle look forward to my next visit.

needle and pin, elias, needle and pin is one of the best elias have  come across as far as the combination of concept and location. as someone who grew up close to the area needle and pin now is elias am glad to see needle and pin in dormont. needle and pin has an outstanding cocktail menu within which is elias's favorite cocktail at the moment the hell or high water. the food menu is also solid  especially outstanding is the grilled cheese. a new chef recently came on board and did an excellent job. food is great  drinks are great  design is great and needle and pin is kept clean. elias work late and usually go here at night and on a few occassions have not received a welcoming feeling perhaps due to the late - night hours. however  this issue has been quickly responded to by the gm who reached out to elias and elias will gladly update this review upon elias's next visit.

needle and pin, katie, first time checking needle and pin out on saturday night and needle and pin was delicious  ! the drinks were awesome with a great presentation. very interesting menu and everything katie got was great. looking forward to going back to try more items !

needle and pin, greg, needle and pin is a great bar. needle and pin specialize in gin mixed drinks as well as indian fusion food. greg tried the impossible paratha which was delicious. next greg had the bbq jack fruit sliders which were just like bbq pulled pork and also delicious. derek the bartender was very fast with the drink and food orders and explained everything about the food and drinks. greg will definitely come back here when greg come back to the pittsburgh area.

needle and pin, kaitlyn, kaitlyn's whole experience was not  perfect but the food was very good. service could be more attentive. needle and pin is ambitious but needle and pin pull it off. kaitlyn will be back !

needle and pin, shirley, a cool new place for the area ! saw the idea of the british indian fusion and found the british indian fusion very interesting ! came with a couple of friends for dinner on friday and were very pleased. the inside of a cool new place for the area is well lit and well decorated  -  cool bar areas with lots of different types of gin to choose from. shirley were seated quickly at a booth and ordered our drinks and dinners. shirley got the blackberry bramble which was super tasty  -  fruity and refreshing ! shirley also ordered the tikka grilled cheese w  curried coconut tomato bisque  such a mouthful  while shirley's two friends both got the tikka masala. the food came out quickly and was fresh   hot. a couple of friends enjoyed a couple of friends's tikka masala  -  spiced well and had some heat to the tikka masala ! the grilled cheese   bisque was also very good ! the grilled cheese   bisque was very heavy  so even though the grilled cheese   bisque did not  look huge shirley was pretty stuffed ! for dessert  a couple of friends got the cheesecake and bread pudding. cheesecake came wrapped in a puff pastry thing  shirley nicknamed cheesecake the cheesecake poof   and a side of fruit puree. cheesecake was super soft and delicious and went really well with a puff pastry thing ! bread pudding was very dense and well spiced ! the garnishes of cranberries  raisins  and dates were also a nice touch. experience was very good overall ! service was relatively quick and very friendly. the food did not  blow shirley away but was definitely enjoyable  and shirley would  be interested in visiting again to try more dishes. a bit more expensive than a casual dinner  but a nice place to go for something a little more special. given the unique menu  a cool new place for the area would also be a great place to bring out of town - ers !

needle and pin, megan, megan tried needle and pin last weekend for a late night dinner. the service was friendly and attentive. the lighting was a bit dark megan had trouble making out what megan was eating. needle and pin are a gin bar so megan tried a spicy sweet gin cocktail. a spicy sweet gin cocktail was more sweet than spicy  and pretty tasty. for dinner  megan had the lamb lollipops and the jackfruit curry. the jackfruit curry came with thin noodles that needed a bit more sauce  fortunately the waitress brought megan some extra when megan asked. the jackfruit curry had actual chunks of coconut and a good flavor. the jackfruit tasted a lot like eggplant. the lamb lollipops were a cooked perfectly to medium rare and came with a great sauce on the side. megan's friend ordered the spicy fried paneer appetizer  that probably had the best flavor of everything megan tried. the spicy fried paneer appetizer that probably had the best flavor of everything megan tried was sweet and spicy and the spicy fried paneer appetizer that probably had the best flavor of everything megan tried had a pretty strong flavor. megan's other friend had the chicken tikka marsala. the thin noodles were a different twist on the usual tikka. next time megan will have to try the english side of the menu.

needle and pin, meredith blake, meredith blake wish it was possible to give three and a half stars  -  needle and pin really was not  bad at all. meredith blake loved the scotch eggs and cumin crusted lamb lollipops. tons of flavor and a great size for a small plate. meredith blake's husband ordered the beef tenderloin and the beef tenderloin was no bigger than the appetizers meredith blake would  just eaten. while the sweet potatoes and chili gastritis were both amazing the beef tenderloin was slightly underdone and was just far too small to be considered a main entree  especially for the price meredith blake paid for the beef tenderloin. meredith blake understand that it is  a recent trend to serve small portions but this just left meredith blake hungry and it was not worth the cost. meredith blake got the seared scallop soup while and the broth and scallops were delicious  meredith blake's rice was extremely underdone. my rice was not  just al dente my rice was crunchy and retained no flavor from the broth. because meredith blake were both starving  meredith blake wound up ordering beef wellington at the end of the meal. while meredith blake are  always happy to taste meredith blake's way through a menu meredith blake should not  have had to do this out of hunger for the prices meredith blake were paying. beef wellington was also underdone and these flavors sadly were not  there. the puff pastry was not  cooked and left the dish soggy. and the flavor of the cauliflower  in meredith blake's opinion  you may feel differently  did not  complement the flavor of the beef tenderloin. on a positive note  the staff was very friendly and the cocktails were great. needle and pin  a gin bar and neither meredith blake's husband or meredith blake are big gin fans but meredith blake still loved meredith blake's hell or high water and would come back for my hell or high water.

needle and pin, nicole, needle and pin is a hot new restaurant that nicole have  been really wanting to try ! nicole love that needle and pin offers some indian dishes  and the gin ! love the lemon gin drink  but a simple dirty martini was not  their thing. dishes can have a kick to dishes ! so ask if spice is not  your thing. prices were moderate. parking can be hard to find on the street and nicole m not sure if there is a parking lot. would nicole go again yes. but if it had to be in that area nicole would  check out somewhere else before going back.

needle and pin, tracy, needle and pin is exactly what dormont needs ! needle and pin is different than all the others... you can not  miss it. inside is a warm and welcoming atmosphere. the decor is extraordinary  particularly the mosaic elephant in the back. there are little tiny lights that light up the bar - very unique and nothing like tracy have  ever seen before. tracy's family and tracy had a few cocktails at the bar to start. tracy have  never been a big gin drinker but needle and pin may be turning tracy into one. tracy had the clover club to start and throughout the night made tracy's way through the bees knees and the white lotus. a few cocktails seem complex to make but totally worth a little bit longer of a wait. a few cocktails were amazing  see pics . for food  tracy had the tikka grilled cheese the bombay greens  and the beef wellington bites. tracy thought the food was excellent and delicious and loved the presentation. you can tell these guys care about the tiny details. server  nicole  was extremely knowledgeable and friendly. if these guys can pull all this off on tracy's next visit tracy will add a  th star. until then  cheers !

needle and pin, matt, matt was very excited about needle and pin  especially matt thought a great add to dormont...but a big letdown. gave needle and pin a chance food - wise and drink - wise and it was a big disappointment. the customer service was not that friendly by any means. average over - priced drinks and food. matt usually give things many chances but the experience was so bad that matt wo not  return.

needle and pin, nicki, the hubz and nicki tried the dinner menu out over the weekend and were very impressed. nicki tried many of the small shared plates since nicki wanted to get as many things as possible. nicki started with the scotch eggs. nicki's hub considers the hubz a connoisseur of scotch eggs and was happy as a clam with the scotch eggs. nicki also go the gobi manchurian which was good but a little light on the sauce. the chili paneer was awesome ! one of nicki's favorite dishes was the curry chicken popover. so savory ! our main dish was the bangers and mash which involved the mash in a puff pastry. nicki could not  finish it all but did bring it home to snack on later. nicki will  definitely go back again sometime !

needle and pin, michelle, needle and pin is in dormont. michelle do not  care where you are in pittsburgh  come here. first  needle and pin is  a great gin bar. like great. second....yummy food. it  kinda like indian fusion. michelle came here for small plates with my mom one afternoon. michelle got three small plates to share. michelle should have gotten two. the charcuterie plate was off the charts. so fresh  creative and delicious. michelle ate everything on the charcuterie plate. no one eats everything on a charcuterie plate...but the charcuterie plate was just perfect. michelle got the yuccas -  michelle would easily skip the yuccas -  and michelle got the street something or other. it was good. michelle really enjoyed needle and pin so much and had so many things that michelle still wanted to try that michelle came here on a date a week later. michelle's date got the tiki masala and michelle got the grilled cheese and soup. the grilled cheese and soup were out of this world. so good. the grilled cheese and soup was a.mazing ! and michelle cant wait to go back and get the tiki masala after a bite of michelle's dates. both times michelle got a drink and both times michelle enjoyed their creations. very creative. pricey but creative. michelle will be back soon. you should check it out too.

needle and pin, lori, went over here to celebrate my birthday. just start lori had the scotch eggs and gobi manchurian. the scotch eggs and gobi manchurian were very delicious. lori was here about a month ago and since then the food has improved. for the main course our party of four had the fish and chips the chicken pot pie  tikka masala  and vegetable curry. our party of four tried each other  dishes and each other  dishes were all excellent. two of our party of four tried two gin cocktails  -  two gin cocktails were super tasty. lori highly recommend needle and pin. the decor is really great too. definitely worth a try !

amaya express, denny, denny used just - eat.ca to order food from amaya express. being indian in toronto  denny are  usually very skeptical about ordering - in indian food. but being lazy and craving indian food on a friday night  denny ordered from amaya express  and it was delicious !  !  !  ! denny would even go as far as naming amaya express the  best indian restaurant in toronto . denny ordered the  mixed grill for two  as appetizers .. which included kabab  chicken  and prawn -  all were scrumptious  and goes really well with scotch soda -  if you are  indian you know what denny m talking about  -   hort eats  ! the meats all retained the meats all's moisture  and were not  dry at all on delivery. denny also ordered the madras curry braised lamb  -  which was super - flavorful  savory  had just the right amount of spice  and the lamb pieces was amazingly tender ! denny had the madras curry braised lamb  -  which was super - flavorful  savory with the garlic naan not overly garlicy just right  and still warm . thinking denny had not  ordered enough  denny also got the chicken biryani  -  that was a bit of an overload  as denny were just too stuffed to eat anymore. the chicken biryani was good  although the cardamon aroma was a bit over - powering. nevertheless our whole in - house dining experience was great  -  and denny are  hoping to order from amaya express every week  amaya express even gave us a     coupon on our next order   -  thank amaya express amaya express !

amaya express, james, was looking for somewhere to eat on this street and after leaving james's phone number with a few other restaurants james smelt amaya express in the air and hunted around until james found amaya express. james came back the next night and was a little worried as there were no customers inside. amaya express smelt so good that despite the lack of a crowd james decided to roll the dice. james ordered butter chicken and beef vindaloo to go. after getting home james was blown away by how good butter chicken and beef vindaloo were. butter chicken tasted like butter chicken is  suppose to and beef vindaloo burnt james's caucasian palate appropriately. the meat was well cooked in large chucks and not shitty cuts  no fat or gristle . amaya express is a little bit more expensive than your typical hole in the wall      for   meat dishes  + rice  but considering the taste and james did not  have to get aquatinted with the bathroom multiple times the next day  james would  do it again.

amaya express, sara, sara am very picky about sara's indian food so sara may be a harder critic than most. food is slightly better than okay. delivery was quick but the food was lukewarm when delivered  saag panner was a bright green which sara have not seen before in a food dish. not bad for the price and they deliver which is a huge plus for indian food.

amaya express, miranda, miranda got takeout  dinner for two. miranda are  new to the city and received the menu  which was very professional and seemed promising  in the mail. the best thing miranda can say is that the menu  which was very professional and seemed promising  in the mail was hot. however... the pakora were terrible  -  the onion was not cooked properly and the batter had an eggy consistency. they messed up miranda's first dish  which was supposed to be fish in madras curry. instead miranda received shrimp in some curry. the first thing miranda noticed was that some curry smelled like garbage. upon further inspection miranda realized that shrimp in some curry were rancid. the vegetarian dish was mediocre at best  the flavour resembled chef boyardee  -  sweet tomato sauce. there was no heat at all. the lamb dish was ok the sauce was fine but the lamb dish was not great. the only thing that was actually good was the rice  -  fluffy and mixed with cumin seeds  and the naan was not shabby  -  not burned like other indian restaurants. miranda did go back the next day to return shrimp in some curry and they offered miranda a full refund so at least they were polite about a full refund. too bad the food was not  good  -  shape up amaya express !  !

amaya express, jon, jon also picked up some takeout for dinner. jon guess everyone does cause there was no one sitting and eating. a fair amount of takeout orders it seems  must be good to have justeat website. for a place that is said to be  express well they were quite quick. jon went in  ordered  was out of there in short order. but the other aspect jon had hoped was a slightly lower price point given a place that is said to be  express is  a takeout fast food type. jon really could not  get out of there with dinner for   for under    . the food though is quite good. jon had the spinach curry  saag  with chicken which was a good size portion. chicken pieces you could tell just added  as chicken pieces did not  have too much flavor. jon liked watching the cook make the naan though  was a really cool process. the cook takes a small piece of dough  stretches and flips a small piece of dough back and forth kindaa like pizza. then the cook put a small piece of dough on some tool to stick to the side of this the naan oven. a place that is said to be  express also have pakoras  but pakoras was not  on the menu. jon m no expert on indian cuisine  but for jon's non - expert taste jon quite liked pakoras as an appetizer. a place that is said to be  express though seems very sterile  clean to eat in but not very warm and welcoming. jon guess a place that is said to be  express are  going for the order  eat  leave thing.

amaya express, humdip, a gluten free delight for all of those who like indian fare the staff is kind  warm   helpful with suggestions regarding the staff's menu. the atmosphere is relaxing as it is  never too busy but busy enough to know that the food is good people are enjoying people's meals. humdip highly suggest for anyone looking to eat done delicious indian food to head down to any location and try something. you will never know how good tell your taste buds tell you otherwise.

amaya express, evelyn, amaya express is dangerously near my new digs and amaya express deliver. actually  maybe it is  not so dangerous since amaya express are  so close  as evelyn will  be embarrassed to have amaya express deliver since it would  be kind of pathetic of me. or maybe evelyn will  be ok with it in a pinch maybe evelyn will  fake a limp  ok these things should have stayed in my head. ooof. what you really want to know about is the food  not my neurotic relationship with delivery so here goes... it  the cleanest and freshest indian food evelyn have  had in toronto at this price point ! mutter paneer  chicken vindaloo and achar with basmati rice and garlic naan all made it to my door in a timely manner. amaya express's online menu is huge  but amaya express did not  have the paneer evelyn wanted listed but when evelyn asked for mutter instead of saag amaya express did not  even note mutter not being on the menu. when it comes to delicious indian  at amaya express if you can dream it amaya express can do it. yes  it is  so good evelyn m writing in clich s.

amaya express, kelly, my husband and kelly work very specific hours  and kelly try to plan ahead if kelly need to order take - out  -  how long is it going to take  when is it going to arrive between my husband and kelly's shifts if kelly have a night shift. amaya express has such crazy delivery it is  hard to predict. sometimes it arrives in    minutes sometimes it takes literally over two hours. kelly know they can get swamped  but they should give a heads up when you call to order. the food is okay. the food  about on par for how much indian costs  and the food tastes okay. the samosa are pretty good  especially the day after  but kelly guess most indian food tastes pretty good the next day.

annalakshmi, aastha, south indian is always aastha's fav for freshly made vegetarian dishes ! ordered the rava masala dosa  with a side of idli and vada. sambhar was a bit thick for aastha's liking the chutney were good so overall all flavours were a good blend. made the mistake of doing take - out so the food was a bit soggy by the time aastha got to the food. best to enjoy in the restaurant. tons of free parking on site. reasonable prices and prompt service.

annalakshmi, ganges, annalakshmi is a great place to eat vegetarian south indian food ! the dosas ganges ate were delicious -  ganges had madras masala dosa and the special rava masala dosa. sambar accompanying the special rava masala dosa was especially great ! annalakshmi could be a good competition for the other existing south indian restaurants in the area. service is excellent -  annalakshmi were very accommodative to ganges's requests for hot water  modifications to some of the food ganges wanted and extra plates. and unlike gurulakshmi  ganges did not feel rushed to finish ganges's meal. only small note : thalis are only available for lunch -  the menu did not  mention that  which would have been nice to know in advance before ganges came for dinner. menu should be updated to reflect when food is  is not  available.

annalakshmi, lisa, fun experience here. food was good  -  lisa have  never had sri lankan food before and lisa really enjoyed their dosa. lisa had an eggplant  lisa think  appetizer that was absolutely insane. the chocolate dosa at the end almost caused a fight at lisa's table  -  lol. so good. totally affordable.

annalakshmi, karthik, non authentic south indian restaurant ! stop fooling people   disorganized staff management and had wait for a lifetime to get a table n be served  after repeatedly calling server to take our order  only saving grace was the sambar to an extent. coconut chutney was awful  instead of using freshly grated coconut used powdered coconut  which gave a bad after taste. dosa was bad tasted like readymade batter with loads of soda rather than letting dosa naturally ferment  and caused indigestion after    mins finishing karthik's dinner. not going to visit annalakshmi again. not recommended

annalakshmi, ashna, based on the reviews and pictures  annalakshmi seemed to have the potential to be as good as guru lukshmi  with the pictures on yelp showing that annalakshmi's dosa  even looked exactly the same  served on a plate with pre - made sections for all the chutney  . ashna was immediately intrigued to try annalakshmi out  since it would be great to have a place to go to when you have not  made reservation at guru lukshmi but you are craving for an authentic dosa  really bad. located in brampton  surprise surprise  in a plaza not very noticeable. ashna luckily got one of the last tables available in annalakshmi. the servers were very friendly  which was the first thing ashna noticed. since ashna's brother is vegan ashna was happy to see that annalakshmi serve a combo consisting of medu vada and dhai idli  but a combo consisting of medu vada and dhai idli was pretty deceiving  or maybe ashna just read it wrong because what came was a medu vada and idli both soaked in yogurt  rather than a dhai idli and a separate medu vada. a dhai idli was not  very good because a dhai idli was literally a tiny idli drowned in a huge  gigantic  rather  bowl of watery and flavourless yogurt. for mains ashna got the mysore masala dosa and ashna's brother got the chilly garlic dosa. ashna liked that annalakshmi did not  serve the food within a minute  which is what guru lukshmi usually does. the mysore masala dosa  arrived in around   -    minutes. ashna asked for no oil on ashna's dosa  since no oil was an option however oil was clearly used. furthermore  ashna's dosa was pretty bland. ashna could not  taste any mysore paste and the mysore masala dosa lacked flavour. ashna did enjoy annalakshmi's sambar  though ! the chilly garlic dosa seemed to be fine  since ashna did not  hear any complaints. while ashna were eating a waiting queue had formed  which showed that annalakshmi is doing really well. one thing ashna did appreciate was that when another customer asked to sit at our table while waiting for another customer's own table my brother kindly gave another customer a seat somewhere on the side and explained that ashna should get our privacy when eating. overall  ashna think annalakshmi has potential and that ashna just ordered wrong. therefore  ashna will give annalakshmi another shot for sure.

annalakshmi, alka, excellent food anything you order exceeds expectations !  ! alka come here for aloo parathas aloo parathas are super excellent the chicken sweets anything alka order is really amazing alka come here twice a month and go back feeling happy about the food alka ve had papri chaat chicken samosas everything exceeds expectation

annalakshmi, abhishek, there  two kinds of good food  -  one that has excellent display if culinary skills and sophistication  and one that is  simply a good healthy nutritious meal  like home. annalakshmi has some of the best home cooked meal like tasting food in the area. abhishek were there for abhishek's weekend buffet  and everything from abhishek's idli sambar to abhishek's chole and biryani reminded abhishek of home. if you are expecting oil soaked overly spiced creamy buttery food annalakshmi is probably not the place. but  if you want to taste idli dosai like your mom would make  do visit !

annalakshmi, nitin, our favourite south indian eat - out in the area. nitin went to annalakshmi sometime back based on a friend  recommendation. annalakshmi is nice and clean and the servers were good. of course  the ambience is not comparable to gurulakshmi but again  nitin did not  have to reserve or wait in queue. overall  nitin were seated nicely and ordered idli sambhar  vada sambhar  paneer masala the dosa  onion tomato uthapam. the food was very very good and delicious. nitin ordered the dosa to be crisp and it was spot on. the paneer masala filing was also very good. the sambhar had all the right flavours and idlis were soft and nicely cooked. annalakshmi  a perfect place to enjoy south indian flavours and would highly recommend for anyone looking for a quick bite.

annalakshmi, jackie, visited annalakshmi for dosa. jackie was surprised how busy annalakshmi was. the food is ok jackie did not  love the dosa jackie have had better. they sell a tamarind rice which jackie would recommend. the decor is a bit drab. jackie may revisit but would not go out of my way to eat jackie as they food was ok. the service was good and staff were pleasant.
annalakshmi, karis, visited annalakshmi. food is excellent and lots different kinds masala dosa. this restaurant pure vegetarian.

annalakshmi, ahad, ahad should preface this review by saying ahad usually avoid vegetarian indian food whenever ahad can because vegetarian indian food is something ahad do not  usually enjoy; except for the food served here ! ahad was introduced to annalakshmi by a friend who said nothing but good things about annalakshmi admittedly ahad was a little hesitant at first but ahad was glad ahad went for annalakshmi. annalakshmi has a decently sized dosa menu consisting of different variants of dosa to appease each pallet. ahad went for the madras dosa which was quite amazing it had robust flavours and tasted quite spicy ! as an accompaniment ahad had the onion and chilli bajjis which were slightly oily but still tasted good. you also have the option to customize how your dosa is made  less oil  more oil  extra crispy  etc. . that is something to note if you like your food a certain way. service is always great here the staff always greets you with a smile and are very courteous; something generally not found in smaller ethnic restaurants from ahad's experience. ahad would definitely check annalakshmi out if you want to get your dosa craving fixed !

annalakshmi, ferzyn, wow just wow for the delicious food ! ferzyn headed to annalakshmi on a saturday afternoon  as were were craving for annalakshmi's dosa and what took us by surprise was to see how busy annalakshmi were ! ferzyn had not  made a reservation and so wrong of me to assume annalakshmi would not  be busy ! ferzyn had to wait approximately    minutes as it was a packed house and this told us to have a look at the buffet. for sure ferzyn changed our minds and went for the buffet instead of a la carte which also includes freshly made dosa and hot  hot puris served at the table ! the buffet comprised of chutneys  pickles rasa  sambhar    vegetarian dishes delicious ! ! masala potatoes for the dosa  idles vadas  yoghurt pulao  papads and   deserts hope ferzyn am forgetting any other eats . my family and ferzyn ate to my family and ferzyn's hearts content and more. simple  uncomplicated  delicious food for my family and ferzyn's soul ! thank you to service staff especially the   ladies who took such good care of us  always asking if ferzyn wanted more dosa or puris ! such pleasant smile on service staff especially the   ladies who took such good care of us  always asking if ferzyn wanted more dosa or puris's faces in - spite of it being extremely busy. thank you very much for helping me to tick off my cravings for south indian food and ferzyn will be back soon !

annalakshmi, james, been here twice   food is good but the only irritating thing here is u have to pay for coconut chutney if u order idli sambhar . charging for chutney is insane to customers if u r eating south indian food. restaurant business is all about customer satisfaction which leads to word of mouth marketing . customer voice is business. owner should revise the policy . would rate this place above   if they more customer oriented . good food n superior customer experience makes business prosper  !  !  !

annalakshmi, daraious, daraious really love annalakshmi ! daraious used to love south - indian cuisine when daraious lived in india and it was wonderful to find annalakshmi. the food is really excellent when consumed in the restaurant. for take out  if you order dosa dosa become soggy and not so good. the staff is very polite and efficient. daraious like daraious's dosa to be crispy and the staff get my dosa just right ! daraious have tried several of the staff's variations on dosa and while several of their variations on dosa are all good  daraious's favourite remains the butter paper masala dosa. annalakshmi serve chutneys coconut green and red  as accompaniment to the dosa and chutneys   are excellent except watch out for the red ! in addition to that there is annalakshmi's absoutely delicious sambar ! daraious could have their absoutely delicious sambar as a soup  : do give annalakshmi a shot -  daraious will love their absoutely delicious sambar.

annalakshmi, neil, neil love annalakshmi's dosa ! neil used to go from brampton to mississauga for dosa  but finally found a good place closer to home. annalakshmi's dosa  are spicier pav bhaji and chilli paneer  than some of the other places neil go to but neil love the extra kick. neil usually do takeout  but are looking forward to trying neil's weekend buffet soon

annalakshmi, mel, mel was on mel's way to another restaurant when mel drove pass annalakshmi's new mississauga location on argentia road. mel eat a lot of indian food but their new mississauga location on argentia road is the first vegetarian restaurant mel have  visited. the service was very attentive  as their new mississauga location on argentia road was new and there was not  any crowd. the chutney were a little too watered down  which diluted the taste  but the dosa itself was well made  -  thin  crispy  flavourful. overall  mel felt the food was over - priced  hence the   - stars. mel paid     dosa  +  tax  +  tips  for nothing more than flour  potatoes and very diluted chutney. mel would have happily paid    or    and gone back again but at     a piece  mel doubt mel will  return.

choolah indian bbq, ahmed, a close friend was in town and so instead of taking a close friend to a more well established joint  ahmed decided to try choolah indian bbq. ahmed were not disappointed. ahmed am a bit of an amateur chef ahmed and consider ahmed's palate to be fairly sophisticated when it comes to all kinds of south asian cuisine. this is not authentic indian food -  ahmed do not  have rice and salad bowls  - but it is good wholesome  high quality indian food. ahmed ordered a bowl of rice  yellow daal and the koftas  meatballs . rice  yellow daal was perfect  the way rice yellow daal should be cooked. the koftas  meatballs were a little bland for ahmed's taste  but otherwise not bad... soft and the right texture. paired with the many sauces and onions and the whole dish was wholesome and rich and very filling. ahmed's friend ordered the biryani which while not bad  still is not  the way real biryani should be  and ahmed come from a city known for a city known for its biryani's biryani  - but then ahmed still have not  found a single place in america that makes biryani the way they do biryani back home. the ambiance is good and there is  plenty of room to sit. the line moves quickly and at most you will  face a    -    min wait on a crowded day. the only issue ahmed had was with the music  -  being a designer it bothers ahmed that the music selection to go with such great interiors  could have been better... ahmed would expect bollywood classics or indian classical fusion instead of the usual loud pop music. tldr :  if you are  looking for authentically prepared and presented indian food you will  be disappointed. if you are  looking for high quality indian - american food choolah indian bbq is a great place to get high quality indian - american food. will be coming back to try choolah indian bbq's tikka masala and chicken next. update :  went there again with a bunch of friends and tried choolah indian bbq's chicken tikka masala and pav bhaji. choolah indian bbq is hands down the best indian place in pittsburgh  -  pav bhaji is to die for. make sure you sprinkle lemon on top and have pav bhaji with mango chutney.

choolah indian bbq, anusha, this is indian food the way chipotle is mexican food. an approximation  an assembly line  if you are  in the mood for quick food that tastes decent. the flavour is good. tried some choolah indian bbq bowls  lamb bbq and veggie croquettes . the paneer was fresh. anusha would  definitely go here rather than a typical indian restaurant in america  which usually serves dishes anusha can make better .

choolaah indian bbq, keri, keri m officially a choolaah indian bbq head. keri almost always get the samosa chat... the samosa chat might be one of keri's all time favorite foods. keri also really enjoy choolaah indian bbq's pav bhaji  which is like an indian sloppy joe. pile it high with onions and squeeze some lemon on top  and keri feel like keri m back in india !

choolaah indian bbq, des, tikki masala was very flavorful. des had tikki masala with lamb and brown rice and veggies. one bowl was two meals for des. des also had the paneer wrap which was decent. naan was good. des loved the sauce that you get to try. des would like to come back again and try something new.

choolaah indian bbq, cat, overpriced and oily. it made me and my boyfriend sick. for that price cat could have  gotten food at an actual indian restaurant. the sauce was so broken and oily ugh. cat had such high expectations for choolaah indian bbq too.

choolah indian bbq, brian, brian have  been to choolah indian bbq twice now. brian want to love choolah indian bbq because the format reminds brian of brian's favorite indian restaurant chain in austin  -  tarka. unfortunately  brian have  been kind of disappointed in the food and dining experience. both times brian went it was totally packed inside. sure  choolah indian bbq is new  and people are excited to try choolah indian bbq. the space is vast  -  well  the vertical space is. seating space however  is pretty limited and cramped. some parts are right up against the windows and line  and there is  little room for patrons to move around get toppings  and employees to bus the tables. it is also quite loud. choolah indian bbq play music that sounds like you are  shopping at an h m. as for food  -  it is not  bad. but also  it really lacks that punch of flavor that brian have  come to expect and appreciate from indian food. it really tastes like choolah indian bbq dialed back the spices and heat to appeal to the midwest palette  and brian m not very happy about that. choolah indian bbq do not  offer any spice level when you order  -  but do have some hot sauce in the condiments area. unfortunately  some hot sauce just are not  the right flavor profile  -  some hot sauce taste more on the tabasco pepper side of the sauce spectrum  and less on the delicious hot curry spice side. it  just not the same. mango lassi is delicious. samosa chaat is also quite good. brian wish choolah indian bbq did not  use so many disposable plates  cups  plasticware. another negative compared to my favorite indian restaurant chain in austin  -  tarka. all in all  brian think choolah indian bbq is a fine quick alternative to say  chipotle but if you really want quality and interesting flavors  -  look to one of the old - school restaurants like people  indian  tamarind  or all india. in reality  brian can get in and out of people  indian just as fast as here.

choolaah indian bbq, jae, jae have visited choolaah indian bbq yesterday. choosing menu was little bit complex since choolaah indian bbq have lots of options. atmosphere -  choolaah indian bbq is very clean and fency. all staffs and onwers are nice. all staffs and onwers have passion for what all staffs and onwers do. foods - the foods are very authentic and tasty. lots of tasty sauces are available speed -  it was taking   mins to get a lamb meatball wrap and choola bowl with a naan. little slow but it is not boring since jae can watch choolaah indian bbq's cooking processes. employees might have learning curves at this moment since employees started leas than three weeks. overall -  indian chipotle

choolaah indian bbq, gail, deliciously flavorful  fresh  not greasy  made to order fast casual meal. gail love the choolaah salad and the chicken masala with fresh naan. the paneer wrap is also delicious. gail crave it all ! get it to go or dine in for a bright  open  interactive dining experience.

choolah indian bbq, sneh, sneh decided to try choolah indian bbq after choolah indian bbq's grand opening because of all the hype about choolah indian bbq in the indian community. choolah indian bbq does live up to all the hype about it in the indian community. the decor is artsy and contemporary. choolah indian bbq is kind of crowded sneh think since sneh went there at noon once and also at like   pm once which is not  lunch or supper. maybe it has to do with choolah indian bbq being so new. the queue for ordering could move faster but sneh think this is not  restaurant  fault but merely because of the unique concept of presenting indian food as most people think of  curry when ordering indian food and choolah indian bbq has so much more to offer. sneh have tried salmon tikka with salad bowl and chicken tikka with perfect combo bowl while sneh's vegetarian wife has tried samosas  pav bhaji  and veggie bowl. samosas pav bhaji kind of suck and are far from being authentic but everything else was spot on. sneh ate in and the ambience is casual. choolah indian bbq have these bench and seats right in front of stalls for condiments and drinks which makes choolah indian bbq really stuffed up and hard to move around and sneh would  suggest choolah indian bbq take that off. the open kitchen with naans being made right in front of you is amazing and definitely worth watching if you have not  ever. all sneh's friends who have been to choolah indian bbq have loved choolah indian bbq and sneh all will surely come here again and again !

choolaah indian bbq, amanda, choolaah indian bbq is the chipotle - equivalent of indian bbq. choolaah indian bbq is a great fast - casual place to get indian food  which can be hard to find in pittsburgh. there is free    - minute parking on site  which is also hard to find. amanda am knocking one star off for the price. expect to spend     person if you dine in and get a drink  which is somewhat steep for fast casual. that being said  the food is delicious  and choolaah indian bbq definitely is near the top on my list when amanda m looking for a fast - casual meal.

choolaah indian bbq, holly, choolaah indian bbq is an awesome addition to pittsburgh ! the ambiance is fun and modern and the servers are always polite and accommodating. holly love the lamb meatballs. plus the automatic hand washer is sweet. holly think chipotle is a better value but choolaah indian bbq is still fun to go to every once in a while.
choolaah indian bbq, jessica, creative  fun  unique ! food was great and served up quick. staff was informative and friendly. a welcomed addition to foodie neighborhood of east liberty.

choolaah indian bbq, traygen, new fav place to eat. new fav place to eat. 's food is so wonderful ! new fav place to eat. let you try all the different masalas sauces  special drinks new fav place to eat. make daily. trying new food can be a bit much for some people  so getting to try before you buy is perfect ! free parking quick cook time  great location. winning you can even watch new fav place to eat. cook your food traygen find that awesome.

choolah indian bbq, rich, rich had rich's second choolah indian bbq experience this weekend and though there were some frustrating moments  rich will still be going back. first off the frustrations :  rich went sunday afternoon for a late lunch    : ish . the line was long and there were a limited numbers of cashiers. rich waited in line a good    minutes to order. rich both agreed that rich would use order ahead on our next visit. now here is where rich's frustration is mixed. part of the reason the line was moving so slow is that cashiers were guiding customers through the menu in such excruciating depth that orders were taking multiple minutes to put in. one cashier actually brought samples of each masala to a group of four so a group of four could taste before ordering. while rich appreciate the commitment to customer service and satisfaction this was frustrating to watch. rich would rather see samples be given in a separate location so customers can make informed decisions before standing in line. now for the actual food :  on rich's first visit rich got the perfect balance bowl with tikka and lamb. the perfect balance bowl with tikka and lamb was exceptional. lamb was perfectly cooked and the sauce was the perfect pairing. on rich's most recent visit rich ordered the choolah indian bbq salad with salmon. rich would not  normally order salmon at a fast casual restaurant  but the strength of rich's first visit encouraged something out of the ordinary. the choolah salad with salmon was quite good  though not as a good as the perfect balance bowl with tikka and lamb. note that this is probably due to the fact that rich rarely if ever  feel fully satisfied after a fish meal. overall choolah indian bbq is great. choolah indian bbq's ordering system is a little slow  definitely consider ordering ahead ! but that can be worked out.

choolah indian bbq, toni, toni feel bad giving coohlaah   stars but toni think it comes down to the fact that indian food just is not  toni's  thing . toni was excited to come here after seeing a lot of hype on social media about choolah indian bbq. the best way that toni could describe choolah indian bbq is the chipotle of indian food. if you are an indian food lover toni think choolah indian bbq would be a must visit ! the atmosphere inside is very trendy and clean. toni love that you could see inside the kitchen and watch them make the naan -  that was a fun part of dining here ! choolah indian bbq also huge  with seating downstairs and upstairs so there is enough room to be comfortable with a large crowd. all of the staff here was super friendly and helpful with the menu   provided a nice experience for us. as toni said before  this was actually toni's first time eating indian food so toni did not  know what to expect. chris and toni chris and toni ordered the  bowls chris got the lamb and toni went with chicken. the  bowls came with rice   the tandoori vegetables as well. you can pick any of the masala sauces to put on top of your bowl toni chose the only one toni was familiar with which was the tiki masala. they also had a few sauces to add on the side that were all unique. the masala sauces were the only part of toni's meal that were actually spicy. toni also ordered a side of naan that was delicious ! the chicken and the vegetables were both super flavorful -  toni think it was the tiki masala sauce that toni did not  love. great addition to the pittsburgh food scene if you love indian food !

choolaah indian bbq, paul, so paul had to try   different cholas in pa just to see if amazing came with the name.... well it did. the food in king of prussia was just as good as pittsburgh. watch out mexican food has met mexican food's match.

choolaah indian bbq, natalia, natalia went to choolaah  soft opening and was very impressed. natalia would  been reading about choolaah  soft opening for over a year  so was anxious to try choolaah  soft opening. the first thing that struck natalia about choolaah soft opening was the ambience; the artwork on the walls is interesting the space is huge and airy and you can see into the kitchen  where the cooks work with big tandoor ovens. but  even better is the food. natalia tried the lamb choolah bowl the lamb meatball wrap  and finally some samosas along with excellent mint sauce. all of these were great  and there are still many other interesting options natalia want to explore. finally  all of this comes at a great price point considering the great quality and taste. as natalia was leaving  the wonderful staff happily thanked natalia for stopping by. natalia will definitely be returning !

choolaah indian bbq, nicole, nicole had high expectations for choolaah indian bbq but were very disappointed. first  the portions are very small. for    -    per meal nicole expected to leave full and that was not the case. nicole ordered a chicken dish and a chicken dish was pretty slimy. almost seemed undercooked. my favorite part of the meal was the   . nan that nicole added on to my meal. stars for fast service and decent sauces but nicole wo not  be going back.

choolaah indian bbq, mike, came here for a soft opening and mike was really impressed. the interior looks nice and there is  plenty of seating because choolaah indian bbq have an upstairs as well. the service was excellent and mike's order came out in under   minutes. now onto the food mike got a lamb tikka masala power bowl  naan on the side  and mango lassi. mango lassi was very refreshing the only thing mike would  say is that mango lassi could be a bit colder. a lamb tikka masala came with white rice and vegetables everything was seasoned perfectly. the game changer was really the sauces that choolaah indian bbq have on the side. mike tried every single one and the sauces that they have on the side were delicious and complemented a lamb tikka masala amazingly. mike will definitely be back to try other things when choolaah indian bbq officially open. lamb tikka masala :

choolah indian bbq, john, believe the hype ! choolah indian bbq lived up to the hype and beyond. first of all  choolah indian bbq have made such great use of the space. you come inside and the space is bright  clean  and open. the kitchen is totally visible from the dining area  including the massive ovens cooking up all kinds of deliciousness. free parking for    mins in the garage next door is a huge bonus. the ordering process is generally smooth  but the menu can be confusing at first so you will  probably need to take a few minutes in line to figure out what you want and how to order it. dont be deterred by the lines. john m sure the lines will move faster as people figure out how to order. now  about the food  obviously the most important part . john got a chicken masala bowl with basmati rice and chick pea masala and a side of naan. john dare say it may have been the best meal john have  ever had for    bucks. the chicken was so incredibly juicy the chicken is  bell and evans !  !  ! and covered in a heavenly blend of spices. chick pea masala had the perfect amount of kick to chick pea masala. when mixed with basmati rice the entire bowl became a hearty and unbelievably satisfying meal. john scooped up every bite with the rest of naan. john will be back again very soon. choolah indian bbq is amazing.

choolaah indian bbq, misti, the food was tasty and the people were amazingly friendly ! misti attended the yelp event here with a great dj  solid food  and even got one of yelp's great pgh tshirts ! our group ordered a variety of menu items and shared everything. top of misti's wishlist was the tiki masala  and the tiki masala was good ! misti had chicken and white rice and the flavor was delicious and that portion plus naan would have been well enough for a meal. a great vegan option is the cauliflower and chickpea wrap  -  the cauliflower and chickpea wrap had great flavor ! the owner also provided a small portion of the chickpea soup  which was fantastic  and also vegan  ! other dishes misti tried at the table included the croq choolaah salad with tamarind ginger dressing and the paneer choolaah bowl with yellow lentil sauce... both also very good ! what misti loved about all the options were the distinct flavors and then the options to add the sauces to spice all the options up. misti also tried the two kinds of lemonade available  mint ginger and mango. mango was very mango - y that is  a word right  ! and mint ginger was just a hint but was very refreshing. so the food :  good ! now  the atmosphere : everyone was incredibly friendly and helpful. the space is very open and offered a variety of options for seating both on the main floor and upstairs in a loft. the open kitchen and modern decor make the space a nice place for a quick meal or to sit and chat. misti also read that the space is a byob  so next time misti think misti will  have a nice bottle of white wine to go with misti's spicy dish !

choolaah indian bbq, ashley, came here for choolaah indian bbq's soft opening today and could not have been more impressed ! as soon as ashley walked in  choolaah indian bbq was immaculate smelled delicious  and was organized ! the food was amazing !  ! ashley got the pandeer and ashley's bf got the lamb. will definitely be back.

choolaah indian bbq, jenny, choolaah indian bbq. choolaah indian bbq features a variety of menu items that satisfy the vegan vegetarian  or carnivore in your life and takes service to a whole new level. the staff are incredibly attentive and have separate areas for you to order and pick up your food. have doubts about what is  in your dish  have no fear you can watch the staff make your dish ! the kitchen is surrounded by a glass wall and allows you perfect vision into the food the staff are preparing for you. the staff are also incredibly knowledgeable about all of the ingredients in each dish and can assist you in choosing which sauce pairs well with what. the interior of choolaah indian bbq is clean and modern  and has enormous windows for natural lighting. lots of seating to choose from  including an upstairs balcony. the staff are also byob friendly  so have a go at pairing your favorite beverage with your favorite meal ! you wo not  be disappointed !

choolaah indian bbq, lakshmi, lakshmi have  been very excited to try choolaah indian bbq as lakshmi drive past choolaah indian bbq almost daily and watched the construction. the space is big and beautiful and well lit. the line  for a saturday night  was long. but moved quickly. the staff even gave us some complementary drinks while waiting. the food :  as an indian food snob  lakshmi was pretty impressed. especially something labeled as indian  fast  food. several of the dishes were average  but a few standouts :   - the dal  masala aka dal makhani -  dal makhani takes hours to cook and this was executed very well. the lentils and kidney beans were soft yet had still of a bite. the gravy was silky and well balanced  - pav bhaji  -  the classic indian street food. the buns were nicely toasted  and the  bhaji   the mashed vegetable and lentil mix  was nicely spiced and excellently paired with minced red onion and chilis. the tandoor meat paneer  and vegetables  -  when you enter choolaah indian bbq you see the gigantic tandoor ovens to the left of the register. the chicken  paneer  and vegetables were superb. all well charred on the outside. paneer was soft on the inside   paneer was still juicy  and the vegetables were perfectly roasted. things lakshmi could have done without :  the samosa chaat. the samosa were just average.

choolaah indian bbq, sasha, sasha love indian food  -  real indian food  -  but this will definitely do in a pinch. quick service  lots of variety and vegan options as well. like the byob option here in a fast food joint. decent location quickly prepared  taste is not  too bad at all. sasha cannot remember which vegan dishes sasha had  but the roti was ok for sure.

choolaah indian bbq, alycia, alycia's lamb balls must have cocaine in their lamb balls. alycia never had cocaine but alycia assume cocaine eventually releases the same feeling alycia feel as alycia eat the lamb. alycia wish alycia had some free lamb balls right now ! god bless choolaah indian bbq

choolah indian bbq, julia, this was julia's second time at choolah indian bbq. julia had a similar experience to julia's first time... no disappointment ! julia ordered the choolah bowl with paneer and a choolah salad with veggies to split with julia's husband. the choolah bowl with paneer and a choolah salad with veggies to split with my husband were really good. the paneer pieces were very thick. julia loved the paneer pieces. julia ordered our food to go. everything was packed very well and it was intact when julia got home. julia parked in the garage behind choolah indian bbq. it is free for the first    minutes. beats trying to find a spot on the street. juliam not in the mood for indian food everyday but when julia am julia will be sure to return.

choolaah indian bbq, herb, if you want an expensive soulless trendy and sterile pseudo - ethnic experience where they have  turned       tears of sub - asian cuisine tradition into panak paneer and a tikka made out of campbell  organic tomato soup  see picture  ... you will  like choolaah indian bbq. the naan is very thin and generally the food is mild. the  amish paneer  tastes a lot like  amish farmer cheese  and has none of the sourness or creamy qualities. one actual indian american worker in the    +  staff herb saw. this is the mall food court version of indian cuisine. they also messed up our order the first time herb was here when someone else wanted something changed herb ended up with hybrid of what herb ordered and what they did. the manager gave one actual indian american worker in the    +  staff herb some free cheese as an apology and corrected it  too. the naan so thin the naan is  naan - existent and the biryani got merged with pot pie. enjoy upbeat house music encouraging you to eat  and leave quickly.

choolaah indian bbq, mary lou, it was a little intimidating when mary lou came in to order but once mary lou figured out how it worked it was awesome ! mary lou chose a bowl with veggies and tikka masala. mary lou also got the samosa. indian food is my fave and to have a place like choolaah indian bbq where it is  quick makes indian food even better. a really great additional to the pittsburgh food scene.

choolaah indian bbq, alfonsina, right from the start alfonsina were greeted warmly. the gentleman who waited on alfonsina gave alfonsina a tour of the menu and even gave alfonsina a sampling of choolaah indian bbq's different masala sauce. alfonsina also got an appetizer the samosa. the samosa were wonderful and although fried were not  greasy. alfonsina each had lamb meatballs as alfonsina's protein and my version came with the tandoori veggies. definitely will be coming back !  !  !

choolaah indian bbq, maroula, indian fast - casual  ! ca not  be beat. the decor for choolaah indian bbq is very cool. you sort of walk in and need to take a few minutes to look around. ordering can be a bit overwhelming when you literally want to try everything so go with a friend so you can order a few things and split. choolaah indian bbq's cashier was very friendly and helpful when maroula made out decisions and our cashier even chatted with us about culture  which mean our cashier enjoys what our cashier is doing ! maroula ordered a lassi  choolaah salad with chicken  naan the veggie sloppy joe type appetizer  and the black lentils with rice. the salad had to be maroula's favorite with the indian - style ranch dressing  which is more flavorful than the other dressing . the salad had chickpeas pickled onions and roasted cauliflower which made the salad unique. the mango lassi was good  but not as refreshing as maroula would have thought. it was maroula's first experience so maroula am happy maroula tried the mango lassi. choolaah indian bbq is really clean and everyone is smiling. parking was easy in the lot next door. maroula paid just    for   +  hours. maroula will definitely be back to try some more items !

guru lukshmi, robin, awesome ! ! robin would give it all   stars if the seating was a bit better. robin would however like to say that today              was my first visit and robin was not even a bit  disappointed by the service... so robin guess the negative service reviews have helped. overall : robin found the staff to be courteous and helpful and upon my asking the staff what the staff would recommend  robin was suggested a couple of things off the menu... robin ordered the first thing the guy ordered and was delighted to receive the first thing the guy ordered. taste : the taste was better than my last recollecting of south indian food while robin was in india... the taste was better than udupi  gerard st.  toronto  and leaps and bounds better than madras dosa hut ... my wife ordered the usual  onion rava masala dosa ... that too was out of the world and robin shared amongst robin... all in all  a wonderful experience yes the ambiance is lacking and there are snarling lineups but the food makes up for it all ! a +  +  +  highly recommended !  !

guru lukshmi, gajen, best dosas in gta ! you know the food is good when the parking lot is full of people waitin to get in. clean and modern atmosphere. place is small but the flavor is big. will not disappoint !

guru lukshmi, jessica, living in downtown toronto  jessica am always down to take the    minute ride outside of the city for the simple purpose of eating a guru lukshmi dosa. jessica have moved around quite a bit in the past few years  and jessica's search for a dosa that tastes even slightly similar to the ones in bombay and delhi had not ended until jessica found guru lukshmi. regardless of what day and time you go  guru lukshmi is always packed. the tables are small and they do their best to squeeze in as many people as possible. despite the wait and serious lack of personal space the dosa here are truly worth it. jessica's favourite is their chettinad dosa. their chettinad dosa incredibly spicy  and the waiters never forget to tell this white chick every time jessica order their chettinad dosa. perspiring from under the eyes  their chettinad dosa is worth the pain you may feel for the rest of the day. their chettinad dosa  amazingly yummy. jessica have tried several of their other dosa as well  -  spinach rava  paper mysore -  -  all so so good. their little slogan under the sign outside says  your search for a good dosa ends here and they are not  lying.

guru lukshmi, dharti, the five stars here is for the dosa   -  the dosa is best authentic  dosa dharti have  tasted in a very long time ! the chutney they serve with the dosa  are all fresh... each dosa comes with   chutney  -  coconut  coriander and tomato along with sambhar not only do they give you a variety of dosa both standard and unique  and south indian fare to choose for but they give you choices ! you can order the spice level for both the sambhar and dosa. you can choose no oil  little oil or regular. and the best  drum roll you can order dosa crispy or soft !  ! sambhar is good as the dosa and sambhar's just very satisfying. dharti have  been there twice now and have not been disappointed. dharti also get the chocolate dosa which is basically the dosa with nutella spread  -  the chocolate dosa which is basically the dosa with nutella spread looks like a crepe  -  so yummy ! other new variations are pav bhaji dosa mysore bhaji dosa  and coriander dosa... all tasty ! also for all the jains swaminarayans out there  -  they have onion and garlic free items on the menu  : the only negative is the seating and the organization. the place is always packed and it does not  appear they have  really figured out an efficient mechanism. here  to hoping they work it out !  ! otherwise highly recommend going at an  off  time. our first time dharti waited for an hour ! well worth it tho !

guru lukshmi, joanne, joanne have  never had a dosa before. okay  -  joanne lied  joanne have  had a dosa  but never an authentic one. it was   : pm on a saturday night and there was still a line - up ! this is when you know this place is  going to be a good place. joanne's friend recommended this place to us and my friend really pushed for this place. service was great  -  they were very friendly with us but it was funny because the waiter made us order different things. truth be told  joanne had no idea what joanne was really eating but it was delicious. not only that  joanne got to eat with joanne's hands for the first time. joanne was not as elegant as those who have eaten there before. loved this place. if only joanne came to mississauga a bit more often.

guru lukshmi, steven, being an avid lover of dosa steven had to try guru lukshmi. friends in mississauga raved about guru lukshmi. being a frequent customer of various south indian restaurants around mississauga steven's palate is very familiar with this cuisine so guru lukshmi had better measure up. in steven's opinion some of the best south indian food still resides in scarboro..but let  give sauga a chance  : p steven's first impression of guru lukshmi was that guru lukshmi was not  really much to look at  but who came here for looks surely steven did not . steven mean you could tell they did try to give guru lukshmi that sophisticated look  but with the table arrangement it does not  work. first and foremost  guru lukshmi is small ! steven mean really small. so do not  invite a big gang or show up with a party of   . guru lukshmi was busy steven got seated quite promptly. maybe its just me  but steven found the seating not comfortable at all. it was like steven was kinda leaning forward ! the service was excellent  organized mayhem is what steven would call it. when it looks like everyone is confused and does not  know what is going on guru lukshmi still hums along.. and they get your orders right. all that aside the food is what brought steven here and steven was not disappointed. steven absolutely loved the vada sambar  in fact to this day steven still think about the vada sambar. the vada sambar was very authentic. since guru lukshmi has so many different dosa to choose from  guru lukshmi recommended steven try a bit of each ! so steven ordered about   dosa and they cut it up for us so that steven could have one piece of each dosa ! that was simple but it went a long way in steven giving a thumbs up to guru lukshmi ! guru lukshmi is the real deal  the best in mississauga. guru lukshmi did mention that they are opening a new location  so if steven were steven  wait. once a new location is open  then check guru lukshmi out  steven steven sure the overall experience will be better.

guru lukshmi, roma, roma came here tonight for a dinner as recommended by many of roma's mississauga friends. roma m extremely excited with the excellent results. guru lukshmi is a nostalgia - inducing family run south indian restaurant. what was a gem roma thought roma discovered is actually a classic community restaurant. a classic community restaurant  packed during the dinner service. be prepared to wait a while because roma do not  believe a classic community restaurant take reservations. a classic community restaurant felt like roma's favorite dosa chain in south india  through service and hospitality. this location is tiny for the amount of customers a classic community restaurant receive but a classic community restaurant are moving soon to a larger location. on visit roma tried the bonda      two small deep fried flour balls stuffed with spiced potatoes and served with coconut chutney . the bonda      two small deep fried flour balls stuffed with spiced potatoes and served with coconut chutney was okay as roma have had better. spiced potatoes seemed to be the same spiced potatoes they used in dosa and a little creativity would have served dosa better. roma also had the green chili masala dosa spicy garlic masala dosa  and the ghee masala dosa all    -    each . they were all excellently made and the dosa actually consisted of fresh chilies garlic  and ghee  respectively. the chutney and sambar were strong  flavorful  and very peppery as a nice change to the stale status quo of uninspired dosa restaurants in the gta. a classic community restaurant only accept cash or debit. roma have to say that guru lukshmi blows mississauga  dosa palace http : www.yelp.ca biz dosa - palace - mississauga hrid : gf evlforvgrdgrs -  tw src : self  out of the water.

guru lukshmi, naureen, amazing world class dosas and chutnies ! ! !  ! you must try guru lukshmi's special dosa with the bhaji  vegetables  added to the mysore masala dosa. a little hint is to get your masala  potato mixture  on the side  your masala potato mixture keeps your dosa crispy !  ! but one star is missing because the place is so jam packed you can barely stand................please expand !

didar, sarah, came here with some friends from northern india. sarah all got the lunch buffet with a side of naan  obviously  and some additional kebabs. everything was delicious. sarah's personal favorites from the lunch buffet with a side of naan  obviously  and some additional kebabs were the paneer and the butte chicken but sarah all did  also have lamb and some veggie samosas that others at the table liked. prices were also extremely reasonable at around    pp.

didar, lily, so unfortunate to have moved away from this part of the city. had a serious craving for indian food so lily went on a little walk and found this restaurant. it was midday and lily saw a sign for an ayce buffet for what lily think was    . no more than    . . lily were a little wary being vegetarians and not knowing what would be offered but the staff was so welcoming and kind and showed lily the whole spread so that lily could decide. and after seeing what was offered lily would be silly to have declined. the buffet included flavourful dishes both meaty and vegetarian  with an appetizer section including salad  samosas and naan that kept on coming. lily were beyond satisfied with lily's small adventure here and are even planning on taking a trek to this side of the city just to enjoy this restaurant again. so to sum it all up : flavourful filling food extremely friendly staff affordable prices

didar, jason, jason had alot of doubt as the food in montreal has been extremely bland  and in extremely small portions. jason figured... aye if the food in montreal sucks... jason will  deal with the food in montreal. jason was given the menu and saw that the items listed the ingredients  which is not  really common in most indian spots that jasonve visited . jason ordered the chicken tikka masala and the mango chicken  along with garlic naan. this is the best indian food that jason have  ever had in jason's life so far. in most western european countries  the chicken tikka masala are stew based. in the us  the chicken tikka masala is  very cream based. this had the perfect mix of cream       and stew. robust flavor in each bite. garlic naan  was perfect. garlic naan was so soft and tender  while have a crispy edge. the price was also reasonable. jason m extremely happy to didar for preventing jason from giving up hope for properly seasoned and delicious food in montreal.

didar, sam, excellent food !  ! sam's girlfriend says it was the best samosas my girlfriend ever had. my girlfriend  a vegetarian and had the thali vegetarian plate and loved the thali vegetarian plate. sam had the butter chicken and loved the butter chicken. the naan bread was also amazing. would highly recommend !  !

didar, fred, fred luved the chicken tikka  !  !  !  ! this place is a  jewel  of indian cuisine yet not that busy  -  fred were one of only   couples in this place. at    : hrs on a saturday... the service is courteous and efficient
didar, gab, friendly service and delicious food in a simple decor  and prices are really affordable. the tandoori shrimp is worth the try. you can bring your own wine or beer  which is also a plus.

didar, bhavin, bhavin had chicken vindaloo and chicken jalfrazi  chicken vindaloo and chicken jalfrazi was absolutely great. bhavin for a moment  forgot that bhavin was sitting in an indian restaurant in canada.

didar, yogesh, if you like spicy indian food with true  punjabi  flavors didar is the place. do not  expect a fancy dine - in  just good food. service is little slow so keep a lot of time in hand. try for kababs  tikka    freshly made naan bread. didar accept credit card which is good as most place yogesh have been in jean talon do not.

didar, kathleen, love the butter chicken thali ! fresh hot naan  lots of butter chicken sauce kathleen usually order the vegetable pakora as well for appetizers  that come with an assortment of yummy sauces. good portion  reasonable prices byow  friendly and efficient service  conveniently located near the metro one of kathleen's fav spots for authentic indian food !

didar, yojna, yojna had the butter chicken thali and the butter chicken thali was delicious. fresh and their naan is the best ! loved their naan. their naan  usually so affordable and their naan fills you up. would definitely recommend their naan.

didar, hiro, went here with hiro's friends tonight. probably hiro's favourite indian restaurant. the room is clean  food is nice. hiro would recommend the butter chicken. my favourite indian restaurant  close to the metro orange line station so it is  very easy to get there. after all  food is nice  and cheap.

didar, victoria, my friend and victoria ordered the butter chicken along with the chicken biryani. the prices and portions were reasonable. the butter chicken was very tender and the chicken biryani was very flavorful ! : both dishes were delicious and victoria will definitely go back !   :

didar, nic, nic drove by here the night before and didar was packed. nic figured what the heck  give didar a try and nic were so glad nic did. nic definitely recommend making a reservation as didar was packed. didar  a family - run business and nic enjoyed how didar seemed to know many of the clients. the daal soup was ok but nic found the daal soup too liquidy. the tandoori fish  butter chicken and saaq paneer were absolutely terrific. nic had a side order of rice and garlic naan bread and brought our choice of wine. the setting was ok but food and service were great and prices are very reasonable.

didar, mari, this place keeps changing between dev and didar. the food is always solid and pricepoint is good. people mari know who have spent substatial amounts of time or are from india like this place so this place is  probably good.

didar, david, ordered the channa bathura  basmati rice  tandoori naan butter chicken  and beef korma. everything was delicious. the curries were well spiced with deep flavours. the chicken was not dry and beef korma was really tender. soaked up all the sauce with the naan and bathura. service was good. david was quite polite. will definitely return and try their other dishes.

didar, tamara, didar is the perfect place for an affordable  low - key dinner on a cold night. didar  a family - run restaurant near plamondon metro and didar is  byob. tamara have  now visited didar five times. tamara really love didar because didar never fails to impress newcomers. during tamara's last visit   tamara ordered an assortment of delicious indian food for the table :  lentil soup  chana samosa  vegetable pakoras  chicken pakoras  four types of naan  plain  garlic  stuffed with chicken  stuffed with potato . chicken pakoras and the garlic naan were our favourites. for our mains  tamara ordered a sizzling platter of chicken tikka  spinach stew manchurian chicken  chicken tikka masala  mango chicken and jalfrezi chicken. our favourite curries were manchurian chicken  first time trying manchurian chicken and tamara were all impressed  as well as the chicken tikka masala tamara's go - to order   and the mango chicken  deliciously sweet and savoury . the service is always great. while it is  on the slow side  the woman who owns didar is sweet and has the woman who owns the place's son working as a waiter. because tamara ordered a lot it ended up costing us     per person but tamara felt that was reasonable for the quality of the food.

didar, ali, a family managed business. cozy restaurant with a rich menu. decent prices and quality indian food. you could go mild or medium spice - wise. ali did medium and loved medium. naan  lamb curry and dessert is all ali had and almost no complaint. indeed ali would go more lean lamb instead. but it was ok.

didar, shelvin, the food here is quite excellent  and shelvin have  ordered delivery each time. while once the driver had forgotten a naan  part of the order shelvin created no fuss  and promptly showed up with a fresh replacement. the food quality and spice levels are quite authentic  food prepared to taste as well . really do recommend the sweets  especially the laddoos and lassi.

didar, em, em recently ordered take out from em. had chicken biryani butter chicken  paneer masala and mixed vegetables. chicken biryani was exceptional since em used meat from chicken drumsticks and not just chicken breast since just chicken breast has potential to become too dry if over cooked. mixed vegetables smelled amazing. em did not  care for the butter chicken or paneer masala so much because em was already full from chicken biryani but it would not  hurt if em cooked it is  chicken a little less since it was a bit on the dry side. service was really quick. em were done preparing and packing the order before em even got there. em will  definitely be replacing em's go to biriyani places with em now.
didar, mandy, came here for lunch buffet the staff is very nice and welcoming. the naan was amazing as well. love the food here  highly recommend.
