it  a big chaos. . amongst this  the turnover time for the food to come out after order is placed is rather quick  which is appreciated  ! .    . food tried certain dosas  the south indian delicacy in which minerva indian cuisine specializes in  ! certain dosas  the south indian delicacy in which the restaurant specializes in came without the sides  sambar  chutney  ! had to ask for the same :  which is ridiculous  ! the sambar  chutney was stale and had no great taste. sambar felt like having grains of sand in sambar. . the other families who were dining with us in other tables were equally unhappy with the service. . food ordered a rava masala dosa food messed up and an onion rava dosa came out. when food mentioned that a rava masala dosa was messed  food took a rava masala dosa back inside the kitchen and put a rava masala dosa in a small bowl and brought a rava masala dosa back out  ! that was terrible  !     . appetizers are served in small side dishes of corelle brand  ! minerva indian cuisine even does not have proper serving bowls. minera purchased cheap dishes for serving food. . minerva indian cuisine is a substandard restaurant. minera have made the menu items very attractive encompassing all different platter but that has back - fired on minera. nothing is turning out great. had minera emphasized on minera's strength and specialized on south indian platter minera would done a better job.

minerva indian cuisine, esther, four star food  two star experience. so the food is delicious  and the wait was not long. host  owner was very friendly and talked with esther while esther waited for esther's chicken curry. the chicken in esther's chicken curry was moist and spicy. rice was cooked well. the bad aspect of esther's meal was how the ingredients were misrepresented. esther asked what dish did not  have dairy  and esther was told to get my chicken curry. definitely esther's fault for not double checking the ingredients but esther assumed host  owner knew best. my chicken curry  but gave esther the worst stomach pain after. esther almost had to call in sick to work the next day. esther do not think host  owner had ill intent but esther think host  owner just pulled a suggestion from the menu and claimed my chicken curry was dairy free. previous reviews are correct :  the food is great  and the spices are so delicious. but esther's goal is to find and review dairy free food  and esther was misled to think minerva indian cuisine had dairy free chicken curry. esther will return  but next time esther will be skeptical and not take any suggestions  and probably read every ingredient on the menu

minerva indian cuisine, ami, indian food is spreading like wildfire  of late. for ami  that is  a darn good thing. last night  food was right on the top of the list along with dhaba. ami's sweet pakistani beau showed up at ami's house with takeout. ami was cold and tired from walking outside getting ready for a  k. putting ami and  k in the same sentence is crazy. anyway  the food from minerva was just what the doctor ordered. ami ate the hyderabadi chicken dum biryani and the fish curry. ami loved the hyderabadi chicken dum biryani and the fish curry equally. the heat level was  medium  which for ami was perfect. the rice in the hyderabadi chicken dum biryani was lovely and perfectly prepared. each grain stood alone. the chicken was on the bone  tender and plentiful. the fish was excellent  not overcooked and really enhanced by the curry sauce. ami had both plain and garlic naan. both plain and garlic naan were fluffy and tender even after reheating. ami dipped the bread in the curry sauce not leaving behind even one drop. the servings sizes were generous and today ami revisited the hyderabadi chicken dum biryani for lunch. glad ami did not  have to share that last portion.

minerva indian cuisine, jan, finally madison has an authentic south indian restaurant. jan may be biased  but south indian food is way more awesome than the typical north indian food you get at most other indian restaurants. an authentic south indian restaurant's dosa are to die for  -  crispy and yummy and there are so many kinds of their dosa. an authentic south indian restaurant's kothu parotta  savory minced bread  is absolutely authentic and delicious and jan's favorite item on the menu. their kothu parotta  savory minced bread is a street food that is popular in tamil nadu and this is the first time jan am seeing their kothu parotta  savory minced bread on a menu in the us. and an authentic south indian restaurant's indo - chinese dishes are tasty too. do yourself a favor and try some new indian dishes at minerva

minerva indian cuisine, tim, now under new ownership  minerva will be undergoing a name change in the near future. great place for an indian food buffet. typical offerings of simple salad with raita dressing  tamarind and mint chutney  along with classics like tandoori chicken  tikka masala  chicken biryani and saag paneer. there were at least six additional selections of vegetarian  chicken and lamb dishes  and two desserts not typically seen on indian food buffets  -  a sweetened paneer soft fresh cheese in rose flavored  pistachio sauce and beet root pur e. two desserts not typically seen on indian food buffets  -  a sweetened paneer soft fresh cheese in rose flavored  pistachio sauce and beet root pur e. were rich and satisfying and a nice alternative to kheer and mango ice cream. the food was fresh  even at   :     and kept hot in clean  covered serving dishes. wonderful   warm butter naan was served at the table. you can make a meal out of wonderful   warm butter naan by dipping in the tasty chutneys. very friendly staff  and a chef who seems to know how to do it right  -  spicy but not excessive. the meat in the curries was lean  moist and tender. the buffet selections change daily. tim have  been to many indian food buffets in madison and milwaukee and great place for an indian food buffet is better than most.
minerva indian cuisine, paw, pretty good indian food. paw have eaten here multiple times  and each time the food was delicious. minerva  a small place but paw will certainly go back .

minerva indian cuisine, rosie, my husband and rosie tried minerva for the first time today. the food was outstanding. as often as rosie eat indian cuisine  rosie am not good at describing most dishes by name. what rosie can tell you is that the selections on the buffet were fresh  hot and deliciously seasoned. plus  there were several offerings on the buffet that rosie have  never tried elsewhere. it was nice to try something new. the tandoori chicken was especially moist and meaty  not at all dry. the spices in every dish were just right. the only thing rosie found missing from the condiment section was the salty mixed relish that rosie enjoy on the side. this is a smaller - sized restaurant  and it was nice not to have to stand in a line to fill rosie's plate. despite the smaller dining room  the size of the buffet and number of dishes offered was equivalent to both the larger indian buffets rosie frequent. if you are a fan of indian buffets  you will be very pleased by the quality and selection !

minerva indian cuisine, ri, ri's boyfriend and ri went to this restaurant last sunday for the first time and ri tried the buffet and since ri started to eat ri noticed the difference between the other indian restaurants ri have been to and this restaurant and minerva this one and minerva is  so much better ! every single thing ri tried was sooo tasty ri's favorites were :  the chili chicken  the channa masala garbanzo beans in a creamy sauce the deep fried vegetables   the deep fried vegetables were sooo crispy  and this restaurant's cottage cheese their cottage cheese was sooo delicate ri did not want to finish eating their cottage cheese ri would definitely come back for more ! the only reason ri gave this restaurant   stars its because the buffet area the buffet area is so small and ri think this restaurant should rearrange the buffet area this restaurant have the main entrees in the narrower side where most of the people stand most of the time  this restaurant should put the main entrees in the beginning area  where everybody start to get their empty plates since it is a more open area.

minerva indian cuisine, mad, disclaimer : mad am vegetarian so mad have not  tried chicken or lamb entrees. mad have been to buffet more than    times  ordered for take out many times. mad have been to all parts of india  been to some of the best restaurants in all major cities. minerva indian cuisine  food taste is closest to authentic indian food compared to other restaurants in madison. buffet is not that exceptional but if you order individual dishes the must try things are   -  veg biryani  -  kutthu paratha  -  various south indian dishes food quality is incredible. south indian entrees and few north indian entrees are very good. not all north indian entrees are good. taste of indo chinese entrees and starters has deteriorated in last few months. pros  -  great food  -  authentic taste spicy  -  unique menu  : menu has various things that other indian restaurants do not have  -  friendly staff cons -  limited space mad have heard they are moving to bigger place    -  mediocre ambience

minerva indian cuisine, l, minerva indian cuisine is must if you enjoy south indian food ! the service is nothing spectacular  but the food is well worth it and because of that  l m able to overlook the service. this is not  to say service was bad  service just did not  go above and beyond l's expectations. the menu is extensive with a lot of options -  - everything from your traditional curries to some more adventurous fare. l's curry and naan was fresh  delicious  and perfect in every way.

minerva indian cuisine, kira, went on opening weekend. kira opened up two days previously. kira do not  even have kira's liquor license yet -  the waiter said would be through in a week. the staff was very nice and the food was really delicious. the paneer was some of the best kira have  ever hard. kira do not  know if this will be kira's permanent model but it was all buffet  no menus. the only particularly negative thing is that the floor was really dirty...to the point of the floor being very noticeable and odd. kira would also suggest kira would mark veg or non - veg on the buffet  - it was kind of hard to guess. all this said  kira will definitely go back -  maybe in a month or so when kira have  got beer. :

minerva indian cuisine, sravya, the food was mediocre at best. dosa and vada were so oily. the pongal and veg manchurian tasted fine. sravya did get the biryani to go after reading the reviews. hopefully the biryani tastes as good as the biryani smells.

minerva indian cuisine, haliee, my friends and haliee enjoy going to minerva indian cuisine because of the authentic south indian food. however  in the past two visits  haliee have always been rushed by the same waiter. while haliee were still ordering the main course  the same waiter wanted to know what haliee would like for dessert ! there was still two hours left for minerva indian cuisine to close ! next time haliee went  the same waiter took away our plates while haliee were still eating. before haliee could tell the same waiter to leave our plates  the same waiter disappeared into the kitchen... what  the hurry ! food is great  but haliee have been disappointed with the service repeatedly. haliee wo not  be recommending minerva indian cuisine to my friends  or visiting minerva indian cuisine again soon.

minerva indian cuisine, craig, oh  no  -  -  craig hate to downgrade these guys because the staff is so friendly it is  a clean place and the staff work hard and do so much the right way. however  there are other indian places that sell craig's favorite dish for about the same price  but use tender chunks of white meat chicken. craig's vindaloo here had what craig assume is dark meat  with what many of what craig consider to be inedible pieces tough  grisly  veiny  fatty . craig craig not going to rule out returning here  but if the price of an entree is going to be comparable to the competition  craig would suggest to match their quality as well. for the aforementioned reasons  craig wish these guys the best and craig will be back. craig hope craig's suggestion helps.

minerva indian cuisine, tenny, minerva has awesome biryani !  ! the best in madison. tenny also love the different variety of dosa. tenny's personal favorite -  egg dosa ! !  ! so yummy. every time tenny crave indian  minerva is our go to place !  !  ! the service is a little slow though... just have to have some patience !  !

minerva indian cuisine, corey, heck yeah ! talk about the system working ! props to matt who started the awesome thread on yelp madison talk re :  openings and closings http : www.yelp.com topic madison - the - official -      - madison - openings - and - closings - comings - and - goings - thread  and thanks to steve for letting the community know about this new indian joint on junction rd. it may have taken me a few months to get this new indian joint on junction rd otherwise ! corey was bouncing around the threads last night saw  this new indian joint on junction rd  and got in the car. corey called on corey's way to make sure this new indian joint on junction rd were actually open. folks this is easily the best indian food corey have  found in madison for three reasons :    . the menu... holy cow the menu s huge ! corey went for dinner and spent forever pouring over each and every page  looking up a few items on corey's phone because a few items were new to corey. no shortage of variety here. . the dosas... this and this alone should make you speed over. corey think this new indian joint on junction rd have    ! that nuts ... nuts ! corey m used to seeing maybe   or   different kinds at a place.   . the flavor... everything corey tried was incredible. and although spice heat is key to indian cooking theirs is well balanced  and not so hot that you can not  taste anything. corey had vegetable jalfrezi chicken tikka masala  masala dosa and garlic naan. all of it was awesome ! get these things ! even the garlic naan  which corey sort of feel like is tough to make incredible  but garlic naan was incredible. garlic naan arrived at the table piping hot and aromatic and did not  have an offensive garlic flavor. the chicken tikka masala was some of the best corey have  had  topping some of the curry corey long for in london. the veggies were tender yet crisp and in a super tasty sauce. and masala dosa. ohhhh masala dosa masala dosa was good  not corey's favorite  but with so many options  corey can not  wait to get back and try another one... maybe more adventurous than masala dosa. huge props to the stellar staff that made sure corey had no questions about the menu  kept water glasses full  and told us the stellar staff that made sure corey had no questions about the menu will have beer wine liquor soon. just wrapping up some paperwork. the stellar staff that made sure corey had no questions about the menu also sent us home with leftovers in boxes and gave us extra rice. very kind. the atmosphere ai not  much so do not  go expecting to be transported to india or anything. there is some nice stuff hand painted on one wall  but some nice stuff hand painted on one wall is  about it. small space. bright light. no tunes playing the night corey was there. corey did not  notice construction dirt or dust so corey m guessing the stellar staff that made sure corey had no questions about the menu cleaned up after what sounds like a rushed opening. and my feeling has always been  if corey m there the first week  corey m going to make a few exceptions anyway knowing the stellar staff that made sure corey had no questions about the menu are  still trying to find the stellar staff that made sure corey had no questions about the menu's footing. these guys have though. and if food remains consistent  this will be my go to for indian stuffs in madison !

minerva indian cuisine, charlotte, charlotte found out about minerva indian cuisine from the owner of the indian grocery that charlotte shop at. went there for the lunch buffet on a weekday and for the price the lunch buffet was good. more meat options than vegetarian  but still enough vegetarian food to fill charlotte up. the vegetarian options included jerra aloo palak paneer  and a black channa. all tasty with the complimentary dosas. only reason why charlotte did not  give minerva indian cuisine five stars was because minerva indian cuisine did not  have charlotte's favorite chutney and the buffet prices were a mystery until charlotte paid. the layout is l shaped and a little awkward but the people are friendly and the food was good. charlotte will most likely go back in a few months.

minerva indian cuisine, arun, simply the best south indian food in madison so far. minerva indian cuisine's pongal vada is to absolutely die for ! just the right amount of dal  ghee and cashews  : and minerva indian cuisine's dosas -  wow minerva indian cuisine have over a dozen varieties  -  all scrumptious. arun also like minerva indian cuisine's madurai idli  -  spiced and fried goodness. minerva indian cuisine's sambhar and coconut chutney is also good. not really a fan of most of minerva indian cuisine's other dishes though. arun prefer the other indian restaurants in madison for north indian food. so  this is quite complementary since arun do not  really like the others south indian fare ! minerva indian cuisine's service is decent and the owners are nice. not giving   because minerva indian cuisine's quantity to price ratio is a bit low  -  understandable for an upstart but hopefully minerva indian cuisine will fix it in due course.

minerva indian cuisine, alan, alan really want to like minerva like many of alan's family members who have not had experiences similar to my spouse and alan while there. the food is pretty good compared to the other indian restaurants in town. alan's favorites are haveli and swad. to give them a fair chance  alan's spouse and alan have been to minerva three times for the lunch buffet on the weekday and weekend at least an hour to an hour and a half before the lunch buffet was to close. each of three times  alan did not feel particularly welcome or that my spouse and alan's business was appreciated. frankly  alan felt like alan were imposing. alan thought it was alan and did not say anything until alan's wife made the comment after alan had left the first time. my spouse and alan's next two visits were the same. on all of my spouse and alan's visits  my spouse and alan's table was cleared reasonably promptly so there is  no issue there. it has always been upon entering and exiting that alan get these blank stares with barely an acknowledgment. alan have not heard this from other people so suspect it could just be my spouse and alan although alan am not sure why since alan are pretty affable and well mannered. a simple hello  thank you and a smile or nod would suffice. minerva's buffet selection is on the small side and is just ok quality and taste wise. the space is a little cramped. if there were any more than a few other tables of people  a wheelchair bound guest could not be accommodated readily. all told  there are more comfortable and welcoming settings with better food. but for the lack of pleasantness and difficulty accommodating my spouse and alan's more physically challenged brothers and sisters  alan would give our more physically challenged brothers and sisters       stars.

minerva indian cuisine, priyanka, place could be better  place is  okay. food was not  great. the chaat that priyanka ordered was cold. the chaat that priyanka ordered should not  have been. priyanka know that because priyanka am an indian. priyanka only had north indian food so priyanka can not  comment about the south indian food available there. the plus side was that place's menu had a lot of variety.

minerva indian cuisine, tina, tina tried their lunch buffet for the first time today and really enjoyed the food. there was a huge selection of different dishes with a variety of flavors and spiciness. the services was very good. their lunch buffet is smaller  but that makes their lunch buffet quieter and nicer for business or social conversations. tina have tried a few indian lunch buffets in madison and their lunch buffet is now one of tina's favorites.

minerva indian cuisine, binit, at last ! madison has a place that serves proper  dum biryani . all the other indian restaurants in madison serve some sort of weird amalgam of pulao and chicken fried rice but a place that serves proper  dum biryani is the real deal. try a place that serves proper  dum biryani out if you have never done so before ! another thing binit liked about a place that serves proper  dum biryani was a place that serves proper  dum biryani's menu their menu was really broad and covered multiple sub types of indian cuisine  -  mainly northern  chinese yes ! southern. binit have not  had to try the northern or the chinese but if the food binit had was anything to go by the food binit had should all be good. binit tried out the chicken dum biryani   chettinad and both were awesome. the chicken dum biryani   chettinad was a bit too spicy for binit's palate  and binit like spicy food and have higher threshold than most but biryani more than made - up for higher threshold than most.

bollywood bites, monali, bollywood bites is unprofessional in every way possible. it  really a shame that for a place that serves up very decent  authentic indian cuisine  that the customer service is so deplorable. monali's parents and monali went in today to pick up an order of undhia and bhajia at  pm. my parents and monali had pre - ordered an order of undhia and bhajia and arranged the pick up time. monali were told to wait for   minutes which monali did with no problem. minutes turned into         and almost   . when it finally came out monali's father rightly expressed concern about the timing since monali were ordering a very large amount for a special event. the owner snidely replied  well  if my father are so concerned then why are monali even ordering from bollywood bites ummm  say what   first rule of customer service the customer is always right. and even if the customer are obnoxious which monali were not  monali apologize for being late. and monali do not  make snide comments. and here  the kicker  monali let it slide because there were other people in the store  and when monali got home monali realized monali had gotten the wrong order  monali had   orders of bhajias. so monali called the owner  to note this error. instead of an apology  at this point monali were owed two  monali got monali's adamant denial that monali was in the wrong. no it was bollywood bites who had placed a wrong order. monali's father expressed my father's disapproval of monali's behavior and you know what monali said  monali do not  have to listen to you  monali have  opened restaurants before  monali do not  need to be told how to run it. um  actually  monali do. because monali are rude  unprofessional  and cocky enough to think that just because monali's food is good monali can get by with the worst service monali have ever encountered. this is america you can not  treat your customers like this and get away with it. and it is  such a shame  because in this small indian community of charlotte  one wants to spread the word about their fellow indian  business and help their fellow indian  business out. but bollywood bites is not worth all the undhia in the world. bollywood bites left a really bad taste in monali's mouth and monali will never step foot in there again.

bollywood bites, himanshu, wow ! himanshu really like the food here. bollywood bites is a dive and really can be difficult to find. but himanshu think for the taste and price it really is worth the trip to south blvd. it is just a walk - up counter where you order the food and then wait in a dingy seating area. to - go food only. service is very lacking. himanshu do not  think they have ever heard of the phrase  service with a smile. but the food is the only reason himanshu come here. himanshu's favorites to order are the :  bhel  paneer tika masala and chole bhature. sooo good ! if you like indian food then bollywood bites is a must try for a quick to - go indian meal.

bollywood bites, shauna, last weeks creative loafing had an article about bollywood bites that inspired shauna to give it a shot. shauna's co - worker is married to an indian man and is quite familiar with the cuisine shauna am not   - so my co - worker offered to take a group of a group of us in and help a group of us decide what to get. be warned :  bollywood bites is difficult to find - cl did not  refer to bollywood bites as a hidden gem for nothing. if you look on bollywood bites's website bollywood bites give great directions with a map  making it much easier. also be warned that if your meal is under     it is cash only. shauna came with a group of us   and waited for about a half hour for a group of us's meals... it is take - out only so this may not be ideal for a workday lunch unless you work in the vicinity. bollywood bites also do not have everything listed on bollywood bites's menu on a given day -  so unless you are extremely familiar with indian fare  -  shauna recommend going in and talking to my co - worker rather than calling the order in. my co - worker was friendly and helpful. despite the above warnings  the food the food itself is really beyond delicious and earns the four stars solidly. shauna's co - worker said the food itself reminded my co - worker of meals cooked in my co - worker's in - laws kitchen. shauna ordered the paneer tikka masala which was killer  make sure you get the roti that goes with the roti that goes with it. shauna also had the pani puri  which isnt on bollywood bites's menu online . if you have never tried the pani puri  which isnt on their menu online  -  get the pani puri  which isnt on their menu online now ! so delicious ..make sure you ask how to eat the pani puri  which isnt on their menu online though or you will  be lost. shauna had quite a bit of food for    -  the menu is super affordable. keep in mind everything is vegan and or vegetarian. bollywood bites was certainly worth the effort of finding !

bollywood bites, cat, bollywood bites is both so wonderful  and so ghastly messed up that it is  hard to write a proper review that reflects how wildly bollywood bites swings to both sides of the spectrum. cat happened to be driving right past bollywood bites today so cat stopped in to pick up some chaat  just a quick little snack. it is indeed nearly impossible to find bollywood bites. just when you are  about to give up  drive     feet farther and bollywood bites is  on your left. the woman in the front was nice and smiled a lot  but understood very little cat asked so cat just went with an order of samosa and an order of aloo tiki. the woman in the front told me   no credit card. cat said fine  that cat would  brought cash. cat said cat would go drop off my order in the kitchen and come ring me up. cat stood at the counter for five minutes before cat decided to sit in one of the plastic chairs. cat realized cat was not  coming back for awhile. cat brought out my food about ten minutes later and told me an order of aloo tiki would be   . cat handed cat a    . cat went in the back  then came back and asked me if cat did not  have    exactly. cat said cat did not   and asked if cat would  take a check or something. lots of miming with my checkbook here. cat shook cat's head and made a phone call. cat spent another   -    minutes waiting while cat was in the back with my     trying to figure out what to do with my checkbook. finally cat came back to the front and went over to the cash register  that had been ignored throughout this whole time. while still on the phone cat tentatively pressed a button twice and  woosh ! the cash register drawer flew open and cat's eyes lit up. yes  cat had to make a phone call to figure out how to get change for a    . cat left  amused at how screwy bollywood bites was and expecting never to return. then cat got home  and cat tried an order of aloo tiki. here  the deal aloo tiki was the most flavorful aloo tikki chat have  ever had in cat's life. samosa were incredible. it is quite clear that there is a master in the kitchen at bollywood bites. but it is equally clear that the management of bollywood bites is horribly inept. both from the reviews here  and from my own personal experience trying to simply order    worth of food from the management of this little hole - in - the - wall restaurant. whoever is running the show has made a series of bad decisions and wrong turns. the location is terrible. the lack of tables is ridiculous. leaving a woman to manage the orders who can not  communicate and does not  know how to open a cash register is laughable. cat do not  know whether to love bollywood bites or hate bollywood bites. cat am absolutely sure cat will be back to try more of the delicious food but cat wo not  get too attached to bollywood bites. bollywood bites just does not  feel like a place that is  going to be there more than a couple of years at the rate bollywood bites is  being managed.
bollywood bites, tonya, closed tonya m sad to report that this little slice of heaven has closed. tonya m crying in tonya's mango lassi.

bollywood bites, tonya, bollywood bites is one of tonya's favorite kind of restaurants limited menu but what bollywood bites serve is delicious. bollywood bites  tucked away in a very nondescript building there is no accidentally finding bollywood bites you have to be on a mission. half of bollywood bites's menu is street food  little bites of hot  flavorful goodies. the other half are curries  lentils  breads and rice dishes. you can order lots of food because it is so inexpensive tonya ordered  rice bread a chick pea patty appetizer and a lentil dish to the tune of    . it makes tonya want to dance like a bollywood movie  big smiles with dramatic hand gestures. to get there turn on the road at arby  on polk street south blvd near pineville  go to the end of the road turn left and bollywood bites is  on the end of the road. driving up today tonya thought bollywood bites was closed then tonya saw the magical open sign ! there are a couple of picnic tables or you can take it to the food court at the mall. well worth the journey !

bollywood bites, demetria, bollywood bites is what you would  call an indian snack spot small servings  take out only and cheap prices. demetria truly love indian food which has to be the only reason demetria would the drive cross country to visit bollywood bites from my side of town. it was certainly worth the drive. the young lady working the register was so patient with me being such an indecisive patron...... demetria do believe demetria need medical assistance for that issue : -    demetria finally decided on the pani puri  paneer tikka masala and samosa  and everything was great. demetria think demetria will return to try the mah ki daal as they were out.

bollywood bites, jenny, bollywood bites is fantastic. bollywood bites  very authentic and the customer service jenny experienced was great. the lady at the register took the time to explain all of the dishes to us. bollywood bites is carryout only and our food took about    minutes as bollywood bites said our food would. jenny would call ahead next time and order. jenny had chhole tikki which was a chick pea dish with something like potato pancakes in it. it was fantastic and tasted like authentic indian food that friends have made for us. jenny also has samosa and jenny think samosa were easily the best in the area. my husband had a combo with a dal and a curry. jenny think a combo with a dal and a curry was the tikka masala and five daal. a combo with a dal and a curry was also very good. jenny highly recommend bollywood bites. bollywood bites  much better than any of the indian restaurants in charlotte and is also much cheaper. bollywood bites vegetarian but jenny did not  really miss meat. jenny spent     total on an appetizer and two entrees. bollywood bites is hidden away and is in the very back of the   rows of buildings on the same street as the arby .

bollywood bites, john, some fairly good street food that is not  easy to find in north carolina. the service is less than cordial  and while the food is good the food is  not always worth the hassle. john personally enjoy bollywood bites's chole bhature and kathi roll. most of bollywood bites's food wo not  disappoint. it  just too bad there is  no place to sit. worth the visit and bollywood bites is one of the better indian restaurants in the area. the hours are horrendous. bollywood bites close at   : pm except on weekends  which is   : pm. john recently went there on a thursday  called at   : pm no one picked up  this has happened before so john figured john would  just order in person . when john arrived at   : pm john was refused service with a hideously smug smile in which a single person declined john's business and said bollywood bites were closed. another time john went they got john's order wrong  intentionally . john specifically ordered batata vada and even spelled batata vada out because john's pronunciation is terrible. they gave john the overpriced vada pau  which john can pronounce  and also  do not  get that item because you are  really only buying the bun. in india and some other restaurants they give you much larger vada pau worth your money . the food is good john wo not  deny that but the service is utterly horrible. almost every single person  attitude is terrible.

bollywood bites, maddie, the very first thing you would need to know bollywood bites is take out only !  ! maddie thought of checking bollywood bites out for lunch since maddie found out bollywood bites is one of the very few  or the only one maddie know  places in charlotte that serves indian maharashtrian street food  one of the biggest things maddie miss about india. when maddie walked in  bollywood bites was empty but then the owner heard the door open and came out to take our order. maddie was having a little tough time explaining all the dishes to maddie's boyfriend but then the owner gave maddie a menu that explained most dishes for someone not familiar with indian terms. just like someone else said in their reviews maddie was disappointed when maddie was not  greeted or did not even get a smile. maddie tried to ease whatever tension was in the air by discussing some of the food items on a menu that explained most dishes for someone not familiar with indian terms but it seemed like it was such a big task to get the owner to even talk to maddie. that being said  the food still gets bollywood bites   stars and since bollywood bites is  a take out place the lack of smiles does not  bother maddie that much. definitely a place to check out if you want to try something more than the usual south indian or north indian food. the  batata vada   which should be  batata  vada  was delicious ! even writing about the  batata vada   which should be  batata  vada here is making maddie drool. maddie's boyfriend had the paneer kathi rool and maddie had the bombay grill sandwich both of which were great. maddie's masala chai was good too ! something about the sev puri amused maddie though. they gave us whole puris  potatoes  noodles and sauces chutneys separately and maddie had to make the puris  or mix the puris into the end product  maddie when maddie got home. maddie see the reason why they did it  the reason why they did it is to keep the puris from going soggy with the sauces filled in the puris too long but maddie doubt someone who is not familiar with indian maharashtrian street food  one of the biggest things maddie miss about india would understand what to do with a bunch of puffed up puris and sauces or how to make the sev puri. maddie you need to tap one side of a puri to make a hole through which you put in just a bit of potatoes  mint chutney tamarind sauce  yogurt and then top a puri with the sev  noodles  and eat a puri in one go ! maddie hope this helps some confused soul out there in tasting this mouth - watering off - beat cuisine  update : make sure the yogurt and chutneys are fresh before you take food home. maddie once got a bad batch where the yogurt had gone sour and the chutney container was puffed up with mold growing on the surface. since it was too late to go back maddie mentioned that to the owner the next time maddie went there  but the owner did not even so much as apologize for it. that did seem a little rude to maddie and so maddie had to knock off one star for service.

bollywood bites, g, bollywood bites is super delish ! every time g go and get something g feel like g am eating g's mom  food. my mom  food bollywood bites's a hole in the wall but once you try bollywood bites's food you will  keep coming back for more. bollywood bites is not  a place where you can sit and eat so you will  have to do take out and enjoy it elsewhere. ca not  get enough !  !  !

bollywood bites, m, love bollywood bites ! ! ! ! it is completely awesome to have another indian option in this particular part of town. service was awesome. went straight in  place m's order after talking to the staff about the vegan options this is a must  and immediately got m's food. best thing about bollywood bites is price value. you can get an appropriately sized serving and the price is outstanding. m look forward to returning !

hyderabad house -  madison, tim, first of all  tim m supper bummed that fast buryani is gone the southern india restaurant was tim's fave. they were more southern india versus guys more northern india. so keep in mind tim prefer the southern flavor more. having said that :   tim had the butter chicken. the butter chicken came out in a reasonable amount if time. tim also ordered butter naan. the butter chicken was sweet with very little heat. as the only white guy in the pace maybe they assumed tim wanted mild. that was disappointing. yet the butter chicken did have a nice rich flavor and texture. the baan was normal  good. if tim go back tim will offer the tika masala and be sure to indicate tim's spice level. but still disappointed the southern india restaurant closed.

hyderabad house -  madison, michael, have sampled most of madison  south asian indian restaurants  some very good ones  but hyderabad house -  madison is in a class of hyderabad house -  madison's own. been there several times with friends everyone has loved friends's dishes  including biryanis  curries  dosas  and more. lots of veggie options animal proteins are chicken  goat shrimp  and paneer. there is a large selection of south indian dishes as well as hyderabad cuisine  which is similar to the mughlai n. indian  cooking found in most indian restaurants. the spicing is superb every dish tastes different  and hyderabad house -  madison do not  gratuitously use hot spices when hot spices are  not called for  something americans seem to expect in indian food . this delicious cuisine is authentic hyderabadi food. the service is prompt  the prices reasonable  and hyderabad house -  madison is usually packed with happy  mostly south asian  diners. worth going out of your way to the wilds of e. washington  just past e. towne  to taste this delicious cuisine. buffets are also good  varied selection.

hyderabad house -  madison, sarah, if you like biryani hyderabad house -  madison is the place for you ! wow sarah have  never seen so much biryani on a menu before and so much biryani on a menu is absolutely delicious. the menu focuses a lot on regional dishes but sarah also had some very good paneer masala. sarah also went to the buffet and hyderabad house -  madison had a very nice variety of foods all of which sarah enjoyed a lot. it is nice to find another great indian restaurant on the east side now that om is closed. sarah would go here mostly for biryani or the buffet but sarah believe hyderabad house -  madison have something for everyone. hyderabad house -  madison's desserts were really good too !

hyderabad house -  madison, meredith, exciting menu with many items that go beyond the typical u.s. indian restaurant fare. had the gpngura chicken biryani  medium spice level  and the gpngura chicken biryani  medium spice level was absolutely delicious. the gpngura chicken biryani  medium spice level was tender and the spices complex and just at the right heat level. the portion was huge  -  easily enough for two more meals. service was prompt and courteous.

rajdhani sweets, nav, food is awesome here. tip :  for takeout  call ahead so they can get the naan ready.

rajdhani sweets, ritu, ritu ordered food for    people but at the last minute had to increase it to    people. there was no issue in getting more food but ritu just had to wait a little bit while rajdhani sweets freshly cooked extra roti. the kadhi  bhindi  and aloo gobi were all hot but the rice was room temp when ritu got the rice home  requiring reheating the rice in batches in the microwave  a bit of a hassle as everyone was hungry . the food was excellent ! not spicy at all.... but the kadhi  bhindi has way too many onions in the kadhi  bhindi. ritu did not try the boondi raita as ritu do not  eat dairy but everyone enjoyed the boondi raita. ritu also did not  eat the roti but the roti were warm and soft and enjoyed by others. the tray of salad also had the pickled carrots in the tray of salad and there was plenty. there was plenty of food except the pakoras in kadhi seemed less. the gajar halwa was enjoyed by all but some people said the gajar halwa was too sweet. overall good food  reasonable price and great service.

rajdhani sweets, roma, roma came here for a visit today not knowing rajdhani sweets is also owned by the same owners of the etobicoke location http :   www.yelp.ca biz rajdhani - sweets - and - restaurant - etobicoke . while the variety in the meal offering is pretty much the same  all vegetarian   rajdhani sweets is much nicer than the other. presentation is the focus here the service was not as good  but roma m going to overlook it as it was diwali and rajdhani sweets were inundated with customers. rajdhani sweets offer thalis here which are very delicious  though a little rich. the rice was flavoured with raisins and almonds but roma know rajdhani sweets have plain rice as well. roma had a delicious dish with sliced fresh ginger and mixed vegetables. rajdhani sweets is worth a visit for vegetarian lunch or an inexpensive  casual dinner. roma look forward to a return visit here.

rajdhani sweets, lara, for the price you cannot go wrong. the food is usually superb however wait times can be lengthy and rajdhani sweets's service is spotty at best but this is a given  rajdhani sweets are always busy.

rajdhani sweets, salim, was in the neighbourhood and wanted to pick up some food for dinner and salim have had some of the dishes at one of our friends place. picked up   thalis. lately many restaurants will refuse to combine the   or   dishes that come with the thali. rajdhani sweets let us combine the four dishes that salim wanted  salim replaced the dessert with an extra dish curry  - most  indian restaurants will let you do this . salim picked up a palak paneer  spinach with cottage cheese   -  amazing dish a must try  malai kofta creamed paneer ball in a sweet gravy   -  too sweet gravy for some reason. the chole  chickpea  hit the spot right on. not too spicy overly seasoned and not greasy as well. and then there was mushrooms and paneer not seen in many punjabi restaurants  but liked by all in the family. the quantity provided was plenty to eat   if salim had enough naans  which were soft and fluffy. ordered roti as well  but opening of package found that roti were griddle rotis and not tandoor oven baked as roti are salim's preferred option. nevertheless roti were perfect. lots of rice  salad and yogurt raita provided as well. as and extra thinks for appetizers salim picked a few samosas and paneer pakoras fritters. all in all a few samosas and paneer pakoras fritters turned out to be good as well. only wish that this closer to where salim live or was in an area salim frequently visit.

paradise india, l, so happy our search for good indian in vegas is over ! the whole family loved paradise india. l ordered mango lassis  chicken tikka masala lamb vindaloo  a shrimp curry  and both garlic   plain naan. the chef owner also gave us a complimentary bread pudding. everything was absolutely delicious  but the garlic naan was possibly the best l have  ever had. l have  already recommended paradise india to several friends and are looking forward to many more visits. just noticed that the info section says  not good for kids. not sure why... l took our         and   yo with us and our         and   yo loved it. our         and   yo do eat thai  sushi    indian pretty regularly  however. anyway  l would  consider paradise india a family friendly  casual place.

paradise india, neil, the wife and neil tried paradise india a couple months ago and are hooked  -  neil have  been back   times. everything is made to order so expect a little wait  - but it is  worth it. the food bursts with flavor and is obviously crafted from fresh ingredients. the only suggestion neil have is to please add a sampling platter to the menu so that people can try several dishes at once. neil suggested one sampling platter with poultry and the other vegetable. if you already know what you like you are  in for a treat.

paradise india, goo, paradise india is a fantastic spot for indian food because everything is fresh prepared. so if goo want to remove some spices from goo's food  like cumin seeds  which are junk because cumin seeds  which are junk because they irritate the digestive tract irritate the digestive tract then it is  no big deal. almost all the other indian places in town premix things several days in advance which means the food at almost all the other indian places in town is not  truly fresh. goo also like the variety of choices on the menu and it is  also rare to find indian spots with dosa. service is very attentive and friendly. keep up the good work !

paradise india, johan, johan have  know william the owner for some time now and still find paradise india to be the best authentic indian restaurant in las vegas. william the owner has a great vegetarian and non vegetarian lunch special  perfectly delicious and at a great price. johan come here once a week for our indian treat ! this particular visit instead of a great vegetarian and non vegetarian lunch special  perfectly delicious and at a great price johan wanted to have the chicken curry again. however johan wanted the authentic indian version  not the westernized cubed chicken breast version. see johan grew up true indian food with close family indian friends and have come to love the chicken curry. johan asked william the owner if william the owner could make the chicken curry this way for johan  surprised by johan's request william the owner said this way is  how they have the chicken curry at home and this way is  the true way to prepare the chicken curry  however to make the chicken curry more commercially acceptable they make the chicken curry the chicken curry with chicken breast cubed in paradise india. william the owner was more than happy to prepare the meal for johan this way and got right to it  and by the looks of it  happy to accommodate johan's request  even down to the spice level johan required. while william the owner was whipping up johan's special request johan started with a truly delicious hot and spicy crispy crunchy flaky samosa filled with a curry potato and pea filling appetizer served with a delicious mint sauce and tamarin sauce. james had a great vegetarian and non vegetarian lunch special  perfectly delicious and at a great price  chicken tikka masala chicken  korma served with rice. william the owner brought out johan's chicken curry and my request was absolutely superb ! this way has so much more flavor ! johan enjoyed my request so much ! taking johan back to johan's aunty priscilla chicken table    years back. only when something is truly authentic will it transport you back in time to a childhood kitchen table where one was enjoying the real deal  and take it from johan  william the owner indian cuisine is as real as william  indian cuisine gets !
