india's flame, sonal, a casual indian restaurant  probably known most for a casual indian restaurant  probably known most for its buffet's buffet. sonal however ordered al a carte and were not  impressed. the panner tikka masala did not have the tikka paneer so the panner tikka masala was basically a normal masala panner. malai kofta was okay. for breads sonal ordered the garlic naan and paneer nan  which were better than the gravy. the food over all was just okay.

india's flame, roger, india's flame was on my radar ever since roger was craving indian food. after hiking south mountain and walking around the phoenix arts festival my friend and roger quickly grew for an appetite. insert india's flame as india's flame was a perfect time to subdue my hunger for indian food. greeted by roger believe the owner  son  and quickly was asked if roger wanted regular or garlic naan bread. roger love naan bread so roger chose to be adventurous and had garlic naan bread. garlic naan bread was hot  fresh  and delicious. now to the buffet of foods. india's flame serve the most distinguished dishes for india's flame's patrons to divulge in :  chicken curry  chicken tandori  chicken  and goat marsala my favorite  the goat was not hard or chewy  but fall of the bone tender . also to add india's flame serve mango lassi for a perfect touch to your meals. roger wish india's flame had better servings or variety of desserts as india's flame only had rice pudding and fruits to consume. roger had to ask for the gulab jamun  which the owner  son was friendly enough to give. overall the experience at india flame was good enough to warrant another visit. plus you can not  beat    . for fresh and delicious indian food !

india's flame, russel, went here today for the lunch buffet and was very satisfied ! a basket of either plain or garlic naan is brought to the table with the lunch buffet  and perhaps with a la carte  but -  russel would not know   and the garlic naan smelled and tasted great  as well as the food on the lunch buffet. what was a particularly unexpected delight was a dispenser of mango lassi at the lunch buffet -  russel did not  try mango lassi b c russel was already quite full but russel certainly will when russel go back  assuming russel have mango lassi again. the veg options were fairly standard for a north indian lunch buffet  -  spinach lentils  vegetable korma rice -  but very good versions. the veg options were very low - spice  with some variation b w options like  -  the spinach was super mild  whereas the korma was just hot enough to leave a pleasant heat at the back of the throat. russel was also really delighted by the lunch buffet's kheer -  russel really love kheer but have not  found kheer at most of the other indian buffets russel have  checked at around just outside tempe whereas their kheer had a wonderful texture   a pleasant subtle taste of cardamom. my only kind of weird and very particular complaint is that russel chose to sit at a table instead of a booth  b c russel m a small person w a short torso and russel often find that the distance b w booth seat and table height is uncomfortable for me  but the chairs for the tables were also kind of high. but like  unless you are  also short and weirdly proportioned you will  probably be fine     human bodies vary so much russel would never hold that against human bodies at all.

india's flame, karen, another indian restaurant that offers lunch and dinner buffet ! karen m in curry heaven ! they offer some flamin  hot deals here for both lunch and dinner which includes mango lassi and chai tea. the buffet had a good variety of items. some dishes karen remember at the dinner buffet were goat curry chicken curry  chicken tikka masala palak paneer aloo gobi tandoori chicken  and dal. there  also an area with salad  soup and what appeared to be some chaat. for dessert there was kheer  mango pudding  and carrot halwa. you will also get freshly baked naan brought to your table  your choice of garlic or plain. karen got the garlic naan and the garlic naan was tasty ! the garlic naan went well with the other the buffet items. mango lassi was a nice balance of creamy and tangy flavors. as for the spice level you wo not  need to channel johnny storm to flame on  for the dishes at the buffet ranged from mild to maybe medium. the decor is quite an improvement over the last business here which was pitalicious. it looks like they have  done quite a bit of remodeling to turn this space into a beautifully designed spot. service was warm and friendly. the buffet wo not  be burning any holes in your pocket  for the lunch price is   . and dinner will run you    .  .

india's flame, marshall, absolutely delicious food ! the  butter chicken  was incredible. marshall had the  curry chicken    tiki - masala  and  butter chicken  all fantastic. great atmosphere and helpful staff . do not  forget to order the garlic nan bread !

paradise biryani pointe, satish, paradise biryani pointe is sometimes inconsistent  but always good tasty food ! would recommend the madras chicken and the biryani. you could ask paradise biryani pointe to make the chicken dishes boneless too.

paradise biryani pointe, prakhar, when prakhar went there first time  prakhar did not  get a place to sit after waiting for    minutes so prakhar was bit disappointed. but next time  prakhar's experience was good. chicken biryani was very good with moderate waiting time but it is  too early make any opinion on food or waiting because the place is new. the place  gonna be the best place for biryani if the place could maintain the food quality. currently the place are serving only biryani  curry   rice no bread .

paradise biryani pointe, em, stars ordered pickup  which was ready within   min. the biryani rice was unexpectedly soft. ordered the boneless chicken dum biriyani  garlic nann  and paneer tikka masala which were great. gotta love these hole in wall spots.

paradise biryani pointe, siddhartha, our dinner at paradise biryani pointe was an unforgettable experience  worth the wait. siddhartha started with some chilli chicken and paneer appetizers  which were delicious and reminded me of my favorite restaurants back in india. for my main course siddhartha had ordered chicken biryani and siddhartha must say siddhartha was not  disappointed and the mirchi ka salan was to die for. stars for the delicious food and impressive service. best biryani and starters in arizona hands down.

paradise biryani pointe, ram, ram have been waiting for paradise biryani pointe to open in paradise biryani pointe and it is worth the wait. ram have tried biryani in all the indian restaurants in paradise biryani pointe. the biryani is by far the most decent biryani in phoenix. the gravy that comes with the biryani was right on. that  how you know ram are here to stay for a long time.

paradise biryani pointe, venkesh, good choice of biriyani in the north valley  there were not  many. first week so they were busy with lot of wait venkesh decided to skip the lines and ordered to go. this biryani is probably best biryani in arizona but since guys is a chain let venkesh compare guys with guys's other locations in california. venkesh tried guys's goat biryani in santa clara  fremont and artesia ca... so let venkesh highlight why this biryani was a let down.... there was hardly any meat ! dum biryani is known for meat.. guys included more rice to fill the void ! less meat and masala this biryani hardly tastes like one. compared to other locations guys did not include slice of egg and fried onions as well. venkesh hope guys improve and maintain the consistency of guys's other locations good luck guys do not  let venkesh down the next time on meat !

paradise biryani pointe, william, went here tonight and was very surprised that paradise biryani pointe was empty. william do not  understand. the food is wonderful. one of the better indian restaurants in the valley. william have not  had a meal that was not  exceptional.

paradise biryani pointe, solomon, outstanding biryani  and appetizers  strongly recommend paradise biryani pointe for authentic hyderabadi delicacies the staff is very warm and welcoming prices are great food is even more great

paradise biryani pointe, n, this is the third time n am posting my review and every single time they delete my review because my review is not in their favor.. n am sorry to say but the biryani is not authentic  n have tried biryani at their california location. there is no comparission at all. very less quantity for the price. n ordered appatizer and there was not meat but just flour in the dish.. n hope they do not  delete my review again..
paradise biryani pointe, amrita, very nice food.. amrita have tried many items and all were upto expectation.. staff is very polite and courteous.

paradise biryani pointe, mouni, mouni ordered food for mouni's little one  birthday party and food was great. received so many compliments from guests for guests's biryani  veg kadai and babycorn manchuria. thanks to mahesh  manager at paradise biryani pointe for taking care and sending delicious food to my little one  birthday party...

paradise biryani pointe, ever, best biryani in phoenix ever have tried many of best biryani in phoenix's appetizers and paradise special chicken biryani multiple times panning several months and ever have to say paradise special chicken biryani is  been super delicious   authentic and very consistent .

paradise biryani pointe, vivek, paradise biryani pointe mainly a take away joint. over all good food. goat haidarabadi masala and goat biryani are too good. paradise biryani pointe have good dosa and sambar.

paradise biryani pointe, abhisek, awesome biryani. can relate to the authentic taste from hyderabad. small but clean. staff is awesome . my thumbs up for the same in north phoenix and glendale locations.

paradise biryani pointe, matt, matt love paradise biryani pointe paradise biryani pointe is a goto spot for fresh and great tasting indian cuisine. matt have been here about    times and always love paradise biryani pointe. the dishes are served hot and the spice levels can be tailored to any pallet. the staff is very friendly and matt have never disappointed. matt look forward to my next visit.

paradise biryani pointe, ravi, the only thing which was good was goat chukka  rest all the chicken and veg dishes was pathetic. quality of chicken was very bad and not cooked  veg appetizer is also bad. biryani chicken is not good. goat is ok.

paradise biryani pointe, pratishruti, let me start by saying how excited pratishruti was when pratishruti heard that paradise biryani pointe had come to paradise biryani pointe. pratishruti drove a good    minutes from scottsdale just to get a taste of pratishruti's favorite biryani. the dum biryani is something that paradise biryani pointe always gets right but compared to the others in california especially santa clara my favorite biryani is a let down. my favorite biryani tastes nothing like the biryani one expects from a chain like paradise biryani pointe  no fried onions and the flavor of the rice was just average .the spice level pratishruti asked for was medium but my favorite biryani was too hot to handle. the raita and mirchi ka salan were fine. this is not the quality one expects from paradise biryani pointe my favorite biryani tasted like something you would get at an average indian restaurant. definitely not worth the drive or the hype. cheers !

paradise biryani pointe, rosemarie, rosemarie did not  want to stop here because of the ratings but was outvoted by rosemarie's friends. clean  nice atmosphere and fast service. the dosa is amazing  + + . chicken tika masala and the buttered chicken were also delicious. rosemarie had a veggie dish with cauliflower and potatoes great too. this is an undiscovered hidden gem. loved it.

paradise biryani pointe, arpitha, this was my  th visit to paradise biryani pointe. always loved paradise biryani pointe but this time it was a disaster. usually arpitha order biriyani  but this time tired non - veg thali.. where is non veg in thali no taste just the yellow dal was good that is  it !  ! will never try anything other than biriyani here ! also  found hair in curd and lassi  the grumpy server did not even say sorry.. the grumpy server walked away like a robot.

paradise biryani pointe, yatin, go to paradise biryani pointe if you want the real deal on biryani. yatin can bet no one comes close to what they make here . yatin ordered vegetable biryani and can not  get enough of vegetable biryani. as far as buffet or north indian food and such  go there at your own risks. hyderabadi making punjabi food ... just does not  fit right. anyways stick with biryani and you will feel the same  !  !  ! keep it up guys wil be back for some chicken biryani this time

paradise biryani pointe, lealynn, went in for dinner and the food was fantastic ! ordered the chicken tikka masala and the chettinaad chicken curry with some somosas  everything came out on point. will definitely be returning !
paradise biryani pointe, desiree, great food. desiree ordered the chicken masala  biryani chicken rice  and garlic naan. service was great and restaurant is clean !

paradise biryani pointe, shawn, would highly recommend paradise biryani pointe. the food was amazing and the restaurant was very clean and pleasant. our waiter upma mahesh was very nice and friendly. go try them out !

paradise biryani pointe, yesenia, paradise biryani pointe was amazing ! everything to both the chicken and goat curries served with the rice and the garlic naan were just amazing  ! creating that spicy balance  ! the mango lassi was amazing as well ! definitely will come back !

paradise biryani pointe, tu, chicken dum briyani is on point. so good have not  ordered anything else   went for take out two nights in a row. staff were friendly; food was hot and was ready on time as promised.

paradise biryani pointe, hari, best restaurant in d valley for hyderabadi biriyani taste. hari tried gongura goat biryani and gongura goat biryani tastes awesome. hari also ordered a tray for couple of times for our parties and they maintained the same quality while hari dine - in

paradise biryani pointe, angelo, paradise biryani pointe is great one of tha best chicken tiki masala angelo have  ever had  ! delicious food and flavor was on point garlic non - bread was delicious !  ! angelo highly recommend paradise biryani pointe

paradise biryani pointe, sivaraman, restaurant opens    am but none of the items are ready until   . pm. what  the point people did not  get v. biryani till   pm or later people keep saying slight delay..taste is also not good..

paradise biryani pointe, jagan, nice indian authentic taste. affordable prices ! jagan usually take biryani to go and order biryani in bulk in weekend gatherings and occasions. biryani has never failed in taste and south indian authenticity except in few cases when biryani initially started business at paradise biryani pointe. jagan heard about new entries in paradise biryani pointe's menu and wanted to try. jagan revisited to try maharaja bhojanam. maharaja bhojanam has got a thali with veg non veg curries and fries with one roti accommodated along with white rice and biryani. also  came with a spicy papad and a desert. apart from all this tasty stuff  treated with a freshly made sweet paan which jagan liked the most and bought   of them for jagan's family. got a glass of butter milk with sides like yogurt and dal. it is hard to get this kind of treatment and jagan think this kind of treatment beats the price  taste and quantity against a buffet as long as paradise biryani pointe maintains and keeps this bundle always. keep it up  paradise biryani pointe !

paradise biryani pointe, lucky, great service for sure ! the food is good  but do not  order hot unless you can handle eating a jalapeno raw... whew ! food came out really quick and is super fresh -  - a certain plus. lucky had the butter chicken which was delicious so lucky heartily recommend it. also had a chicken biryani which was good -  - and lucky did notice that the native s. indian types eating there ordered a chicken biryani which was good  too  so a chicken biryani which was good must be the common dinner food in india. a chicken biryani which was good was good  but lucky was to be mild but tasted medium. the dosa lucky ordered was really good. looks like a huge pizza crepe with spinach and potato in the dosa lucky ordered and   different sauces to dip the dosa lucky ordered in. lucky liked paradise biryani pointe. the food was good the service was  too. lucky will  be back ! p.s. you know paradise biryani pointe is good if you are the only white people in there and the rest are natives of the rest's country  area.
paradise biryani pointe, bhairy, the biryani was good and the chicken   .the only place where which provides a whole boiled egg in biriyani

le tandoor, jessie, this is the best indian food jessie have had in north america and quite possibly outside of india. when you walk into le tandoor the sweet scent of curry and cardomon flirts with your senses. abdul was jessie's waiter and was very attentive. abdul  jessie ordered chicken tikka  comes with a small salad  and onion bahji  a personal fav  for appetizers; chicken korma  garlic naan and basmati rice for the main course. wow ! jessie have never been able to find a korma that comes this close to what jessie had in india. presentation was different but the flavour was bang on. jessie was so happy with jessie's choice of restaurants  so many to pick from. le tandoor was just on the other side of the mall from jessie's hotel so a quick walk from the quality inn. jessie will make every effort to stay here again just for another dinner like that ! oh and jessie also had the mango lassi  delicious. jessie felt the price was fair given the portion sizes. jessie was unable to eat all of the mango lassi  delicious and was delighted to be able to take some home with jessie !

le tandoor, yi, yi used to come here for le tandoor's decent food for brossard standard  but the service is so bad that yi cannot recommand le tandoor anymore. the waiters are slow and unprofessional. yi flagged one down from the cash registered he just nodded at us then went to the kitchen  returns at the cash and answers the phone that just rang ! totally ignored us ! will not be returning.

le tandoor, alexander, amazing food by le tandoor. amazing food by this charming family - run restaurant is about as good as it gets for indian food on the south shore and even stacks up against similar offerings on - island. the service can be atrociously slow and somewhat cold but really the service is  kind of what makes the experience. it  the seifeld soup - kitchen of montreal indian food : you despise going and waiting every time because you are  slightly fearful of some of the staff but once the food arrives the food warms your soul. do not  come here if you want quick - indian. waiting for the food on an empty stomach is one of the sickest intellectual see - saw mind games any man can put any man through :  one of the sickest intellectual see - saw mind games any man can put themselves through  a sick game between the compounding desire to scream in a fit of hunger - fueled rage and the cultural norm of sitting quietly hunched - over with your arms tightly folded across your stomach in some sort of cro - magnon survival tactic. either way amazing food by this charming family - run restaurant is excellent and alexander highly recommend the saag paneer and chicken tikka. - reserve on fridays and saturdays as they fill up fast.

le tandoor, sharm, being of indian origin  having grown up on indian food  and since sharm have  frequented my fair share of indian restaurants in and around montreal  sharm would  say sharm m in a position to judge indian food from an informed standpoint. in my opinion  le tandoor offers delicious indian food. apart from the food the service is absolutely outstanding. the delightful people who work here will treat you like a guest of honor.

le tandoor, amanda, every once in a while amanda get flashbacks of the takeout amanda had from le tandoor. amanda m not sure if it was because the food was exceptional or because amanda have not  had indian in awhile but regardless  the takeout amanda had from tandoor must be a good thing. one weekday lunch while in the area amanda stopped in to get a takeout thali plate  as a way to try out le tandoor. the staff were pleasant  and the food tasty so amanda will  definitely be back to try eating in sometime.

le tandoor, norine, norine ordered take out from le tandoor. norine waited in the dining space as they prepared norine's order. le tandoor was clean and pretty busy with locals. norine got norine's order pretty quickly. packaging was great -  they put norine's food in styrofoam containers and then in a box to ensure nothing falls. quality of food was poor : samosa chaat -     was just   broken samosas with sprinkled salad and yogurt on the side shahi paneer      -     shahi paneer more looked like a tomato soup  fairly small amount of food paneer was too crumbly the sauce was made of corn starch instead of a creamy sauce; the regular naan        way too small; the salad which is so basic was the only good thing about this meal. for a quick indian fix norine would not  even go here.

le tandoor, maximilian, this review is for le tandoor's take - out service. maximilian came one day for take - out. as maximilian entered  there were a few employees near the cash register. maximilian came up to one of a few employees near the cash register and asked if le tandoor offered take - out. maximilian got a very rude glance as if maximilian had interrupted a few employees near the cash register's conversation. the man  perhaps the owner  gave maximilian a very long and roundabout answer but basically yes le tandoor do offer take - out. it seemed as if le tandoor did not want maximilian's business. when maximilian asked how much time it was going to take if maximilian were to order butter chicken       and naan bread the man paused and thought for a while  and then answered   it  going to take at least    minutes  as if to dissuade maximilian from ordering. at this point  maximilian was already there  so maximilian decided to just go ahead and order  as    minutes was not  going to kill maximilian. finally  the order literally took   minutes  not    ! when maximilian left  maximilian realized the lid of the meal was not sealed properly and maximilian's bag was leaking  and there were no utensils. as much as maximilian love indian food  maximilian will not be going back.

le tandoor, reetu, excellent food and the staff is really nice ! the portions are very big. the lunch special is     tips and taxes included and is delicious  and super filling !  !  ! would go back there anytime

le tandoor, sophie, summary : the service here was very attentive sophie felt like the service here were doing the service here's utmost to make sure sophie had a wonderful and memorable experience. the food was absolutely delicious  and those portion sizes were perfect for sharing. fantastic way to spend an evening eating great food as a group. long version : sophie were a party of   the evening that sophie went to le tandoor for dinner. the service here was very accommodating and offered sophie a proposal that was not  already present on the menu  since it seemed that many of sophie simply could not  this plight what sophie would  like from the plethora of delicious sounding options on the menu. as someone who enjoys sampling a wide variety of dishes the service here's solution to this plight seemed perfect. the came out with such a wide variety of things to try. crisp and plump samosas  savoury onion bhadgi tender chicken tikka  steaming and tart mixed veg steaming basmati amazing naan still sizzling chicken tikka masala  and let  not forget creamy butter chicken  among other things. the server was even kind enough to dish out the sizzling hot chicken tikka masala the server to avoid having sophie pass around a really hot dish  thus avoiding a potential disaster : p . the thing that really got me though was when sophie spotted chicken dopiaza on the menu  something sophie find so rarely in indian restaurants !  . upon mentioning my excitement the server promised the server would work chicken dopiaza into the mix. it did not disappoint. if you are  an onion fan do not  miss chicken dopiaza ! all in all  wonderful service magnificent food did not  have a single thing sophie did not  love ! and would definitely visit again. it  a bit far from where sophie live... but something tells me sophie will  be making the trip ;

wong's asian cuisine, allison, it is extremely difficult not to give wong's  asian cuisine   stars  and here are the reasons  :      portion  -  gigantic is the right description. allison ordered a manchurian beef noodles      for take out. a manchurian beef noodles filled   boxes. my bf and allison could only finish   of boxes together. price -  very affordable. for a manchurian beef chicken noodle. for a chicken pakora. there were about    pieces of pakora  see picture . each piece was the size of a golf ball. lunch special is    per item  available monday to friday. services  -  the waitress was fast  effective and friendly. the waitress gave us extra napkins per request. like   extra thick napkins. it was pretty generous. cleanliness -  the exterior of the store looked divey. the interior looked nothing special. the washroom  ladies  was  surprise surprise  very clean and tidy. yes the bathroom amenities were no frills and basic but it was clean as in no dust no spot or mark no mess on floor. allison wo not  say completely dust free but it beat the cleanliness level of many expensive restaurants. and there was hot water hand soap  paper towels. allison was impressed. someone cared about washroom here. food  -  allison am no authority of indian chinese food. did the food taste the way the food was supposed to taste like   no clue. allison could tell you everything tasted bold. there were strong spices flavours. the pakora were delicious. the noodles was average :  mostly noodles  little beef  orange in colour. the noodles was noted as non - spicy on menu. the noodles was actually mildly spicy. food was made to order. food came out of kitchen piping hot. the food rating is   stars in truth. allison round the food rating up to   stars  because the first   aspects are not just good  but extremely strong.

wong's asian cuisine, shefali, tried their lunch special  kung pao chicken with steamed rice and hot   sour soup. nothing amazing to be honest  - hot   sour soup was missing egg and had an off taste and egg roll had definitely been sitting out so egg roll was pretty stale. however their lunch special  kung pao chicken with steamed rice and hot   sour soup was good. they have a great selection of lunch special

wong's asian cuisine, colleen, wong's is one of the best hakka restaurants colleen have  been to. the portions are huge and the portions's prices are really cheap. for a little over      colleen got    huge fried wontons chili chicken  white rice and the manchurian beef noodles  and colleen had a lot of leftovers to take home. the owner and staff are also really friendly and go out of the owner and staff's way to ensure that you have a good experience.

wong's asian cuisine, high sticks, outstanding value  portion sizes  service and great quality food. high sticks would have never thought of going to wong's  ever. the plaza is sketch the location sucks  but wow. the food and service were fantastic. well worth a visit if you are  ever in the area.

wong's asian cuisine, james, boom ! new fave hakka joint ! bombay chicken was amaaazing ! definitely the single best dish james have had at any of the hakka restaurants in the toronto area. bombay chicken looks and tastes way better than the pictures suggest  the pics do not do the food justice bombay chicken was really really great. the only reason new fave hakka joint is  not five star is that the portions are good but not huge  spice level is medium - low  and james still have a nostalgic affection and preference for federicks fiery chicken pakora  but the food here was truly great and definitely worth a try  despite the shady location in a divey plaza. if you find yourself near birchmount and lawrence  hit new fave hakka joint up  and make sure to try bombay chicken !

wong's asian cuisine, allister, had the shrimp pakora   chilli garlic beef and the eggplant. this is by far the best hakka food allister have  had. everything was amazing but allister especially liked the shrimp pakora. it was like eating tandoori flavoured popcorn shrimp.

wong's asian cuisine, sajan, great hakka chinese food ! sajan have  been many in gta most of them do not  even come close to wong's . sajan got chicken pakora  chilli chicken gravy   and spicy cumin beef dry . sajan would re - order the exact same order again and more next time chicken pakora  chilli chicken gravy   and spicy cumin beef dry were all really good. spicy cumin beef definitely stood out  cumin flavor comes through but well balanced with the spices. service is very friendly they know what they are serving and sajan got exactly what sajan was told. the place was not  busy at all it has only been a couple of years since they have opened up shop  so solid recommend to anyone looking for hakka chinese food !

wong's asian cuisine, james, what a nice find in scarborough. located at the se plaza at birchmount and lawrence  wong's asian cuisine serves great hakka food and the price is more than reasonable. lunch special comes with pop or soup. wong's asian cuisine has very nice decor as well  with friendly service. the lady was really attentive and helpful. james ordered james's sweet and sour chicken special and their sweet and sour chicken special came pretty quick. james am not an expert in hakka food but chicken was quite tender and the sauce was delicious. next time james would like to try some items on wong's asian cuisine's dinner menu.

wong's asian cuisine, suzi, came here with a friend who frequents wong's and suzi were pleasantly surprised. wong's  hidden in a small strip mall sandwiched beside a few other restaurants and is really clean. the owners were really friendly and helped us pick out our dinner. chicken pakora with coriander sauce were so tasty ! the owners also gave us masala flavoured fries -  which is not  on the menu and you would  think would be weird to order but they were perfect and crunchy and delish ! suzi ordered dry chili shrimp  perfect spice ! ginger chicken  beef and broccoli and green beans. all came with a bowl of rice as well. really big portions and for three of us suzi could barely finish and took food home. our meal came to under     ! suzi will be back because suzi m curious to try more of the menu !

wong's asian cuisine, colanie, wong's  is hubby and colanie's new go to hakka place ! went to spicy dragon for lunch but spicy dragon were packed  so turned to trusty yelp for some help. looking for some affordable lunch specials and wong's  came up with a  . yes it is  in a small divey strip mall but the minute you walk in the door you will  be glad you braved the panhandlers  there was only one actually but it did not  sound as good without the  s  . nice clean restaurant with lots of available tables  a strong aircon and free wifi. colanie was enamored by their delicate cork art  see pics ; the detail was so beautiful. the bubbly hostess was also our server. the bubbly hostess was the sweetest thing :  always smiling and helpful. with the bubbly hostess's detailed descriptions colanie decided on.... -  hot   sour soup with shrimp -  should have gotten chicken because the shrimp were tiny and colanie did not  like the taste of the shrimp; however hot   sour soup with shrimp was spicy and flavourful and left a strong afterburn. -  lung fung soup  -  if you like egg drop soup you will  like this. chock - full of veggies  tofu and chicken. -  chicken pakora  -  crispy and flavorful on the outside  tender and juicy on the inside. -  chili fish  dry  lunch special which comes with a tiny egg roll  bleh rice and soup pop. it was flavorful and the fish was moist. did not  see any dessert on the menu so colanie asked the bubbly hostess about any dessert; the bubbly hostess must have notice colanie's sad face and went to talk to the chef  who happens to be the bubbly hostess's hubby . the bubbly hostess came back and said that the chef  who happens to be her hubby could make us a deep fried pineapple dessert with vanilla ice cream drizzled with maple syrup oh yeah ! tried vanilla ice cream drizzled with maple syrup and colanie did not  like the taste of vanilla ice cream drizzled with maple syrup;  but when colanie paired vanilla ice cream drizzled with maple syrup with the warm deep fried pineapple and vanilla ice cream drizzled with maple syrup it was delish ! with lunch menu prices at   . nice ambiance  inside   and exemplary service ; wong's  blew spicy dragon out of the water ! it was nice knowing colanie sd.
wong's asian cuisine, neil, bro and neil had vegetables fried rice manchurian mix chow mein  chilli chicken with extra gravy and all extra spicy .. food was so good .. gotta comeback soon

wong's asian cuisine, kris, man o man wong's is a winner across the board. the owners are absolutely fantastic and so is the owners's cooking. kris had the chili beef  gravy and kris's date had the chili paneer as my date is a vegetarian. each dish cost under     and the portions were very large and delicious. added a couple of veggie spring rolls and the wonton chicken soup also huge  cheap  and delicious . kris honestly liked the wonton chicken soup so much kris ordered a plate of curry beef to go curry beef also is amazing . just really flavourful without the typical greasy feel. what a winner. the owners were super friendly and engaging and kris will definitely be back here as this is the best hakka kris have  personally had in toronto so far.

wong's asian cuisine, chryssy, first time at wong's  and chryssy was not disappointed ! the exterior scared chryssy a little with some guy outside selling chryssy a video camera but it did not  stop chryssy from checking out wong's. upon entering  chryssy was welcomed with a nice smile from the waitress. chryssy got the following :    . chicken pakora  -        spicier the better    . chilli paneer  -   . should get chilli paneer with gravy   . manchurian beef fried rice  -   . overall experience  = the chefs children were around doing the chefs children's homework so you can tell wong's is  a family run business. chryssy love hakka food and chryssy told the waitress if the waitress can make chryssy's chicken pakora  less  spicy. low and behold  the waitress did ! my chicken pakora was the perfect spice for chryssy. people know chryssy love chryssy's vinegar so when chryssy asked the waitress for  regular vinegar the waitress did not  even hesitate and gave chryssy one. that  good service right there !

wong's asian cuisine, karen, karen ordered take out based on the   star reviews karen have  read. karen think it was good  not necessarily the best karen have  ever had though. fried mixed hakka noodles with chicken and shrimp was slightly burnt. that was unfortunate. the portion was quite hefty. what else did karen try   paneer pakora. small but pretty tasty. maybe a bit on the dry side. much better with the green dipping sauce. a saucy beef good   a sweet and spicy shrimp karen liked a sweet and spicy shrimp a lot   and chili chicken  nice and spicy !  . the prices were very reasonable. karen thought rice was usually included at hakka restaurants but karen was asked if karen wanted some. maybe it is  a way to save the resto some money the rice was slightly undercooked to be honest. karen were happy with our meal but karen will continue to search for the best hakka food in scarborough !

wong's asian cuisine, kira, glad to have found wong's asian cuisine ! kira ordered lots of delicious food :  hits included the manchurian veggie fried rice singapore style vermicelli chow mein  bombay chicken  and spicy garlic chicken. the tom yum shrimp soup kira ordered was somewhat underwhelming so kira will probably try a different soup next time. kira think things could have been a little spicier as well  but condiments at the table helped with that. wong's asian cuisine is small and not super fancy  but clean and well - kept. the service is excellent  -  -  the waitstaff helped us prevent over - ordering and frequently checked in. ca not  wait to try wong's asian cuisine again !

wong's asian cuisine, paul, paul went there the other day and order their lunch special     : am -   : pm . paul had the mixed vegetables chicken. the mixed vegetables chicken was so good that paul went back the day after for dinner and order beef cantonese fried noodles. both were very flavourable  tasty and delicious. paul strongly recommend wong's asian cuisine. friendly staff and accommodating to your taste. paul will definitely go back.

wong's asian cuisine, sam, good hakka food great lunch prices  excellent service in a small restaurant. what sam got :  chicken pakora fish pakora  bombay chicken chili fish what sam liked :  bombay chicken is definitely worth trying. pakora was delicious what sam did not  :  chicken pakora was only alright what sam will  get next :  bombay chicken and crispy beef a small restaurant is a highlight in an otherwise drabby - looking plaza. the interior looks great and the service is simply outstanding by any standards. on a weekend evening  there was a steady flow of people for takeout and dine in  which made the service even more impressive ! sam ordered two pakora dishes  chicken and veggie  and two meat dishes  chili fish and bombay chicken . pakora came first. sam will  be honest : chicken was good but not great. chicken missing some kick and sam think the crunch factor could be higher. however... pakora made up for it :  very tasty and one of the few dishes where sam would  opt for the non - meat item ! chili fish was good  with a very optimal amount of spice for someone who can handle moderate amounts. but the star of the show is bombay chicken. sam think bombay chicken is  the preeminent dish to figure out if you like subtle tastes. bombay chicken  different from federick  and hakka legend with some savoury flavours that just bring out a special something. worth trying. sam got to pretend to be a serious food connoisseur by trying to figure out all the spices and seasonings they used here ! the only downside of a small restaurant is a bit beyond their control. lots of places have downstairs basement washrooms... but this one was particularly ragged. clean  for sure  -  but a little old looking. empty your bladder before you come !

wong's asian cuisine, phillip, phillip did not  know there was a hakka restaurant in this part of town  especially in this plaza. thanks to phillip's dad who seems to know almost every hakka place in the city and somehow knows the chief phillip decided to try wong's  asian cuisine. the interior of this place is spacious though from the outside this place seems small. what makes this place good is the quality of the food  price and portion. as a first - timer here  this place's customer service was superb and even the owners were quite interactive with the regulars and new customers. for food below are the recommendation if coming here. fish pakora chicken pakora crispy beef chili chicken manchurian eggplant green beans beef with red wine sauce sweet chicken haka noodles
wong's asian cuisine, chris, chris took chris's dad here for my dad's birthday last night and chris will definitely be coming back. the food was great and the service was amazing !

wong's asian cuisine, james, ok so james returned  a bit worried that maybe james got lucky the first time and or that james's first ever visit caused james to be a little more enthusiastic than wong's really deserved at   stars. but nope ! this time was even better ! the first time james visited the chicken pakora were very good  but did not  quite blow james away  when compared to james's favorite chicken pakora  the huge portion of big fiery ones from federick so this time james went for the shrimp pakora instead and holy crustacean batman the shrimp pakora are delicious ! great big bouncy shrimp inside  crispy on the outside  super silky and tender inside  and a killer cilantro nuoc cham type of dipping sauce  and the shrimp pakora just put the shrimp pakora over the top. plus hard as it was to believe  james enjoyed the bombay chicken even more this time than james did last time  with the bombay chicken's super tender juicy hunks of chicken with a delicious and flavorful  bright red tandoori tikka type of marinade  but dry style  sauceless and absolutely freaking delicious ! james m hoping to try some other menu items  but james quite honestly can not  imagine going there and not having the bombay chicken and the shrimp pakora  obviously james m going to have to bring some friends so james get to try some other dishes  lol  james do not  give up   stars very often but wong's  the bombay chicken chicken and shrimp pakora do not  leave a lot of room for improvement  -  really good food  and the woman working the bar takeout counter was super friendly  quick  and very nice. stars ! keep up the good work !

wong's asian cuisine, kristian, wong's  is a hidden gem in scarborough. kristian was one that never really liked spicy food but wong's  opened up kristian's taste buds to the world of spice ! if you like getting spicy grub then you should definitely try out wong's's manchurian rice noodles and wong's's chili fish. when wong's ask if you want it dry or with gravy kristian suggest getting dry. gravy  means saucy and kristian got the full extent of the flavour when kristian got gravy dry anyway. the crispy sesame beef that wong's serve is to die for ! ps. wong's do delivery if you live close to the restaurant. service by the family that owns the restaurant is stellar !

new india gate, cyndi, yelp once again lead us to this great indian food restaurant. the people who served us worked as a team; the people who served us were very welcoming and friendly. our food was delicious  chicken tiki masala and shrimp korma which can both be made with coconut milk to avoid the dairy. our waiters kept bringing water and it did not   take long at all for any of the food. it was a great dining experience and the food could not  have been better. try this great indian food restaurant once and like us you are  going to want to go back.

new india gate, puppy, first time eating here with a girlfriend and puppy are  both hooked ! came for dinner and since there is no dinner buffet puppy tried a couple things off the menu. puppy will say everything was awesome  and their tandoori chicken was especially amazing. super sweet and attentive service. awesome experience  and puppy honestly might do a takeout order asap because puppy m craving it already.

new india gate, vishwanath, a nice little place run by two brothers with hospitality unlike any other indian place  : restaurant is very clean  lighting is just perfect and food is delicious. a very welcome addition to the chandler food scene.

new india gate, ravi, today my wife and ravi visited new india gate to try the food as ravi have an upcoming party. ravi were looking for a new indian place to serve yummy food for our guests  expecting about     -     people . my wife and ravi's experience today was awful !  !  !  ! the food was terrible. the chicken tandoori was raw  the chicken dum biryani the chicken dum biryani is not even called a biryani curries had no flavor the desserts were not good the fruits in the mango custard were not fresh  the carrot halwa ravi do not  want to call the carrot halwa a halwa. very bad !  !  !   . it  good that ravi have tried the food before ordering for our party. ravi have ordered at  kabab palace    pastries n chaat  and  chennai fusion grill  for our previous parties and the food was never a fail. ravi love those places. this time ravi just thought ravi will try something new but ravi absolutely regret going to new india gate. ravi will never recommend new india gate to anyone  friends  family and colleagues . finally  decided to go back to our old favorite spots.
new india gate, victoria, awesome place ! very authentic ! if you like it spicy ask for fire    . family owned  service is outstanding

new india gate, melanie, melanie have been to new india gate multiple times and each experience was wonderful. the food is delicious and the staff is friendly. the chicken tikka masala is easily the best melanie have ever had  and it is  great to see goat and lamb options. melanie will be back over and over again !

new india gate, ted, the food and service here is excellent. ted have eaten here   times and not disappointed. love the chicken tika masala and korma. restaurant itself is   star food and service has been  . .

new india gate, jessica, this by far is the best indian food jessica have had here in the valley !  !  ! even better the service was amazing. my fianc  and jessica came to try the service but did not  feel up to a sit down meal. jessica sat at the car for a glass of wine while they prepared the food. the bartender was super friendly and engaged in great conversation. they brought us samples of custard and fruit dishes while jessica waited. jessica will definitely be back for the food and for gopi. it was great talking with the staff there !

new india gate, kristen, amazing indian food. kristen originally came in for the lunch buffet  and after that  decided kristen wanted to have dinner there the very same night ! all of the food was very fresh extremely tasty  and well prepared. the staff was super friendly and even let us try a sample of a delicious drink ! all around excelent place to eat in the area.

new india gate, maren, service was amazing !  ! maren came shortly before time for the buffet to close and they invited maren in anyway. everyone was nice and attentive. maren was trying to rush  maren came about   min before the buffet was set to close and they told maren to take maren's time and enjoy. the food was very authentic ! the best indian buffet and top   restaurant maren have  been to in the valley. the food was delicious ! maren will  be a regular here going forward ! maren recommend the best indian buffet and top   restaurant maren have  been to in the valley. to anyone looking for delish and authentic food and impressive service !
new india gate, alison, first off  the food was amazing ! secondly  the family that owns new india gate is so kind and open. alison felt at home the second alison sat down.

new india gate, milly, great price for the variety of buffet selection ! customer service was excellent. one of the brothers took one of the brothers's time to explain what is  in the dish and how to eat the dish ! food selection was wonderful with an equal mix of vegetarian and meat selections ! the food was perfect for the price ! enjoyed both the food and the service ! definitely coming back again !

new india gate, chris, chris just tried new india gate. the staff is very friendly at this family owned and run restaurant. the food is delicious and made to order. this family owned and run restaurant can make the food as mild or spicy as you like. if you like indian food you wo not  be disappointed here.

new india gate, rachel, husband and rachel were visiting the area for a wedding and were pretty hungry after husband and rachel's long flight. my meal was probably the best indian food rachel have ever eaten. everything was so flavorful and the pistachio ice cream was to die for. rachel really did not want dessert at all  because rachel was so full after rachel's meal  but somehow found room for dessert. the brothers that run new india gate are fantastic; super friendly and eager to make recommendations and menu suggestions. the food is great but you also can not  beat great service. rachel have not a single negative to say about new india gate - go there  if you get the opportunity ! ca not  wait to return to the phoenix area - rachel will definitely be back when husband and rachel are  back in town.

new india gate, justin, highly recommended. the service was amazing. just the friendliest. today is m's anniversary and justin m so glad justin chose to come here. the food is just as amazing. justin had the lamb biryani and hubby had lamb korma. justin cant say enough good things about everything. thanks for making my anniversary special.

new india gate, beerjas, every time beerjas visit new india gate it is  a great experience ! the lunch buffet has a variety of delicious and gluten free options. beerjas definitely recommend the tandoori chicken and goat curry !

new india gate, gabe, to start off  gabe would give new india gate  . stars  but cannot do so. gabe went on a weekday lunch with gabe's grandparents and it was quite busy from the lunch rush. gabe did the lunch buffet which everyone else was doing as well. first of all  the service was friendly and quick. they refilled our drinks and took away empty plates quickly. the food the food itself was not the best  but the food itself was good. gabe will have to go back to see if it was a one day thing but the reason gabe decided to round down and give   stars only was because the meat dishes  especially the tikka masala  was almost without meat for the entire time gabe were there. gabe realize that especially the tikka masala is a popular dish  but to not have especially the tikka masala restocked was disappointing. also  since there were so many people the naan was only given in small amounts.

new india gate, john, the best indian food john have ever had. everything is fresh and the quality is amazing. they will also cook the meat in any style you choose. john ordered goat madras. first time john ever had goat. melts in your mouth ! ! you are missing out. eat here immediately !  !  !

new india gate, kary, this is by far the best indian cuisine in town ! kary do not  normally write reviews but kary just had to praise new india gate because of the excellent customer service new india gate provide as well as the magnificent food ! kary's favorite dishes are the fish vindaloo with a side of garlic naan and the chicken masala  any of new india gate's dishes are awesome and you wo not  be disappointed

new india gate, glenn, new india gate is my girlfriend and glenn  go - to restaurant. everything is incredible  and made from scratch. the family who runs new india gate is so nice  as well. it  been too long since glenn have  been here; glenn m definitely coming back in the next few days ! the roti and naan are incredible  and the buffet is such a great deal.

new india gate, cetin, this is cetin's second coming to new india gate. first time cetin came on a weekday. on weekends the menu is richer. the only thing cetin personally did not like ; pork and chicken are placed close to each other. if anyone gets pork pork might drop into chicken while carrying the service spoon. quality is good. hospitality is good. the custard is awesome. cetin was told that the custard is available only on weekends. new india gate is a family run restaurant and all are dedicated to quality.

new india gate, abi, new india gate is incredible ! not only was the food delicious and fresh  but the staff were so friendly. every single person was smiling and said hello to our table. abi felt like abi were invited into a family home for dinner rather than a run of the mill restaurant. the young man  owner  son who was there told us all the ingredients are sourced fresh and locally  and that all the ingredients are all family recipes. abi hate when people say that and you can taste a disgusting frozen  month old mess. not the case at all here; everything was tried tasted like everything was tried was made on the spot. abi had the chicken tika masala  lamb vindaloo samosas a delicious indian beer  kingfisher   and the best damn pistachio dessert abi have ever had. abi highly recommend giving new india gate a shot; abi hope new india gate stay in business for years to come.
new india gate, lindsey, lindsey absolutely love new india gate. the brothers who own new india gate are so friendly  and the food is wonderful. definitely a hidden gem that lindsey love eating at !

new india gate, l, new india gate has great food and crazy amazing service. new india gate  clean  delicious  and the excellent staff here is very welcoming and attentive. the hot chai tea is a must - have  thank you for encouraging us to try the hot chai tea. the tikka masala and garlic naan were delish.

new india gate, travis, had a really nice dinner. very friendly and the food was really good ! travis would  go back ! travis wish the naan was a bit bigger but travis was still full and could not  finish the naan. travis was not disappointed with new india gate !

new india gate, megan, hello new favorite indian food restaurant ! yum. ordered take out here during lunch. young man answering the phone  owner   was really polite and helpful. came to pickup the order and found new favorite indian food restaurant. all of the employees were super nice. megan did have a bit of a long wait for the order but people kept checking on megan and megan did not  really mind waiting. the food was really tasty ! you can specify the spice level  which megan appreciated. megan had medium spice  which was just right for someone who is kind of a spice wimp but still wants a little kick. the naan was delicious  as was the saag paneer. will definitely be back for the customer service  cleanliness  and delicious food ! might just dine in next time with the takeout wait time though ...

new india gate, andrew, pretty good chicken tikka masala ! the wife and andrew both enjoyed pretty good chicken tikka masala ! andrew both ordered pretty good chicken tikka masala ! mild andrew will  probably step up to medium next time because the mild is not spicy at all  but the mild still has a good flavor. the naan was hit and fresh and the rice was perfect. andrew will  be back !
new india gate, scott, scott think new india gate is great ! you have to ask them to put more food up on he buffet line because it is  so good it goes fast ! love new india gate

new india gate, carrie, so good ! the tamarind and mint chutney that came with the appetizer were delicious  full of flavor. our garlic naan was not  greasy and was perfectly balanced as to not overpower our food. carrie had the chicken vindaloo which carrie will gladly eat again. carrie's boyfriend had the chicken saag also delicious  smooth and creamy. the service was great too. carrie sat next to what seemed like a difficult table and the server owner handled them with such grace offering suggestions and detailed explanations. the server owner even looked at another restaurant  menu that the customer pulled up to show carrie what would be similar on the customer's menu. the server owner was very friendly to us as well. carrie wish them much success and will definitely be back.

new india gate, jersey, the servers were very friendly and attentive. the food was very good. jersey would recommend the vegetable biryani and chicken curry. also had lamb masala which was very tasty. chicken curry medium spice and had just the right bite. jersey tried new india gate based on the other recommendations. prices were about normal. only annoying thing was the alarm on the front door which every time some opened the front door  the alarm on the front door would announce front door open. just annoying when you are having a conversation. otherwise very good.
new india gate, holly, favorite indian in the area. been several times  always a fantastic meal. service and food are amazing !

new india gate, mercedes, new india gate is amazing ! where do mercedes begin the decor is simple but very clean and as soon as mercedes walked in mercedes were greeted and seated. mercedes encountered three waiters and every single one was super nice and three waiters answered any questions mercedes had. this was mercedes's first time eating indian food and mercedes am a fan. mercedes's husband had the chicken masala spice level   and mercedes had a shrimp dish  mercedes can not  remember the exact name  spice level  . mercedes each ordered a side of basmati rice and garlic naan. everything was absolutley delicious and not too spicy. mercedes ended the meal with the deep fried cheese dessert which was amazing. when you come across a place like new india gate you want to tell everyone ! there is a shortage of places to eat where not only is the service excellent  but the food is as well. they do not  get all of these amazing ratings for nothing so go check them out ! mercedes can not  wait to go back !
new india gate, katie, new india gate is so good and reasonably priced. the service is excellent and food delish !

new india gate, terri, first time having indian food in the valley. staff is friendly and attentive. food quality was fresh and delicious. one the owners took time to make sure everything was satisfactory for our visit. definately a place to try. terri will be back. our taste buds are very happy.

new india gate, saransh, the food was okaish in the bufet. some things were good but definitely not worth a   star experience. mango lassi n curry was good. deserts kinda disappointed saransh ! pakora n chutney was great ! food was worth the price  just made it in !

new india gate, anthony, anthony really like new india gate  ! the food is always good and the staff is awesome ! you can not  beat the lunch buffet and anthony can walk there. anytime anthony m craving indian food anthony go here to get anthony's fix !

new india gate, michael, new india gate has excellent ownership ! they spend time talking to you as a customer. the food for a buffet rocks. yummy ! try the goat. the sauce are delicious. desserts bliss. not overpriced. great food !  !

new india gate, husna, my husband and husna found new india gate on yelp while visiting az. the service here was amazing. husna have never seen such wonderful service at any other indian restaurant. both of the brothers went out of both of the brothers's way to make sure my husband and husna's drinks were refilled and food was good. on service.

new india gate, barb, new india gate was our first indian restaurant  and our waiter was very patient while barb were asking about which foods our waiter recommended. the food was great  and the service was excellent. barb highly recommend new india gate to anyone looking for a great meal.
new india gate, mark, the food was absolutely delicious  and the service was the friendliest mark have  seen in a long time. mark will  definitely be going back for more !

shalimar foods, sheek, shalimar foods  sheek highly recommend the the burrito -  style chicken in naan meal. actually   meal  is an understatement. sheek would  be surprised if most anyone could finish the the burrito -  style chicken in naan meal on their own. better to share the the burrito -  style chicken in naan meal. the biryani are quite plentiful and tasty as well. thumbs up for the mango lassi ! there is not too much sitting room or an available restroom  so be prepared for some fabulous food and a hand wash at the end. if you are a fan of indian food you must try shalimar foods. sheek m betting you will  keep going back. the owner is very friendly and humble and will give you proper recommendations for your palate.

shalimar foods, karthik, if you are in a mood for some real good and fresh sub continental food shalimar foods is the place to be. not a place known for its ambience. shalimar foods has just four booths but dont be mistaken with the looks of shalimar foods. the owner is a really nice person who has a passion of cooking and making sure the owner's customers leave happy. the food is prepared fresh and the food will surely satisfy both your taste buds and hunger pangs.

shalimar foods, babjee, a guy who boasted so much in a local community news edition  served chicken nuggets when asked for chicken pakora and added little bit of spices to chicken pakora. babjee wondered when chicken pakora become a chicken nugget and become a part of indian cuisine. the food is only so so  even though liked customer service  shalimar foods should correct these blunders. babjee expect shalimar foods to say babjee do not  have chicken pakora at this time rather than selling an indian chicken nugget.

shalimar foods, mary, shalimar foods is a great little restaurant and the prices are very reasonable. mary have gotten addicted and seem to end up here about once a week. shalimar foods is a little hard to find since shalimar foods does not  have a big sign  but just look for the thai place next door. the food is awesome. every time mary go mary try something different. mary have not  gone wrong yet. try the shashi paneer and the aloo gobi. the shashi paneer and the aloo gobi are both the best mary have had. the breads are also great. service is very courteous and everything is cooked to order. on the downside the menu is limited and the menu is a true hole in the wall. everything is very clean but it is the opposite of fancy. food is served in to go containers with plastic utensils. if you are picky about ambiance  get it to go.

shalimar foods, j, it is important to realize that different restaurants are meant for different occasions. also  j look for value for money where value can be in the form of a delicious meal  ambiance  or personal service. j go to shalimar foods for a hearty meal and personal service. indian food can be from different regions and therefore can contain different ingredients  heat levels  and flavors. shalimar foods primarily serves north indian food with tastes that can only be found in roadside restaurants in india. food is  in other words  on the spicier and slightly greasier than what one would typically find in the valley. the owner can customize heat levels though. j have tried different dishes but one of j's favorites remains chicken curry. unlike many other places  meat is tender  flavorful  and often oven baked. curry does not contain cream which is a big plus in j's book. chicken tandoori oven - baked chicken  is j's another favorite. chicken is moist and  unlike many other places  not rubbery. everything is made to order so be prepared to wait. a typical yelp snob like j would typically take off one star for lack of distinct and pleasant ambiance but then shalimar foods is not the place to go with your date or a romantic evening. shalimar foods is the place where you can go with alone or with a group of friends and have a delicious meal.

shalimar foods, eric, tl;dr : great food  great value  but the interior is nothing fancy. came by for lunch right after shalimar foods opened and the owner cooked everything from scratch for us and you could tell how fresh it was. food  -  delicious. got chicken biryani    . on promotion ! ! and eric's girlfriend got chicken tandoori. both delicious  fresh  and full of flavor. the garlic naan was very fresh and some of the best eric have  had. value  -  amazing deal. two drinks and both large and filling entrees for only    . with tax. the owner gave us the garlic naan for free because eric had a bit of a long wait and because it was our first time. was not  really sure if eric was supposed to tip and the owner did not  mention it so eric forgot but next time eric definitely will to make up for it. and because the food was so good. atmosphere appearance  - so this is why eric took a star off. eric loved shalimar foods because shalimar foods was so authentic but shalimar foods is quite small with   small booths likely from another restaurant. very basic and sort of the definition of a hole in the wall. but eric like places like shalimar foods because the food is usually very delicious and authentic  the food was . just do not  expect anything fancy and you will  love it ! the owner is very friendly too if not slightly hard to understand. summary :  if all you want is good indian food at a good price shalimar foods is the place to go. just expect the bare minimum in amenities and potentially a long wait if it is busy because eric think the owner does nearly everything the owner right now.

shalimar foods, richard, do not  be put off by the look of shalimar foods  shalimar foods is  very basic. expect paper plates and plastic cutlery but the food is great and cooked fresh by the owner. richard went there for lunch and the owner was very welcoming and even invited us into the kitchen to watch the owner cook. ingredients were very fresh and flavor was very authentic. naan was outstanding. if you are  looking for good indian food shalimar foods is a good experience if you want something different than standard curry houses.
shalimar foods, phil, not bad. great customer service. the goat curry was delicious. phil can see myself coming back for more ! reasonable prices too.

shalimar foods, chuck, tried shalimar foods for the first time last night due to positive reviews on yelp. chuck were not  disappointed. chuck ordered chicken tikka masala and chicken tikka. chuck are those rare people who actually do not  like spicy food but love indian as long as indian is  cooked very mild. so chuck always order super  super mild. it had no heat at all so chuck nailed it on the first attempt  which almost never happens for chuck. the flavor was amazing. the sauce had an incredibly fresh taste brimming with intense flavors and fresh herbs  so much so chuck could not  get enough. the sauce not exactly the taste chuck remember from chuck's days in california but unlike other indian restaurants that fall short at imitating the taste shalimar foods was just so amazingly unique in taste that chuck would  put shalimar foods on par with the best chuck have  had  just uniquely different. since chuck's favorite indian place in az closed  india  grill chuck have  been disappointed over and over trying to find another place. shalimar foods will be chuck's new favorite. just be aware shalimar foods is  really only good for takeout. as others noted  shalimar foods is  so tiny and not really outfitted for dine in. also  shalimar foods is  really hard to find because shalimar foods is  so tiny. the storefront is only about    feet wide and shalimar foods is  tucked between a chinese restaurant and a nail salon. chuck drove by twice and did not  spot shalimar foods; the owner had to talk chuck to shalimar foods ! and as other  have noted  it is  truly the owner and one other person cooking everything from scratch so it takes longer  over    minutes from the time chuck ordered . but there is  something really quaint about the whole experience; it is  like you are  visiting the owner and one other person's home and the owner and one other person are  whipping up some home cooking back in the kitchen. oh  and as noted  prices are very good. generally about     less than chuck m accustomed to paying.

shalimar foods, venkatesh, the food was just wow.. venkatesh took party order for a friend and the food was fabulous. everyone loved the food. of course  the owner is a gentleman and makes sure you are welcomed. if venkatesh am throwing a party  venkatesh will be getting food from shalimar. cant wait to go there again.
