bikaner sweets & restaurant, jessica, jessica am definitely not a connoisseur of indian sweets but it does not  take an expert to know that the sweet baked goods at bikaner sweets & restaurant are great ! the first time jessica drove by jessica was intrigued by the name; the next time jessica decided to stop in. as you enter bikaner sweets & restaurant you pass through the sweet shop where amazing indian treats are sold by weight. jessica have no idea what jessica tried  one was a sweet  spongey cake - like thing that was white on one end and light brown on the other ; jessica also tried a more dense white square with pistachios on top but they were incredible ! jessica have  also brought out - of - town guests to bikaner sweets & restaurant to sample the sweet baked goods at bikaner sweets house and restaurant and out - of - town guests agree with jessica -  the sweet baked goods at bikaner sweets house and restaurant is  all absolutely delicious ! the staff there are always so nice to jessica and jessica never feel like the staff there are  judging jessica because jessica do not  know the different sweets. jessica will definitely return in the future to try bikaner sweets & restaurant -  if the food is half as good as bikaner sweets & restaurant's sweets it will be worth it !

bikaner sweets & restaurant, tiffany, surprise ! tiffany are  eating here ! tiffany thought tiffany were just stopping here to pick up some sweets but tiffany m glad to finally check bikaner sweets & restaurant off of tiffany's bookmarks. bikaner sweets & restaurant is not  exactly close to where tiffany live and it is  pretty safe to say that it is  worth the trip. the pindi chana was delicious  as was the afghani pulao  even though tiffany really dislike dried fruits in tiffany's food . minus one star because the server kept forgetting our drinks. the server  but very forgetful. then  when tiffany were paying for our food it took tiffany forever to get to the till. then  when picking up sweets it took someone five minutes to show up at the counter. tiffany were the only people in bikaner sweets & restaurant so tiffany worry how service would be if it was a busy night. vegetarians be wary; chicken is listed among the  vegetarian  dishes. tiffany was not  completely worried about this  because tiffany's friend vishnu considers my friend vishnu a vegetarian  even though my friend vishnu eats fish; chicken and lamb. lots of ethnic restaurants assume that when you say you do not  eat meat you mean you do not  eat beef and or pork. the servers are careful though  so do not  be afraid to ask questions. be assured that what you will get will be delicious  :  .

bikaner sweets & restaurant, serena, excellent indian food. serena was told by a friend  in the know  to eat here tonight for an early dinner. the buffet was    . which seemed expensive but wow. great food. every bite of every thing was so exquisite. the first plate of food serena took was literally polished off. serena ate every single thing on the first plate of food serena took. second plate almost the same and thinking back to the few bites serena left behind... serena wish serena had the few bites serena left behind now. bikaner sweets & restaurant was described to me as a  hole in the wall  but bikaner sweets & restaurant was spacious and had a charm about bikaner sweets & restaurant that was nice. serena asked about the chefs since the food was so outstanding. the chefs are  trained in india and there are three : one for the tandoor meats and naan  one for curries and vegetarian and the other something fantastic that serena forget now because you see  serena am now experiencing a lovely food coma  remembering the butter chicken  rice and tender spice battered fish. the dessert and chutneys were so good too. so glad serena went.

bikaner sweets & restaurant, mia, mia came allll the way from the sw up to bikaner sweets & restaurant for a sangeet  ladies party for indian women getting married  mia cant comment on the cost  and since bikaner sweets & restaurant was crazy busy with ladies all over the place and bikaner sweets & restaurant was buffet style the service seemed as quick as the service could be  trying to dodge all the women  while picking up plates and refilling waters. the food was amazing !  !  ! butter chicken was to die for. not too tomato - ey the sauce is a little more thin than miam used to but the taste more than made up for it. from the naan to the pakora to the peas pulao..everything was perfectly cooked and moist. mia actually would travel the distance again to go back and try more of their food.

bikaner sweets & restaurant, pouria, pouria had been searching and craving for good indian food for about   years and pouria finally found some in bikaner sweets & restaurant ! it  not the best indian food pouria have  had in pouria's life but it is  as good as you can get in calgary. pouria ordered two portions and almost finished two portions ! the chicken vindaloo was amazing and the biryani rice was pretty good too. the naan was not too bad either. the appetizer veg pakora was just too good as well. there is a whole lot more on that menu that pouria have to try...

bikaner sweets & restaurant, kelly, the food here is really good. kelly drive from the south just to come here to eat. the only thing kelly am not a fan of is that the service is not very good. bikaner sweets & restaurant are very friendly but a little slow to take your order and to see how things are at the end of your meal. another thing is it seems that bikaner sweets & restaurant's cooks change often and you get a different dish each time it is still amazing but not consistent. kelly still love bikaner sweets & restaurant's food though

bikaner sweets & restaurant, nadine, my partner and nadine came in for the dinner buffet on a sunday. no special weekend pricing unlike most indian buffets  -  it seems to be     per person for dinner every day  surprisingly cheap for a non - vegetarian buffet . nadine loved everything ! the butter paneer was probably my partner and nadine's favourite  but the butter chicken was definitely up there. though the dinner buffet was not  very busy  fresh food was brought out more often than nadine have  seen at any other buffet. the host    was pleasant and helped my partner and nadine to identify what everything was. nadine will definitely be back. edit :  came back on a thursday night and had a slightly different experience. the food was not  super fresh  but certainly still edible. the butter chicken was completely different than the one nadine had on a sunday  -  the butter chicken tasted  to me  like the butter chicken was just cooked in a can of tomato soup. the butter paneer was still very good. the dessert  vermicelli kheer  tasted like plain milk with some noodles thrown in  and the jalebi was quite soggy. nadine were the only people there and noticed that bikaner sweets & restaurant closed up right after nadine left  though it was just after   :    pm so maybe bikaner sweets & restaurant were just having an off day. the service was fine  and the man who was very helpful last time the gesture my partner and nadine fresh naan which was unfortunately quite burnt  though nadine appreciated the gesture . the pakora were still amazing  -  among the best nadine have  had. nadine previously gave five stars  but nadine have  revised my rating to   due to the apparent decrease in food quality on weekdays.

bikaner sweets & restaurant, pouria, pouria wrote a flattering review of bikaner sweets & restaurant in late     . pouria was so excited and amazed by the food here. bikaner sweets & restaurant had a small menu with really tasty food. everything was impressive and the pakoras were the best pouria would  ever had. so pouria got a chance to come back a few weeks ago. a small menu with really tasty food had changed  a small menu with really tasty food is  freaking huge now. bikaner sweets & restaurant added pouria's all time favorite  tandoori chicken. so pouria ordered my all time favorite  tandoori chicken and my all time favorite  tandoori chicken was utterly disappointing. my all time favorite  tandoori chicken was among the worst pouria have  had in pouria's life. pouria could swear my all time favorite  tandoori chicken had nothing in my all time favorite  tandoori chicken except food coloring and maybe a little salt. pouria tasted the lamb curry and something else pouria do not  remember and there was nothing special about any of the food here. pouria's conclusion is bikaner sweets & restaurant either have a new chef or s he just gave up on cooking.

bikaner sweets & restaurant, ryan, came in for a quick lunch the food was pretty good although a couple of the trays were empty and never replenished during our visit  about    mins. . being from the toronto area ryan have definitely been to better indian buffets but the price was right. one thing that was really surprising was that there was this constant beeping noise in bikaner sweets & restaurant that never went away  this constant beeping noise in the restaurant that never went away would go off every    seconds or so. nobody seemed interested in doing anything about this constant beeping noise in the restaurant that never went away but this constant beeping noise in the restaurant that never went away was quite annoying to listen to for that long.

bikaner sweets & restaurant, rand, best indian food in the city ! !  !  !  !           a friend suggested bikaner sweets & restaurant to me a while ago  but rand did not  check bikaner sweets & restaurant out until about a couple months ago when rand found myself in the ne part of the city. bikaner sweets & restaurant is the kind of place that you could drive by and never really pay attention to  -  bikaner sweets & restaurant is  quite unassuming from the exterior. but as soon as you step in  you are  greeted by friendly servers  who might take a second glance and instantly acknowledge that you do not  live in the ne part of calgary . in a nutshell  bikaner sweets & restaurant is the best indian rand have  had in the city. bikaner sweets & restaurant is also ridiculously cheap  which does not  hurt either ; the interior is very spacious  with a full bar and open dancefloor rand think   which is available for event bookings. safe to say my friends and rand have become regulars here  for both the delicious buffet  at   . you can not  go wrong  and dinner service. rand usually order the butter chicken and goat curry with basmati rice and garlic naan bread all of which are cooked and spiced to perfection by the entertaining staff at bikaner sweets & restaurant. bikaner sweets & restaurant is a hidden gem in the city and you will  be coming back time and time again   -  or in my case  three times in ten days  :

bikaner sweets & restaurant, sapna, sapna visited bikaner sweets & restaurant today for the first time and sapna gotta say  sapna was very impressed ! sapna tried bikaner sweets & restaurant's lunch buffet and their lunch buffet was good ! the food was excellent  the space is decent and the service was good. their lunch buffet runs   days a week from    : am  -   pm and it is  only   .   ! plus on tuesdays it is  only   .   ! what a steal ! the only reason bikaner sweets & restaurant lost a star is because sapna was disappointed that bikaner sweets & restaurant did not  have milai kofta in bikaner sweets & restaurant's buffet. the selection was a bit limited   but what bikaner sweets & restaurant did have was excellent. oh and take my word for it  -  the gulab jamuns are the best gulab jamuns sapna have ever had. bikaner sweets & restaurant is definitely a hot spot  -  check bikaner sweets & restaurant out fo sure !

bikaner sweets & restaurant, ammar, ooh ! the flavors. yes ammar am starting ammar's review with this. if you have eaten foods in the streets of india  or have gone to the dhabas on the highways in india you are going to relive that in your mouth. bikaner sweets & restaurant is an unconventional restaurant bikaner sweets & restaurant has sweet shop on the front and restaurant inside. bikaner sweets & restaurant has nice dining setup. ammar went in for dinner and bikaner sweets & restaurant turned out to have a dinner buffet. ammar was craving for good veggies and here good veggies were laid in front of ammar along with chutneys  pickles and sauces. aloo gobhi  potato and cauliflower   sitaphal pumpkin dal  were all so authentic and homelike that a morsel in the mouth and a morsel in the mouth could just melt your heart. oh ! the flavors  the spices just right. the naans were nicely done and crisp. to top it the dessert  jalebis and gulab jamun were among the best ammar have had in north america. they can work on their entrance though.

bikaner sweets & restaurant, vishnu, seems like bikaner sweets & restaurant was not  really heard much around. vishnu had an invitation today for lunch from a friend  and then vishnu understood that bikaner sweets & restaurant serve food as well. from the outer picture of bikaner sweets & restaurant it does not  seem like there are some awesome hidden food treasures inside  : p .. after having food  vishnu just thought how did vishnu miss bikaner sweets & restaurant. bikaner sweets & restaurant was big enough to handle our group of    people. spacious !  ! vishnu did not  really have a chance to drill through the menu as it was already decided to go for a buffet. bikaner sweets & restaurant had chilli chicken butter chicken  tandoori chicken lamb curry fish fry shahi panneer  panneer tikka dal bhindi fry indian okra   fruits chat  similar to salsa dessert gilebi gulab jamoon sweets  and few other salads  yogurt with onion etc. vishnu do not  think there was beef and pork. bikaner sweets & restaurant had saffron rice and naan  papadum too.. the best one that could steal me was chilli chicken. stuffed up my stomach with chilli chicken as much as possible as if vishnu might not find that taste again. shahi panneer  fish fry panneer tikka were equally good. fruits were fresh and tasty. good bollywood music. service was good too. and the whole bunch is just for  .   !  ! a great deal.. and from past two years there was not much increment in the price too but what made me to rate the price was due to few shortfalls. tandoori chicken was not at all good. restroom was just one for both men and women and once you enter through one door there will be two doors w o any symbols or signs on one door. fortunately the third door had exit on the third door. so now it is  your hit or miss with the rest two. overall -  a must try place. value and taste for money. really worth it.

samosa factory, emily, emily have  had my eye on samosa factory for some time  but finally got around to trying samosa factory last night when our first choice for dinner was closed for the holiday. emily entered the small dining area and were greeted by the incredibly friendly server. emily told the incredibly friendly server emily wanted to order our food to - go and the incredibly friendly server still offered us two glasses of water and a starter to nibble on while emily perused the menu. emily settled on the lamb vindaloo and the chicken tikka masala. emily also ordered some garlic naan. our server was incredibly personable and offered us refills on our water while emily waited as well as made some idle chit chat with us. once our food arrived  emily paid our bill and off emily went with our food. the incredibly friendly server also offered us a to - go menu for our return visit. great customer service ! my fella and emily dug into my fella and emily's meal as soon as emily got home. the spice level was just right. emily ordered the medium spice level to be on the safe side on our first visit. some garlic naan was delicious and emily really enjoyed the rice. the flavors were right on and emily look forward to a return visit to hopefully eat in samosa factory and try some of samosa factory's samosa. the food is not cheap  but emily did not  feel the food was overly expensive for the quantity and quality of food emily got. definitely a great indian option in a town that is lacking.

samosa factory, sue, sue love samosa factory ! sue drive from centennial hills just to get some amazing food from samosa factory. everything is amazing.. butter chicken and malai kofta korma vegetarian  are some of sue's favorites... do not  forget your veggie samosa or the mango lassi. amazing. the food is always so fresh and perfect each time ! the owner is also super friendly and samosa factory have excellent service ! make a point to visit samosa factory and get some yummy food  :

samosa factory, tomeca, this was my first time trying indian food tomeca loved it ! tomeca can not  wait to go back and try more things ! the service was great as well ! tomeca would definatly recommend this to anyone who is trying for the first time  -  great experience !

samosa factory, jenna, jenna was visiting from philly and wanted delicious indian food for lunch. upon doing a google search  samosa factory was the only place with excellent reviews so jenna tried samosa factory for jenna. jenna was not disappointed ! the guy who served jenna was so pleasant. the food came out in a short amount of time. jenna ordered a vegetarian dish with naan and iced chai. the flavors was so amazing ! jenna loved that samosa factory give you just one heaping scoop of rice because jenna do not  like too much of just one heaping scoop of rice. could only eat half jenna's meal so jenna was given a container for the food and a little bag for naan and bonus :  a to go cup for jenna's iced chai ! jenna found that to be very thoughtful. samosa factory is not  a big place but the decor is nice and warm. jenna wanted to go back before leaving but never got the chance. jenna highly recommend samosa factory !

samosa factory, amber, amber have  been hearing good things about samosa factory for years  but had yet to make it over there until tonight. samosa factory does not  look like much from the outside  but samosa factory is  really cozy cute inside. the tables   chairs leave a bit to be desired  but samosa factory really did a lot with the decor to improve the ambiance. amber ordered chicken vindaloo   hot sour chicken  which were both good. chicken vindaloo was awesome really spicy   delicious. the hot   sour chicken was good but all the sesame seeds in the sauce were a bit much for amber texture - wise. amber also had a hot chai  which was perfect. the owner came by and talked to us  asking us what amber thought of samosa factory and how amber would  heard of samosa factory. the owner was really nice and made amber feel very welcome and appreciated as a new customer. also  they were playing great music. right after finishing amber's meal  while sipping on amber's tea amber's favorite amber's morning jacket song came on  -  it was a really nice moment.

samosa factory, paul, paul have eaten here regularly for quite some time. the food is consistently delicious. paul's favorite dish is the lamb curry lunch w  garlic naan and iced tea. all their dishes are extremely good. and the owner is really nice. paul often take friends and family when friends and family visit from out of town  and friends and family are always impressed ! paul think samosa factory is a best kept secret in las vegas  :  -

samosa factory, linda, the food was delicious. linda enjoyed every item linda ordered  chicken tikka  malai kofta korma  tandoori chicken  and the garlic naan . but the service was horrible and made linda  linda's children  and linda's guests not want to come back. both she and linda's waiter was overly aggressive. first our waiter constantly pushed both she and linda to make an order and when linda made one our waiter kept pushing for both she and linda to get an appetizer  even when linda calmly declined. when linda did get both she and linda's food our waiter served our food and sat on the side a little bit back at one of the tables on our waiter's phone. when linda were done linda paid the bill and left. as linda were outside putting both she and linda's four children into the car  ages six and below our waiter came outside and angrily began to yell at both she and linda for not leaving a tip. our waiter continued to yell at both she and linda about the  kind of people linda were  to come to a  full service  restaurant without bringing enough for a tip. linda's children were upset and confused as well as linda's friends child. both she and linda left quickly to avoid any more of this behavior in front of both she and linda's kids. linda were completely embarrassed by our waiter  actions. the reason linda did not  leave a tip is irrelevant. our waiter never should have reacted in that manner  especially to both she and linda and both she and linda's four little kids. unacceptable. so in conclusion  five stars for the food but zero stars for the service. if you do go be sure to bring tip money or beware.

samosa factory, p, p's friend and p decided to try out another indian restaurant and came to samosa factory. p's friend ordered my friend usual and p tried something new. p's dish was quite okay  nothing to brag about. p's friend  chicken dish my friend said my friend  chicken dish was okay as well. the garlic naan bread the garlic naan bread tasted a little bland. p have  had better at another restaurant. p's friend and p enjoyed the samosa the samosa was tasty. the samosa was like a filipino empanada but indian style. will my friend and p be going back here  will see.

samosa factory, nathan, nathan have  been to several of the more popular indian restaurants in vegas  and this is by far nathan's favourite ! samosa are always fresh and flavourful  with a nice mix of subtle spices that is well - complimented by a selection of chutneys ! hot  crispy perfection ! the lamb korma is pure curry heaven  too. the boneless lamb is always tender and super - tasty  with creamy sauce over fresh garlic naan and aromatic basmati rice. is your mouth watering yet then get off the internet and into your car. head down to samosa factory for the best indian food vegas has to offer right now ! ! :  -

samosa factory, jake, jake tried samosa factory a few years ago and was disappointed jake decided to give samosa factory a try one more time this week. the first time jake showed up during this week at  pm and samosa factory were closed. the next day jake decided to show up for lunch and jake knew jake would be cutting it close to the   :    lunch closing. jake tried calling from my car at   : but jake only got the answering machine. jake walked in at   :    and was told samosa factory were closed. jake was a little steamed. jake was told samosa factory shut off the phones at   :   . jake said  really . so jake showed up today saturday no lunch specials so jake order the full chicken curry entree. talk about a disappointment. a clump of plain white rice and a bowl of brown soup with a couple of chunks of chicken. the full chicken curry entree was like maybe one leg. the sauce was bland. jake will go to the strip to tambla  or mantra masala. never ever going here again.

samosa factory, aaron, went to samosa factory with a dear friend for lunch. aaron was greeted by the staff and aaron were ushered to a dear friend's usual table by the window. the server was courteous and attentive. unfortunately  the fare was not as commendable. aaron ordered the lamb curry    . lunch special; a hot chai tea    . ; and vegetable chaat samosa    .   . vegetable chaat samosa arrived first  a heaping plate of green chutney creamy yogurt  and innumerable other colors and flavors. vegetable chaat samosa was just okay. try the chaat at mount everest down the road to see what real chaat should taste like. a hot chai tea arrived after. a hot chai tea a hot chai tea was so disappointing. it is impossible to find good chai in las vegas. does not taste like indian chai tea. next the lamb curry arrived with a heaping scoop of jasmine rice. the lamb curry was bland and unenjoyable. aaron's friend enjoyed a dear friend's chicken tikka masala and naan. aaron tried naan and naan was hot and fresh  though a bit thin and crispy. there are too many excellent indian food options in las vegas to return to samosa factory.

samosa factory, karen, very friendly service and lovely food. karen got the garlic naan  lamb curry  okra  and paneer mahkni. sauce were tasty and all was delicious. the rice pudding with blueberry topping was divine. karen m lactose intolerant and ate nearly everything karen. holy cow. yeah no kidding  the  best rice pudding in the world. karen concur. difficult to locate samosa factory if you do not  know where to look. samosa factory  in the strip mall directly west of the panda express on sahara. the exterior is not  anything to write home about  but the interior is tastefully decorated and smells wonderful. karen want more rice pudding !  !

samosa factory, tiffanie, my go to place for indian food in vegas. samosa factory  one of those best kept secrets for indian food for vegas in my opinion. samosa factory a casual ambiance place with great food that is  reasonably priced. tiffanie always get samosa factory's naan bread and paneer. tiffanie love it here also for samosa factory's great vegetarian options ! love samosa factory.

samosa factory, mykul, a friend recommended the restaurant. do not  let the name fool you. mykul found the interior upscale. the staff was very friendly  even when mykul sent the iced tea back. mykul hate chai tea. mykul had the butter chicken which was out of this world. for dessert the rice pudding  fantastic. the rice pudding had cinnamon and fresh blueberries on the rice pudding. mykul's friend had the coconut chicken which mykul tried also. hard to choose between the two which mykul liked more.

samosa factory, sarah, really  really  really cannot say enough about how much sarah love samosa factory ! the best indian food sarah have had in las vegas by far ! if you are new to indian food and want something different but tasty sarah can always recommend the lamb korma the lamb korma is  perfect ! with a side of garlic nan some samosas  of course   and mango lassi this is sarah's favorite dinner. if sarah was on death row  sarah may very well pick samosa factory for sarah's last meal. samosa factory's restaurant is tiny  but sarah like samosa factory ! samosa factory does not  feel overly crowded but actually cozy. sarah really can not  say enough good things about samosa factory.

samosa factory, misti, wait  am misti in new york city seriously  something about samosa factory reminds misti of a little indian spot you might find in manhattan. samosa factory is small  dark and moody with a portishead soundtrack and a waiter who so professional you assume he must be going to graduate school for philosophy or something. add to the mix the trippy ganesha cartoon being projected on the window  and you are  definitely half way to manhattan. it  a cool sensation  and perhaps one that can only be experienced at a later evening hour. the best part :  unlike manhattan it is  easy to park ! go vegas. as for the food  misti rarely go out for indian dinner because misti find it hard to go without the cornucopia offered by a lunch buffet  which they do not offer . last night  though  misti decided on indian for dinner and this was close. misti ended up spending      which seemed expensive  but misti got three entrees when misti would have been okay with two. the average entree is    . misti had baigan bartha  paneer makhani and daal makhaani. misti requested a medium spice  and a medium spice was on the lower edge of spicy. of the three dishes  paneer makhani was the absolute best  the perfect balance of tomato and cream and without a trace of grease. they definitely pride themselves on cooking fresh and healthy. misti would not order daal makhaani again. daal makhaani is usually misti's favorite indian dish but this is the second time misti have had daal makhaani here. both times misti have walked away thinking daal makhaani tasted like a not so great chili. however  baigan was solid. misti misti went with roti instead of naan  and misti really enjoyed roti. the menu has plenty for meat eaters vegetarians and vegans  and misti am pretty sure they can help gluten - free eaters as well. the combination of experience and food quality adds up to an indian spot worth trying.

samosa factory, chrisene-faye, one of the best indian restaurants in town ! one of the best indian restaurants in town ! do serve the best rice pudding. reasonable prices. chrisene-faye usually order the chicken tikka masala or the lamb korma. great quality food. one of the best indian restaurants in town ! 's sauce are rich and creamy. chrisene-faye think each entree is good for   people  depending on how hungry you are  but chrisene-faye have  always been stuffed sharing an entree . small restaurant  but great service.
samosa factory, kirk, kirk love samosa factory ! kirk eat there every other weekend. garlic naan is to die for. the food is excellent and so is the service.

samosa factory, molly, went here yesterday for lunch. it was ok. if you like samosas samosas were good here. other than samosas molly have  had better indian food. samosa factory have plenty of vegetarian and vegan entrees though  so if you are  vegan or have a friend who is then molly would reccomend samosa factory  but tamba and ghandi are better. samosa factory is pretty small too so dont go with a big group. also samosa factory was full of white people i m white too but thats kind of a giveaway that samosa factory's not as authentic as other places because molly did not see one indian eating there...

samosa factory, michele, michele love samosa factory. while the service is sometimes a little on the slow side when they are busy  the food is always hot and fresh and delicious. the lunch specials are a real deal  but the other regular menu offerings are also great  and michele encourage you to venture off the lunch menu and try something different. the saag paneer is always delicious  the curries are great  and the naan -  -  the perfect accompaniment to sop up the juice from whatever you have chosen to order. michele also love how the owner always welcomes michele back  and if the owner has not seen michele in a while gently chides michele for it and encourages michele back. try samosa factory for wonderful indian food and you wo not  be disappointed !

samosa factory, raj, ok place for groups  not that super for couples or singles. why would not  samosa factory offer a samosa with the thali platter  check samosa factory's name why not offer a better thali combo option papadum   dessert samosa in the thali   found the thali to be a bit pricey for what the thali offers.

samosa factory, holly, samosa factory is called samosa factory for a reason. the samosa are amazing ! the samosa come with a tasty cilantro chutney and a tamarind chutney. per order and the samosa are a very good size. really worth the   . -   . price. samosa factory also have some unique items  such as masala fries covered in cilantro  onions  and come with a bbq - cilantro - ginger sauce. very tasty. holly have  never been impressed with samosa factory's curries. a little bland for holly's taste. but samosa factory do have a lot of vegan options  which is nice. staff has always been friendly. great place !

samosa factory, jesse, when it comes to ethnic cuisine samosa factory is a real winner. samosa factory is a regular spot for my coworkers and jesse to meet for lunch and go over territory info. the samosa are great and the entrees are authentic. check samosa factory out.

samosa factory, mark, a hit and a miss. mark went here looking at the reviews and were disappointed. do not  get me wrong  if you are  new to indian food  like many reviewers here seem to be  you will  probably like indian food. unfortunately for samosa fake - tory mark have  had our share of good indian food and samosa factory is not  it. first off  to the uninitiated  samosas look and taste nothing like the one you find here. mark mean not even close ! google samosas and you will see what samosas look like. after our samosas  mark ordered the thalis sort of an indian mixed plate  and the naan  fluffy  delicious indian bread  was great. mark did not  like the saag  mustard leaf but my so did. neither of us liked the chicken curry or the potatoes and cauliflower. contrary to popular claim the rice was not  basmati. you can not  ever go wrong with mango lassi  mango flavored yogurt drink  and mango lassi mango flavored yogurt drink probably was the best part of our meal. in summary  our food was okay but the alien samosa was a massive fail. if you have  never had a samosa please do yourself a favor and grab one from an authentic indian restaurant. you will not regret it. may mark recommend gandhi  on paradise road or tamba on the strip for the most authentic and best indian food in town positives -  the service was good. our server  who mark think is also the owner  seemed like a genuinely nice guy.

samosa factory, kitty, husband  and kitty ordered beef samosa  chicken tikki marsala lamb curry  garlic naan  and dessert samosa. the food was delicious. kitty enjoyed the food very much. the service was great and our server was very friendly and attentive. kitty will definitely be back for more. the only negative kitty have was that when kitty asked for a straw kitty was handed a cup full of unwrapped straws and asked to pick one. kitty cringe at the thought of how many dirty  unwashed hands have touched unwrapped straws. ew.

samosa factory, tony, tony bought groupons as tony were sitting at samosa factory  excited for the deal. then tony loaded up on orders to our max. unfortunately there is only one groupon allowed per table says the owner with a stick up the owner's butt. this was tony's first time at samosa factory and the owner served tony. the owner stuck to the owner's guns and would not budge on letting tony use   groupons  even though the owner openly admitted to being able to make an exception. tony will not go again and definitely not recommending to anyone. food was not  even very good. no spices and pop that you grow accustomed to in a good indian dish. the owner looks like he  from ohio not bombay. revised tony think it is  completely unprofessional that the owner complains about not getting a tip when the owner was a dick to tony. how about learning some customer service before entering in the retail food industry. much better indian restaurants in vegas by far !  ! try much better indian restaurants in vegas by far ! for tasty  authentic indian food and unconditionally friendly service :    . the mint  -  flamingo and maryland  . mount everest  -  sahara and arville  . india masala  -  flamingo and swenson  . india palace  -  twain and paradise tony will never go back to samosa factory and urge you not to patron samosa factory. some people are not suited to be in front of customers. rick  the owner here  believes the customer is always wrong. not the way to win repeat or new business.
samosa factory, leza, leza love samosa factory. the food is fantastic. the owner rick is very personable and makes it pleasant to eat here. leza wish leza could eat here   days per week.

samosa factory, joe, the food was not  disgusting or  bad  per se but its a crime to call the food indian food. samosa factory feels like a white guys poor attempt at indian food and  can best be described as food made by hipsters for hipsters. joe's first clue should have  been the name  samosa factory but joe do not  judge on initial appearances. the second clue was the balding white guy wearing clam diggers  a red flannel shirt and a wool cap in august...but alas it was too late... joe had already called in joe's order. joe ordered the fairly basic dish of chicken tikka masala  as joe always do at these types of restaurants  because if you can not  even do that right there is  no sense in venturing onto the  real  indian cuisine. everyone does chicken tikka masala their own way but what joe received was more like an insultingly bland almost flavorless butter chicken. the garlic naan tasted like a thick  rubbery  cilantro covered tortilla. joe do not  mean to talk sh t but joe have  honestly had better indian food at mall food courts. for the exact same price you can receive twice the portions of the fairly basic dish of chicken tikka masala  and joe m assuming most  if not all  other menu items  made properly at shalimar on s. decatur in the food less parking lot.

samosa factory, t, my husband and t went to samosa factory for lunch t went there right when samosa factory opened. t am a big fan of butter chicken  and butter chickens what t wanted but they said they are out of butter chicken how can they be out of butter chicken when they just opened for lunch  . of course  this got me very irritated. anyway  t ended up ordering chicken curry  chicken curry was not  that satisfying  t have  had better . the service was good. samosa factory is very small. overall  t would give samosa factory a another shot.

samosa factory, mark, mark have  never been let down at samosa factory  in fact mark now make samosa factory a weekly stop. as others have said  service is great and the owner is a great guy. my weekly meal is chicken samosas and lamb vindaloo hot the garlic naan is amazing also.

samosa factory, wayne, great tasting and healthy indian ! well  supposedly healthy because they said they do not  use ghee. ghee =  = gross pure fat. but the food was definitely delicious !  !  !  ! and reasonably priced  too ! will definitely be going back when craving some hot n  spicy indian food...

chatpatay, elaina, stumbled upon chatpatay after driving around trying to figure out what elaina wanted for lunch and figured elaina would  just settle for a jersey mike  sub. saw chatpatay was new and figured elaina would  give it a go. so glad elaina did ! service was friendly and food was delicious. elaina ordered the baingan bharta. the baingan bharta is elaina's favorite indian dish and elaina m picky about the baingan bharta elaina feel like the baingan bharta is  a dish that when done right is amazing  but elaina have  had some disappointing versions at other restaurants   the baingan bharta was perfect ! elaina m happy to have a good indian restaurant in town !

chatpatay, rob, chatpatay is a terrific  casual indian restaurant that is rob's favorite place to go for indian food in the charlotte metro  though rob love what copper and the blue taj do when it comes to upscale indian indian fusion rob have  been to chatpatay on about five different occasions now; the food is consistent in the food's quality rob have  never once felt like anything has been phoned in. for people who do not  eat spicy food on a regular basis  there are definitely items that you can get that will be safe  but be aware that the biryanis  the bullet naan  such a great name  such a great bread  and other items will light.you.up. service can be slightly standoffish depending on who  working the register  but the owner gm is invested in the success of the owner gm's restaurant s and you feel it when the owner gm rings up your order or when you talk to the owner gm. plenty of items here are delicious  and the menu is pretty sizable   but rob have a particular fondness right now for the dal makhani. chatpatay offer thalis and lunch specials  but other than thalis it is all a la carte. when people ask rob where to go for indian food in the area chatpatay is the place rob point to every time; even though chatpatay is     minutes down rob -     from rob's neck of the woods it is  always worth the drive.
chatpatay, ary, the best indian food ary have  had in charlotte ! and the service was very attentive despite the service being  fast casual . loved the service !

chatpatay, nisha, from the moment nisha walked in  nisha was greeted with a warm and welcome smile. you sit down wherever you want and a gentleman brings you a menu. then you go to the front counter and place your order. the lady taking your order is very sweet as well ! nisha ordered a samosa chat  mango lassi  paratha pav bhaji  and chicken korma. you can choose your spice level just like any other indian place. the lady taking the order repeated your order and confirmed our spice level to make sure it was what nisha wanted. while nisha were eating the food the lady taking the order did check on us and asked if nisha needed anything. the service is quick in comparison to a full fledged restaurant and the food is delicious !  ! the pav bhaji is decent but the chicken itself was fork tender and chicken korma was silky  buttery  and scrumptious !  ! note : if you are a uncc student you get     off if you bring your student id and show your student id to the kind lady at checkout. definitely recommend chatpatay !  !

chatpatay, a, definitely give this place a try if you are in the area. a have been looking for an go - to indian restaurant in the area and this place is an go - to indian restaurant in the area. service was amazing. the most friendly service that a have received at an indian restaurant. food was delicious. ordered this place's spiced naan and butter roti their spiced naan and butter roti  both were fresh and so reasonably priced with generous portions. also got a chicken curry and potato kofta which were both flavorful and just spicy enough. this place is a casual eatery so this place is  kid friendly. you order at the counter and the food is brought out to you. will be coming back for sure to try out the rest of this place's extensive menu. do not  miss out !

chatpatay, swatee, to say chatpatay was disappointing in an under statement. swatee can not  believe chatpatay serve the food chatpatay serve and still stay open ! swatee visited chatpatay  while taking a break from our road trip and were famished when swatee got here. it was thanksgiving day  so not much open and very few people inside. first of all  swatee m confused about whether chatpatay is self service or not. someone greeted us at the door and seated us  gave us menus. to place an order  you have to walk up to the counter. chatpatay bring the dishes to you. you need to grab your own utensils. chatpatay expect you to place dirty dishes in a far corner yourself. just extremely confusing and annoying. swatee have nothing against self service  -  in fact self service is  awesome and efficient  but this weird process made no sense. anyways -  the food. swatee started wit the mango chat. the mango chat was made with old papris and was over over sauced. swatee would be okay with that  -  if th sauce tasted good. th sauce did not  -  way too much heeng and terrible flavor. lily wanted to paneer -  paneer tasted of nothing  had a weird red color and the texture of rubber. swatee actually were not able to get through more than   pieces collectively. swatee also had the garlic naan. swatee think you should be punished for screwing up something as simple as garlic naan and they totally did not -  too much garlic and uncooked sides  ugh. swatee had the gobhi parantha and again  -  how you screw up something so simple  swatee do not  understand. the gobhi parantha was uncooked in placed and swatee could taste the raw dough. the filling tasted of nothing and there was not   enough of the filling. the gobhi parantha was also slathered with way too much oil  butter rags loves chicken  -  he did not  like chatpatay's version of chicken tikka. everything tasted stale and disgusting. as much as swatee hate food waste  swatee ended up trashing about     of the food swatee ordered and left chatpatay hungry still. never coming back and never recommending chatpatay again.

chatpatay, feleisha, feleisha love chatpatay. great food but casual and fast. chatpatay are very helpful with suggestions if you do not  know what to order. everything feleisha have tried has been enjoyable. this trip feleisha had the goan curry chicken with garlic naan and the goan curry chicken with garlic naan was amazing.
chatpatay, richard, chatpatay    food is good and staff super helpful. full recommendations   typical of indian places chatpatay is  not warm and fuzzy but you can always order togo

chatpatay, jan, jan have been coming to chatpatay and love the food. chatpatay not only have a large menu on street snacks  indo - chinese but also offer north - indian curries to finish up with indian desserts and various choices of tea coffee. the service is fast even in rush hours  and chatpatay cater to the point at your requested spice level. jan are very happy that chatpatay opened up closer to home. meet ravi the owner will guide you through the menu if you are new to indian cuisine.

chatpatay, kevin, dangerously situated on kevin's way home from work chatpatay will likely become an at least weekly stop for dinner. kevin m no expert on indian food but kevin feel this is a great selection of indian food. kevin wish kevin had the stomach capacity and spice tolerance to try everything on the menu. kevin tried some paneer    to start and kevin easily could have eaten some paneer for a main course. some paneer was delicious and kevin m all about the spices used. kevin got chicken biryani  kevin's girlfriend got malai kofta  and kevin split some garlic naan. everything came out quick  in large portions  and beautifully presented. the staff was helpful with our clear lack of knowledge about indian food and the owner even stopped by to make sure everything was good. kevin highly recommend chatpatay; kevin know kevin m looking forward to the mountain of leftovers in the refrigerator right now.

chatpatay, cynthia, amazing food. cynthia ordered samosa  chicken vindaloo and bullet naan. the samosa was out of this world. fresh and flavorful. the sauce were incredible. ravi the owner  was helpful in picking out the dishes. cynthia asked for samosa  chicken vindaloo. cynthia will  just say samosa  chicken vindaloo was amazing. samosa chicken vindaloo was so tender samosa  chicken vindaloo fell apart. and bullet naan  cynthia would  never had bullet naan before  bullet naan was buttery and bursting with flavor. everything was outstanding. cynthia would  love to see chatpatay stick around for a long time so cynthia can order and eat everything on the menu !

chatpatay, ravi, ravi have a feeling that chatpatay will become ravi's favorite indian restaurant. the food was just incredible the ambience is nice  and staff was very friendly. the menu is huge. ravi am so happy chatpatay opened in north charlotte. chatpatay was much needed. ravi would highly recommend everyone try chatpatay  !  !

chatpatay, zarina, zarina really like chatpatay. food is amazing and flavor is exactly what zarina want. chatpatay will make thing actually spicy which zarina love but chatpatay can also make thing more mild if needed. chicken    is zarina's favorite.

chatpatay, akshatha, tried chatpatay for the first time  !  ! very disappointed must say !  ! ordered chicken    and gobi manchurian  chicken    and gobi manchurian were terrible as chicken was over cooked and super chewy and gobi manchurian was under cooked and tasting like flour will not be going back  !  !

chatpatay, tarun, tarun m new to charlotte and made tarun's first friend here in bharat at chatpatay ! every single person tarun have  interacted with here  including ravi  the owner  is super - friendly and go out of every single person tarun have  interacted with here  including ravi  the owner's way to make sure you are  having a good time. every single person tarun have  interacted with here  including ravi  the owner actively seek feedback as well  on any aspect of your experience  and do not get all defensive about the constructive pieces  which is refreshing to see. as for the food  every entree chaat that tarun have  tried here takes tarun's taste buds back home to delhi  although tarun did learn that the chef is from mumbai ! the food every entree chaat that tarun have  tried here is definitely rich  and very flavorful. while tarun have had a couple of misses  tarun would highly recommend the samosa  mango papdi chaat  chhole bhature chicken methi  and saag chicken yes these guys put it together for us once !  . now it does feel somewhat pricey  but tarun m not sure that is  unique to these guys. tarun m starting to get used to shelling a little more for tarun's meals here in charlotte !

chatpatay, devon, phenomenal food ! big fan of the other location on the south side of town  the other location on the south side of town  this new location definitely lives up to expectations. staff are always super friendly and helpful with the large menu. quality and variety makes the other location on the south side of town  this new location a family favorite for sure. there are even chicken fingers for the boring eaters !

chatpatay, brian, brian m no expert on indian food so brian can not  comment on how authentic chatpatay is  but brian also do not  really care. chatpatay  absolutely delicious !  ! brian tried the chicken     garlic naan  and samosas and all were the best versions brian have tried of the chicken     garlic naan  and samosas

chatpatay, tabrez, chatpatay is one of the best indian street food restaurant tabrez have been. chatpatay's chats  pani puris chicken tikka biryani are amazing. will keep going there more often and updating tabrez's post with more photograph. chatpatay's quality of  food and pricing is very good too. tabrez recommend everyone to try chatpatay out

chatpatay, catrice, the taste of this food is truly amazing !  ! the experience was awesome just from walking through the front door and being greeted by a very warm and  friendly staff. a very warm and  friendly staff were very helpful with choosing what you want to eat. the price is great and the portions are good. catrice will come here every time for indian food.

chatpatay, denise, so chatpatay was a new place denise had not tried and denise love indian food. the food was good quality the set up denise did not like so much. denise do not  want to wait on denise when denise go out. but denise must say that the gobi manchurian and bullet naan would make denise come back. the gobi was crisp fried and in a delicious sauce with green onions and red onions. a very nice size portion. bullet naan was one of the spiciest denise have had in nc. denise loved bullet naan. denise did miss not getting a chutney or condiment tray. denise did have a great waitress  denise's sister who was right next to the plates and silver ware and water. try it !

chatpatay, aleeza, aleeza's partner and aleeza were craving some indian food. unfortunately  there were no good places near the concord mills area so aleeza drove a little out of the way to make sure aleeza filled my partner and aleeza's fix. chatpatay does not  look like much but the staff and owner were so nice ! the staff and owner told my partner and aleeza the staff and owner's favorites and what the staff and owner's customers like. aleeza took all of the staff and owner's advice with no regrets  except maybe on aleeza's wallet . aleeza got the mango papdi chaat plain   gobi paratha    indian sodas lamb biryani  and chicken tikka masala. chatpatay was reasonably priced  but aleeza definitely was not  expecting to get so many things. aleeza are  a sucker for trying new things. the mango papdi chaat was good  -  refreshing with a surprising amount of heat. indian sodas were good too  -  very slightly spiced though aleeza do not  know how to quite describe indian sodas. plain   gobi paratha was a +  crispy and buttery. plain   gobi paratha went very well with aleeza's partner  chicken tikka masala  which was so rich and tasty  with exceptionally moist chicken. lamb biryani was good as well. good spices  big pieces of lamb  and just so so good with the raita. the only thing aleeza would not  order again is the gobi paratha. the gobi paratha was a little dry  but aleeza could tell chatpatay's parathas are more authentic than other places -  chatpatay definitely use whole wheat flour  not using enriched bleached flour for american tastes. the owner stopped by to talk with my partner and aleeza a couple times and ensure the food was good. aleeza was very happy with the food and service. aleeza liked that chatpatay was casual in that you get your own silverware and water. it  worth the detour to ensure you get solid indian food.

chatpatay, pankaj, looking for quick indian snacks and rightly found so... dahi sev puri is amazing... mango papri chat on recommendation by owner ravi gera was  very tasty as well. malai panner sizzler was well marinated and soft tender and cooked to perfection.. pankaj will be back soon again to try out more stuff
chatpatay, ankush, the food is great. ankush ordered the thali with chicken and goat curry. the pickles were tasty. the dessert was also tasty. they provided a great service.

chatpatay, sam, chatpatay have old monk ! been wanting to try chatpatay for a while now as sam am a huge fan of the pineville location. the interior is similar but the menu has some slight differences. you also do not order at the counter like you do in pineville which sam actually like better. what sam did not like better was the food. our gobi manchurian had not been fried long enough and our gobi manchurian was a bit on the soggy side. sam requested spicy and our gobi manchurian was more like a medium. sam's rogan josh was good but again  my rogan josh was just missing the spice kick that sam get at pineville. the staff was friendly and sam hope the staff make it but for sam  sam will  stick with ravi in pineville. hey at least chatpatay have old monk !

chatpatay, trippy, so this is trippy's new favorite spots. it is  a culture trip. gtfo out of your dorm. lightrail here and enjoy the experience politely. with respect. anyway. trippy tried to rip. they did not  accept. trippy respect that. their workers are treated w respect so do the same. the food the food is  literally so amazing. trippy will be living here until trippy move in sept. chatpatay is new to the area so show their workers some love ! it is  a nice time ! clean up after yourself ! like you pick up your own dishes. duh u do not  tip. xxo. if trippy get like    likes on this. dinner on chatpatay

chatpatay, trupti, such a cute place  after a stop to ikea. the food was incredibly delicious  hit the right spot. a very casual dining experience all things trupti ordered were spiced right. the service was great and friendly  overall with food and service definitely a worth a place to repeat. the menu is so creative  if you are a bollywood fan you will love the way menu is written.

chatpatay, sophia, sophia recently had chatpatay's saag shrimp and naan. their saag shrimp and naan was delicious. the staff was very friendly. sophia definitely recommend trying the food there sophia will be back soon.

chatpatay, amisha, try the mango papdi chat. amisha really loved the mango papdi chat. rest of food was also good. dabeli can be worked upon a little. people are friendly and welcoming and restaurant is clean
chatpatay, i, great service and even greater food ! i got the saag chicken and fell in love. i also got an order of samosas and samosas were also delicious !

chatpatay, monica, what a great experience ! the food is excellent and freshly prepared. the restaurant is set up so that you place your order at the register and they give you a number and they bring your food out to you. the staff is extremely friendly and helpful with any questions that you may have about the menu. monica will certainly be back. the restaurant will be our go to for indian cuisine. the restaurant have only been opened for months. give the restaurant a try !  ! you wo not  be disappointed.

chatpatay, hanna, chatpatay are super great ! hanna have been looking for a good chicken korma all over charlotte and this is the best ! hanna love the casual atmosphere and chatpatay are very helpful if you do not  know what you would want. chatpatay have convinced me other dishes to try and hanna have never been disappointed. the naan is amazing as well. would recommend to anybody wanting to try indian food or for people already fans. just be aware that you get your own water and plates and such  order at the counter you can look at the menu at a table first ! and chatpatay bring the food out to you. it doesnt bother me at all but something to be aware of !

chatpatay, halle, came by chatpatay on our way home and stopped in. it was such a warm atmosphere from the time halle walked into the door. halle got our menus and sat down to figure out what halle wanted. the cashier helped us determine good things to get based off what halle knew halle were comfortable with. after the food was brought to us... my goodness ! the colors are so rich and beautiful. aroma is amazing. and your first bite is heaven. get the samosa to start !  !  ! only appetizer halle have  had but only appetizer halle have  had is  amazing. food was piping hot and tasted amazing. and halle like that even when you order spicy there is  so much flavor versus it being so hot that you just cry chatpatay will be our new evening spot for indian and the price is well worth it. yumm

chatpatay, shraddha, the food is good. but there is no one to wait tables because it is a fast - food setting. for everything to be self service  starting from bringing our own plates  silverware  water  and also throwing away our own dirty dishes  shraddha would have expected the price of the food to be lower and not the same as every place that does offer waiter services. shraddha will  go back for the food but just for takeout and not dine - in.
chatpatay, fred, great and full flavored food. the owner is super nice and friendly. fred will definitely be back. the green sauce with the lamb is spectacular.

chatpatay, kelsey, have not  tried much indian food in the university area but chatpatay was awesome ! our waiter who is also the manager was very friendly and had some great suggestions. the food was fresh and very yummy. kelsey recommend the tikka masala  chicken biryani and garlic naan.
chatpatay, natalie, delicious and good prices. my meal was huge and tasted very authentic. the service was excellent as well. natalie will definitely be back !  !

chatpatay, nirman, went there to have some indian street foods. papadi chat was delicious with chill yogurt and spices. so was choley bhaturey. surprised to that they have momos too. it was fine  but  momos chutney was too good.

chatpatay, anthony, excellent food and service. the butter naan and garlic naan bread was very good. anthony got the chicken masala and the chicken masala was perfect chatpatay have an extensive menu with a lot of choices. anthony will definitely be back.
chatpatay, gauri, really enjoyed the variety of food chatpatay served. the food and service was great. would come back and recommend others to try the food and service if you havent !  !

chatpatay, kijana, this is some of the best india food kijana have  ever had. the men who worked here where also so nice and hospitable. chatpatay was clean and kijana loved the chill environment. kijana am definitely coming again soon.
chatpatay, gauri, really enjoyed the variety of food chatpatay served. the food and service was great. would come back and recommend others to try the food and service if you havent !  !

royal ganesha, patricia, patricia really enjoyed royal ganesha. the service was amazing and the food was some of the best patricia have  had. patricia also had my   year daughter and our server was super sweet with my   year daughter and gave my   year daughter's rice pudding and a little gift. patricia highly recommend royal ganesha to everyone.

royal ganesha, tammy, tammy love royal ganesha ! royal ganesha  in a unique space with good parking nearby  plus royal ganesha is  close to kensington and the train so it is  vey easy to get to. our office staff often goes for the lunch buffet and the food is excellent. the service is even better however - tammy absolutely love that royal ganesha tell us what each dish is about  where each dish comes from in india  and what ingredients are in each dish. in addition  the staff are thoughtful and kind  and very friendly ! check it out -  you wo not  be disappointed !

royal ganesha, crystal, went here with friends in search of good indian for dinner. it was so good and convenient to get to from the hotel. the lamb korma was delicious with enough spice to make the lamb korma interesting. personally  crystal could have had a bit more spice but when trying a new place  and not knowing the spice levels  crystal tend to be a bit conservative. next time  crystal will  up the ante ! definitely worth it  and crystal would go back for more. if crystal lived in calgary  crystal could see crystal becoming a regular patron ! the service was great and menu suggestions were spot on !

royal ganesha, roger, was here about two weeks ago  and in going back in an hour... the food was amazing ! the host owner manager was most accommodating and super friendly. the atmosphere is also very indian and quite lovely. roger highly recommend royal ganesha.

royal ganesha, eswina, royal ganesha is housed in the house that used to be anju on st. s.w. being part of the calgary opera chorus for lakme eswina had a   hour dinner break between afternoon and evening rehearsals on a saturday night. they do not  normally do dinner buffets but when eswina explained eswina had    people wanting east indian food  lakme  lakme  is set in   th century india under british rule they very obligingly agreed to have one just for us. eswina took over the main floor of the restaurant. service was excellent. the food was decent and eswina highly recommend the onion bhajia onion fritters  and chicken pakora. eswina had butter chicken  beef curry  vegetable korma  dal makhani and vegetable biriyani as well as salad  papadam and a chutney  butter naan and rice and rice pudding for    .  . the curry and butter chicken was a little on the watery side but the flavours were good the sauce could have been thicker. a selection of house wines could be had for   . per glass. parking is on the street. the restaurant is a small place so definitely reservations are recommended on the weekend. a chutney  butter naan is scrumptious  crisply baked in the tandoori and still soft and pliable to dip in the sauce. the restaurant have one of the best rice puddings eswina have  tasted  not too sweet or overly scented with cardamom.
royal ganesha, shauna, ordered online. the prices were good  and it was classic indian food. there were plenty of vegetarian options. shauna would order from there again.

royal ganesha, emily, great portions for the price. mango lassi was great. service is friendly. odd policy of paying before the meal. they have  probably had a bunch of people skip out on the bill  so understandable. butter chicken was more like  delicious  tomato chicken. beef samosa was really yummy. emily got butter chicken  rice  naan and could have fed three. will come back.

royal ganesha, dinah, are you ready calgary    dinah live on the same block as the infamous anju and much to dinah's disappointment dinah noticed that the infamous anju were closing down. in the weeks to follow dinah started seeing movement in the infamous anju only to see another restaurant was going to take the infamous anju. much to dinah's delight another restaurant was indian food. the day that royal ganesha opened royal ganesha's doors to the public  some friends and dinah were there with huge bells on ! royal ganesha offers a very affordable lunch buffet at  . for meat and  . for vegetarian. but get there fast because only two weeks after opening royal ganesha's doors royal ganesha already has line ups !  !  ! dinah have been an avid foodie and have written many yelp restuarant reviews as you can see and dinah honestly can say that this is the best indian food dinah have ever had in calgary. the dishes change daily and the dishes use the most freshest ingrediants. the choices are vast  lamb  beef  spinach chicken lentil   chickpea and the mango lassos are to die for. the nicest thing is the family that own royal ganesha are very very nice and hardworking folks and go out of thier way to make you feel very welcome. there are only    -    tables open for now but as soon as the upstairs opens up you can bet that royal ganesha will be packed to the rim. thier curries have extra flavour and the rice pudding is superb.. not too sweet and sprinkled with chopped pistacios and nuts with a delicious hint of cardamon. dinah highly recommend royal ganesha ! you work during the day .. do not  despair royal ganesha are also open for dinner....

royal ganesha, chris, food was excellent. very fresh and the naan bread was outstanding. service was great  very friendly people. just moved to the area and chris know chris will be regular customers.
